sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: Isehlakalo sokwanda okusheshayo kwesifo se-coronavirus (I-COVID-19) ku-European Union/European Economic Area nase-United Kingdom, ngo-1 January ukuya ku-15 March 2020
en-mt: Rapid outbreak of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: Isehlakalo esandayo sezimo zesifo se-coronavirus (i-COVID-19) sibonisa amathrendi afanayo emazweni e-European Union/European Economic Area kanye nase-United Kingdom okuqinisekisa ukuthi, nakuba isezigabeni ezihlukene kuye ngezwe, ubhubhane lwe-COVID-19 luqhubekela phambili ngokushesha kuwo wonke amazwe.
en-mt: The increasing incidence of cases of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) shows similar trends in the countries of the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom which confirms that, although at different stages depending on the country, the epidemic of COVID-19 is rapidly progressing all countries.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: Ngokusekelwe kokuhlangenwe nakho kwase-Italy, amazwe, izibhedlela namayunithi okunakekela abasesimweni esibucayi kufanele andise ukulungela ukwamukela iziguli eziningi eziphethwe i-COVID-19 ezizodinga ukunakekelwa kwezempilo, futhi ikakhulukazi ukunakekela abanesimo esibucayi.
en-mt: Based on the Italian experience, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their readiness to receive more patients suffering from COVID-19 who will need medical care, and especially critical care.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Ngo-31 December 2019, iqembu labantu abanezimo zenyumoniya ene-aetiology engaziwa labikwa e-Wuhan, e-Hubei Province, e-China.
en-mt: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown etiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Ngo-9 January 2020, i-China Center for Disease Control and Prevention yabika ukuthi i-ejenti eyimbangela i-coronavirus entsha manje ebizwa ngokuthi i-severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported that the causative agent is a new coronavirus now called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Kusukela ngaleso sikhathi, ukugula okuwumphumela wesifo se-SARS-CoV-2 kuye kwaqanjwa ngesifo se-coronavirus (I-COVID-19).
en-mt: Since then, the illness resulting from the SARS-CoV-2 disease has been named the coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: Ubufakazi obukhona kuze kube manje bubonisa ukuthi u-80% wabantu abaphethwe i-COVID-19 baphethwe isifo esingasho lutho, okungukuthi isifo somgudu wokuphefumula esihambisana noma esingahambisani nenyumoniya, futhi iningi laba bantu liyalulama.
en-mt: The evidence available so far shows that 80% of people who contract COVID-19 have a mild illness, that is, a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these people recover.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: Ezimweni ezingu-14%, i-COVID-19 iyathuthuka ibe isifo esibucayi kakhulu esidinga ukuthi ulaliswe esibhedlela kuyilapho u-6% wezimo ezisele ubhekana nesifo esibucayi esidinga ukunakekelwa kwesimo esibucayi.
en-mt: In 14% of cases, COVID-19 develops into a more serious illness that requires hospitalization while the remaining 6% of cases experience a more serious illness that requires intensive care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: Ukufa kweziguli ezilaliswe ngenxa ye-COVID-19 kungu-4%.
en-mt: The inpatient mortality rate for COVID-19 is 4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Kulolu cwaningo, sihlola amathrendi esehlakalo esandayo se-COVID-19 ezweni ngalinye le-European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) kanye ne-United Kingdom (UK) futhi siwaqhathanise nalawo ase-Hubei Province, e-China.
en-mt: In this study, we examine trends in the incidence of COVID-19 in each country of the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to those in Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: Siphinde futhi siqhathanise inani lamanje labantu abane-COVID-19 emazweni ase-EU/EEA nase-UK nalelo lase-Italy phakathi no-31 January–15 March 2020.
en-mt: We also compare the current number of people with COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that of Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Izimo ze-COVID-19 emazweni e-EU/EEA nase-UK
en-mt: COVID-19 situation in EU/EEA countries and the UK

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: Ngemva kwe-China, i-COVID-19 yasakazeka kabanzi ngokwezindawo futhi ukushintsha kobhubhane lwe-COVID-19 emhlabeni wonke okwamanje kulandela lokho okwenzeka kuleli zwe.
en-mt: After China, the COVID-19 spread widely geographically and the current evolution of the global COVID-19 pandemic follows what happened in this country.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: Ngo-11 March 2020, Umqondisi Jikelele we-World Health Organization (I-WHO) wamemezela ukuthi i-COVID-19 iwubhubhane.
en-mt: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared that COVID-19 is a pandemic.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: Ijenali yango-5 March ye-Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. yabika ngabantu bokuqala abaqinisekisiwe abane-COVID-19 e-Europe ezivumelana nencazelo ye-WHO.
en-mt: Journal of 5 March of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported the first confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Europe that fit the WHO definition.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: E-EU/EEA, abantu bokuqala abaqinisekisiwe babikwa yi-France ngo-24 January 2020 kubantu ababuya e-Wuhan, e-Hubei Province, e-China.
en-mt: In the EU/EEA, the first confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in people returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-15 March 2020, abantu abane-COVID-19 base betholiwe kuwo wonke amazwe angu-30 e-EU/EEA kanye nase-United Kingdom (UK), okungukuthi phakathi kuka-31 December 2019 nalolo suku, kwase kubikwe abantu abangu-39,768 abanaleli gciwane kanye nabantu abafile abangu-1,727, kulokhu abantu abangu-17,750 abanaleli gciwane kanye nabangu-1,441 abasebefile babengabase-Italy kuphela.
en-mt: On 15 March 2020, people with COVID-19 had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), i.e. between 31 December 2019 and that date, there had been reported 39,768 infected people and 1,727 dead people, of which 17,750 infected people and 1,441 dead people were only from Italy.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: Ukuthola inombolo eyandayo neyesehlakalo esandayo sezimo ze-COVID-19
en-mt: Finding an increasing number and increasing incidence of COVID-19 cases

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: E-European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (I-ECDC), izibalo zabantu abane-COVID-19 ezweni ngalinye emhlabeni wonke, ezitholwa ngemithombo esemthethweni kuphela efana Nomnyango Wezempilo wezwe ngalinye, amagunya ezempilo kazwelonke nawesifunda kanye ne-WHO, zibuyekezwa osukwini ngalunye ngo-8:00 a.m.
en-mt: At the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the number of people with COVID-19 in each country around the world, obtained only from official sources such as the Ministry of Health of each country, national and regional health authorities and WHO, is updated each day by -8:00 a.m

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: Le datha yasetshenziswa ekuhlaziyeni amathrendi e-COVID-19 e-EU/EEA nase-UK, futhi aqhathaniswa nalawo ase-Italy.
en-mt: These data were used to analyze the trends of COVID-19 in the EU/EEA and the UK, and were compared with those in Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Njengesimeleli sokuvama kwezimo ze-COVID-19 eziqhubekayo, sibale isehlakalo esandayo esinqanyuliwe sezinsuku ezingu-14 zezimo ze-COVID-19, ngaleyo ndlela sicabangela ukuqhubeka okungokwemvelo kwe-COVID-19, ezweni ngalinye le-EU/EEA nase-UK, phakathi nenkathi ka-1 January–15 March 2020.
en-mt: As a proxy for the frequency of ongoing COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural progression of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, over the period of -1 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Siphinde sathula inombolo eyandayo yezimo ezibikiwe zezwe ngalinye ngo-15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. uma kuqhathaniswa nase-Italy ngenkathi ka-31 January–15 March 2020.
en-mt: We also presented the increasing number of reported cases for each country on 15 March 2020 8:00 am compared to Italy for the period 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Amathrendi e-COVID-19 emazweni ase-EU/EEA nase-UK
en-mt: COVID-19 trends in EU/EEA countries and the UK

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: Amathrendi esehlakalo esandayo esinqanyuliwe sezinsuku ezingu-14 zezimo ze-COVID-19 emazweni ase-EU/EEA nase-UK ngokuvamile alandele lawo ase-Hubei Province (China) (Umfanekiso 1).
en-mt: Trends in cumulative cumulative incidence of 14-day cases of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed those in Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Sekukonke e-EU/EEA nase-UK, isehlakalo esandayo se-COVID-19 saqala ukunyuka cishe ngo-21 February futhi sanyuka kakhulu ngo-28 February 2020 (Isithasiselo sokufundwayo).
en-mt: Overall in the EU/EEA and the UK, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and peaked on 28 February 2020 (Appendix study).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Lokhu kwandiswa kakhulu ukwanda okusheshayo kwenani lwezimo ezibikiwe ezisuka-Italy, kodwa wonke amanye amazwe ase-EU/EEA nase-UK abonisa amathrendi anyukayo afanayo esehlakalo esandayo se-COVID-19 (Isithasiselo sokufundwayo).
en-mt: This is greatly exacerbated by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK show similar upward trends in the incidence of COVID-19 (Appendix study).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Umfanekiso 2 ubonisa inani elandayo lezimo ze-COVID-19, emazweni ase-EU/EEA nase-UK uma kuqhathaniswa nalelo lase-Italy ngenkathi yango-31 January–15 March 2020.
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the increasing number of cases of COVID-19, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared to that of Italy in the period 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: Ligqamisa ukuthi, ngo-15 March 8:00 a.m., amanye amazwe angu-15 ase-EU/EEA kanye ne-UK ayesevele ebike ingqikithi yenani elingaqhathaniswa nalelo lase-Italy emavikini angu-3 ngaphambilini noma kancane.
en-mt: It highlights that, on 15 March 8:00 am, 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total amount comparable to that of Italy in the previous 3 weeks or less.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Imiphumela yethu ibonisa ukuthi inani lezimo ezibikiwe ze-COVID-19 linyuka ngokushesha e-EU/EEA nase-UK.
en-mt: Our results show that the number of reported cases of COVID-19 is increasing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: Amathrendi aphawuliwe kusehlakalo esandayo se-COVID-19 abonisa ukuthi ubhubhane luqhubeka ngejubane elifanayo kuwo wonke amazwe.
en-mt: The observed trends in the increasing incidence of COVID-19 indicate that the epidemic is progressing at the same pace in all countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: Lokhu kwenzeka naphezu kokuthi amazwe esezigabeni ezihlukene, ukuhlukahluka endleleni yokusabela kwezempilo yomphakathi kazwelonke, futhi cishe nezincazelo ezingafani zezimo emazweni kanye namaphrothokholi ahlukene okukhetha iziguli okufanele zihlolwe ukuze kuqinisekiswe i-COVID-19, okuhlanganisa nokuhlola kokulandelela.
en-mt: This is despite the fact that countries are at different stages, diversity in the national public health response, and probably different definitions of conditions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients to be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including follow-up tests.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: Ekuqaleni kuka-March 2020, odokotela ezifundeni ezithintekile zase-Italy bachaza isimo lapho u-10% weziguli eziphethwe i-COVID-19 zidinga ukunakekelwa kwezimo ezibucayi futhi imithombo yezindaba yabika ukuthi izibhedlela kanye namayunithi okunakekelwa okubucayi kulezi zifunda ayesefinyelele umthamo wawo ophakeme.
en-mt: At the beginning of March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation where 10% of patients suffering from COVID-19 required intensive care and the media reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had reached their maximum capacity.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: Idatha yokungeniswa kwabanezimo ze-COVID-19 esibhedlela kanye/noma iyunithi yokunakekelwa okubucayi iyatholakala esigabeni se-EU/EEA ezimweni ezingu-6% no-1% kuphela, ngokulandelana (idatha ayibonisiwe).
en-mt: Data on admissions of cases of COVID-19 to hospital and/or intensive care unit are available in the EU/EEA category for only 6% and 1% of cases, respectively (data not shown).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: Kufanele, nokho, iqoqwe ngendlela ehlelekile ukuze ihambelana nedatha yokuqapha yamanje egxila enanini lezimo ezibikiwe kanye nenani lokufa.
en-mt: It should, however, be systematically collected to match current surveillance data that focuses on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: Ucwaningo olwenziwa ngo-2010–11 lwabonisa ukuhluka okukhulu ngokuqondene nokutholakala kwemibhede yokunakekelwa okubucayi kanye neyokunakekelwa okumaphakathi e-Europe, kusuka ku-29.2 e-Germany kuye emibhedeni engu-4.2 emphakathini wabantu abangu-100,000 e-Portugal.
en-mt: A study carried out in 2010–11 showed great variation in the availability of acute and intermediate care beds in Europe, from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: Lokhu kusho ukuthi amazwe kungenzeka ukuthi anezinsiza eziningi noma ezincane kune-Italy (imibhede yokunakekelwa okubucayi engu-12.5 neyokunakekelwa okumaphakathi emphakathini wabantu abangu-100,000 ngo-2010–11).
en-mt: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 acute and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: Ukulingisa izimo ezihlobene nokugcwala komthamo wokunakekelwa kwezempilo, okunikeza isilinganiso sezwe ngalinye lase-EU/EEA nase-UK ngokuqondene nokwanda kwezimo zabalaliswe esibhedlela ngenxa ye-COVID-19 okuhlobene nengozi engu-> 90% yokweqa umthamo wemibhede yokunakekelwa okubucayi, kunikezwa kusibuyekezo sesithupha sokuhlolwa kwengozi esheshayo ye-ECDC ngokuqondene ne-COVID-19.
en-mt: Simulation of scenarios related to healthcare capacity overload, which provides an estimate for each EU/EEA country and the UK regarding the increase in hospitalizations due to COVID-19 associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding the capacity of critical care beds, is provided in the sixth update of the rapid risk assessment of ECDC regarding COVID-19.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: Njengoba izimo zinqwabelane ezifundeni ezithile emazweni ase-EU/EEA nase-UK, futhi izibhedlela namayunithi okunakekelwa okubucayi ngokuvamile kusiza abantu abathile besifunda, ulwazi olumayelana nezimo kanye nemibhede yokunakekelwa okubucayi kufanele kutholakale ezingeni le-Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (I-NUTS-2).
en-mt: As conditions are concentrated in certain regions in the EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units often serve a specific population in a region, information about conditions and intensive care beds should be available at the level of the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS- 2).

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Okuhlangenwe nakho kwase-Italy kanye namathrendi amanje akwamanye amazwe abonisa ukuthi ubhubhane lwe-COVID-19 lukhula ngokushesha e-EU/EEA nase-UK.
en-mt: The Italian experience and current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is growing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: Amazwe, izibhedlela namayunithi okunakekelwa okubucayi kufanele azilungiselele isimo sokuthelelana komphathi okuqhubekayo kwe-SARS-CoV-2 kanye nokwanda kweziguli eziphethwe i-COVID-19 edinga ukunakekelwa kwezokwelashwa, futhi ikakhulukazi ukunakekelwa okubucayi, njengalokho okwenzeka ezifundeni ezithintekile e-Italy.
en-mt: Countries, hospitals and critical care units must prepare for the situation of continued transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and the increase of patients suffering from COVID-19 requiring medical care, and especially critical care, as is happening in the affected regions in Italy.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: Njengoba kuboniswe ekuhloleni kwakamuva kwe-ECDC kwengozi esheshayo, indlela esheshayo, enomdlandla neningilizayo ibalulekile ukulibazisa ukusakazeka kwe-SARS-COV-2, ngokwenza ushintsho olusuka endleleni elawulayo luye endleleni enciphisayo, njengoba ukwanda okusheshayo okulindelwe kwenani lezimo kungase kunganikezi abenzi bezinqumo nezibhedlela isikhathi esanele sokuqonda, sokwamukela nokuvumelanisa ukusabela kwabo kube indlela efanele uma kungasetshenzisiwe kusanesikhathi.
en-mt: As shown in ECDC's recent assessment of the immediate risk, a quick, proactive and thorough approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, by making the transition from a control approach to a mitigation approach, since the expected rapid increase in the number of cases may not give decision makers and hospitals enough time to understand, to accept and adapt their reactions into the right way if not used early.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: Ukuhlola kwengozi esheshayo kuphinde kusho izinyathelo zempilo yomphakathi ukuze kulawulwe umthelela wobhubhane.
en-mt: Rapid risk assessment also implies public health measures to manage the impact of the epidemic.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: Kukhona intuba encane yethuba lapho amazwe engakwazi khona ukuba nethuba lokulawula ngokuqhubekayo imizamo yawo yokulawula ukuze kuncishiswe ukubhebhetheka SARS-CoV-2 futhi kuncishiswe ingcindezi ekunakekelweni kwezempilo.
en-mt: There is a small window of opportunity in which countries can have the opportunity to further control their control efforts to reduce the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and reduce the pressure on health care.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: Ukuhluleka kwalokhu, kungenzeka ukuthi amasistimu ezokwelashwa amanye amazwe ase-EU/EEA azobhekana nenqwaba yeziguli ezidinga ukunakekelwa kwezimo ezibucayi ezinsukwini ezizayo noma emavikini.
en-mt: Failing this, it is possible that the medical systems of other EU/EEA countries will be faced with a large number of patients requiring critical care in the coming days or weeks.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: Ukubhekuda kwesifo se-Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19), okubangelwe yi-severe acute respiratory syndrome (I-SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), okwamanje kubulale abantu abangaphezu kuka-3,000 futhi yaphatha abantu abangaphezu kuka-80,000 e-China nakwezinye izindawo emhlabeni, okuphumelele enhlekeleleni kubantu.
en-mt: The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) outbreak, caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has currently killed more than 3,000 people and infected more than 80,000 people in China and other places in the world, which succeeded in the disaster for the people.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: Ngokufana negciwane layo elifanayo, i-SARS-CoV, eyabangela i-SARS ezinkulungwaneni zabantu ngo-2003, i-SARS-CoV-2 ingase futhi idluliswe isuka kumalulwane futhi ibangele izimpawu ezifanayo ngendlela efanayo.
en-mt: Like its similar virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 can also be transmitted from bats and cause similar symptoms in the same way.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: Nokho, i-COVID-19 inobucayi obucayi kanye nezinga lokufa kune-SARS kodwa idluliseka kakhulu futhi iphatha abantu abadala abaningi kunetsha futhi abantu besilisa abaningi kunabantu besifazane.
en-mt: However, COVID-19 has a lower severity and death rate than SARS but is more transmissible and affects more adults than young people and more men than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: Njengendlela yokusabela enanini elikhula ngokushesha lokushicilelwe okumayelana nesifo esisafufusa, lesi sihloko sizama ukunikeza isibuyekezo esifike ngesikhathi nesiningilizayo esimayelana nesihloko socwaningo esithuthuka ngokushesha.
en-mt: As a response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of a rapidly evolving research topic.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: Sizodingida izinto eziyisisekelo ezimayelana ne-epidemiology, i-etiology, i-virology, ukuxilongwa, ukwelashwa, imbangela, nokuvinjwa kwesifo.
en-mt: We will discuss the basics of epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, causation, and prevention of disease.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: Nakuba imibuzo eminingi isadinga izimpendulo, sithemba ukuthi lesi sibuyekezo sisiza ekuqondweni nasekuqedweni kwesifo esisongelayo.
en-mt: Although many questions still need to be answered, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of this menacing disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: I-Spring Festival yango-January 25, 2020 isiphenduke inkumbulo engenakuqhathaniswa futhi engalibaleki kuwo wonke ama-Chinese akhuthazwa ukuthi ahlale ezindlini zawo ngeholide futhi emavikini amaningi ngemva kwalokho ngenxa yokubheduka kwesifo segciwane elisha.
en-mt: The Spring Festival of January 25, 2020 has become an incomparable and unforgettable memory for all Chinese who were encouraged to stay in their homes during the holiday and for weeks after due to the outbreak of the new virus.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: Igciwane lifana kakhulu ne-coronavirus (I-CoV) eyabangela ukubheduka kwe-severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) ngo-2003; ngenxa yalokho, laqanjwa ngokuthi i-SARS-CoV-2 yi-World Health Organization (WHO) ngo-February 11, 2020, futhi isifo esihlobene sabizwa ngokuthi i-CoV Disease-19 (I-COVID-19).
en-mt: The virus is very similar to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) outbreak in 2003; as a result, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the related disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: Umqedazwe waqala e-Wuhan, e-China, futhi wasakazeka ngokushesha ezweni lonke futhi nakwamanye acishe abe ngu-50 emhlabeni wonke.
en-mt: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread across the country and to nearly 50 other countries around the world.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: Ngo-March 2, 2020, igciwane laholela ezimweni eziqinisekisiwe ezingaphezu kuka-80,000 ze-COVID-19, ngeziguli ezingaphezu kuka-40,000 ezakhishwa esibhedlela kanye neziguli ezingaphezu kuka-3,000 ezafa.
en-mt: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has led to more than 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged from the hospital and more than 3,000 patients dying.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: I-WHO ixwayisa ngokuthi i-COVID-19 “iyisitha somphakathi esihamba phambili” futhi kungenzeka ukuthi inamandla amakhulu ukwedlula ubuphekula.
en-mt: The WHO warns that COVID-19 is "public's worst enemy" and may be more powerful than terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: Ngokwe-PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), ezinyangeni ezingaphansi kwezimbili, kushicilelwe amaphepha angaphezu kuka-200 mayelana ne-COVID-19 okuhlanganisa i-virology yayo, i-epidemiology, i-etiology, ukuxilongwa, nokwelashwa kusukela kumbiko wokuqala ngo-January 7, 2020 owanquma ukulandelana kwegciwane okuhlukaniswe ezigulini eziningi.
en-mt: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, more than 200 papers have been published about COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from many patients.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: Lesi sibuyekezo sizama ukufinyeza inqubekela-phambili yocwaningo olumayelana nesihloko esisha nesithuthuka ngokushesha.
en-mt: This review attempts to summarize research progress on a new and rapidly developing topic.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: Noma nini lapho okungenzeka khona, sizozama ukuqhathanisa i-COVID-19 ne-SARS kanye nesinye isifo esibangelwa i-CoV, i-Middle East respiratory syndrome (I-MERS, ukubheduka kwango-2012).
en-mt: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another disease caused by CoV, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, 2012 outbreak).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: Sizophinde futhi sixoxe ngalokho esikufundile kuze kube manje mayelana nokuvinjwa nembangela yesifo kanye neminye imibuzo esele kodwa ebalulekile.
en-mt: We will also discuss what we have learned so far about prevention and the cause of disease and other remaining but important questions.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: Ama-CoV ngokuvamile ababhekwa njengama-pathogen angabulali kubantu, ngokuyinhloko abangela u-15% wemikhuhlane evamile 4.
en-mt: CoVs are not generally considered to be non-lethal pathogens in humans, mainly causing 15% of common colds 4 .

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: Nokho, kuleli khulu leminyaka, sike sabhekana kabili nama-CoV abantu a-pathogenic kakhulu, okungukuthi, i-SARS-CoV ne- MERS-CoV, eyabangela ubhubhane olwaqala e-China ngo-2003 nase-Saudi Arabia ngo-2012, ngokulandelana, futhi ngokushesha asakazekela kwamanye amazwe okwabangela ukugula okubi nokufa.
en-mt: However, in this century, we have experienced two highly pathogenic human CoVs, namely, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused epidemics that started in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively. and quickly spread to other countries causing serious illness and death.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: Ngakho-ke, i-COVID-19 yamanje iwukubheduka kwesithathu kwe-CoV kumlando obhaliwe wabantu.
en-mt: Thus, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in recorded human history.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: Njengoba kuboniswe Kumfa. ​Umfa.1,1, amaqoqo enyumoniya ayenomsuka ongaziwa aqala ukubikwa e-Wuhan ngo-December 31, 2019 ku-China National Health Commission.
en-mt: As shown in Mfa. 1,1, clusters of pneumonia of unknown origin were first reported in Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: Ezinsukwini eziyisikhombisa kamuva ukulandelana kwe-CoV kwakhululwa.
en-mt: Seven days later the CoV sequence was released.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: Ngo-January 15, 2020 kwabikwa isigameko sokuqala sokufa e-Wuhan.
en-mt: On January 15, 2020 the first death was reported in Wuhan.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: Kusanjalo, umqedazwe wasakazekela ngokushesha emadolobheni angomakhelwane, ezifundazweni, nasemazweni.
en-mt: Meanwhile, the epidemic quickly spread to neighboring cities, states, and countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: Ngo-January 20, kwabikwa ukutheleleka kwezisebenzi zezempilo, okwasikisela ukuthi ukuthelelana kwabantu kwakuyinto engenzeka.
en-mt: On January 20, an infection of health workers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was a possibility.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: Ngo-January 23, idolobha lase-Wuhan lavalwa thaqa futhi kwamiswa zonke izinto zokuthuthwa komphakathi.
en-mt: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was closed down and all public transportation was suspended.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: Ngo-January 24 ucwaningo lwezokwelashwa lokuqala lwesifo labika ukuthi, ezigulini ezingu-41 ezinezimo eziqinisekisiwe, zingu-21 kuphela ezaba nokuxhumana okuqondile nemakethe yokudla kwasolwandle yase-Wuhan eyayibhekwa njengendawo okwakuqale kuyona isifo esivela kumthombo oyisilwane esingaziwa.
en-mt: On January 24, the first clinical investigation of the disease reported that, of the 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered to be the source of the disease from an unknown animal source.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: Ngo-January 30, I-WHO yamemezela ukubheduka kwesimo esiphuthumayo sezempilo embulungeni yonke.
en-mt: On January 30, the WHO declared a global health emergency.

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: Ngesikhathi salo mbiko, isifo sesisakazeke kulo lonke elase-China kanye nasemazweni acishe abe ngu-50 emhlabeni jikelele (Umfa. ​(Umfa.2).2).
en-mt: At the time of this report, the disease had spread throughout China and to nearly 50 countries around the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: Njengoba isimo sishintsha ngokushesha, isiphetho kanye nobucayi bobhubhane akwaziwa.
en-mt: As the situation is changing rapidly, the fate and severity of the epidemic is unknown.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: Ngo-February 11, 2020, ucwaningo lwezikhungo eziningi lweziguli ezingu-8,866 okuhlanganisa ezingu-4,021 okwakuqinisekisiwe ukuthi ziphethwe i-COVID-19 zabonisa isithombe esibuyekezwe kakhudlwana somqedazwe ngendlela elandelayo (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study of 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed cases of COVID-19 showed a more updated picture of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi- HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV-2 igulise abantu bayo yonke iminyaka, kodwa ngokuyinhloko iminyaka engu-30-65.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 sickens people of all ages, but mainly 30-65 years.

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: Cishe uhhafu (47.7%) wabantu abagulayo ubuneminyaka engaphezu kuka-50, bambalwa abangaphansi kuka-20, futhi bangu-14 kuphela abantu abagulayo abangaphansi kuka-10.
en-mt: Almost half (47.7%) of the sick people were over 50 years old, few were under 20, and only 14 sick people were under 10.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: I-SARS-CoV-2 igulise abantu besilisa abaningi (0.31/100,000) kunabantu besifazane (0.27/100,000).
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infects more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: I-COVID-19 yakhula ngamaqoqo ngokuyinhloko e-Hubei naseduze kwakhona.
en-mt: COVID-19 grew in clusters mainly in and around Hubei again.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: I-COVID-19 yathatha isilinganiso sezinsuku ezingu-5 (2-9) kusukela ekuqaleni kuye ekuxilongweni.
en-mt: COVID-19 took an average of 5 days (2-9) from onset to diagnosis.

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: Isilinganiso senkathi yokufukanyelwa sibe izinsuku ezingu-4.8 (3.0-7.2).
en-mt: The average incubation period was 4.8 days (3.0-7.2).

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: Isikhathi esiyisilinganiso kusuka ekuqaleni kuye ekufeni sibe izinsuku ezingu-9.5 (4.8-13).
en-mt: The mean time from onset to death was 9.5 days (4.8-13).

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
targetString: Inombolo eyisisekelo yokukhiqiza kabusha (I-R0) ibithi 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), futhi i-R0 eshintshiwe ibithi 2.23-4.82.
en-mt: The baseline reproducibility ratio (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: Inani labantu abathelelekile lanyuka ngokushesha ngaphambi kuka-23 Jan. 2020, okwafana nesikhathi sokuthuthwa okukhulu ngaphambi kwe-Spring Festival e-China.
en-mt: The number of infected people increased rapidly before 23 Jan. 2020, which coincided with the period of mass migration before the Spring Festival in China.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
targetString: Ukufa kweziguli ezinezimo eziqinisekisiwe kwakungu-1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), futhi inani lokufa elishintshiwe lazo zonke iziguli lalingu-3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
en-mt: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality rate for all patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: Izici ezintathu ezinkulu zobungozi be-COVID-19 zaziwubulili (abantu besilisa), ubudala (≥60), kanye nenyumoniya ebucayi.
en-mt: The three major risk factors for COVID-19 were gender (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: Ama-CoV ayingxenye yomndeni wamagciwane amakhulu afihlekile aqukethe umucu owodwa we-RNA yomuzwa.
en-mt: CoVs belong to a family of large latent viruses that contain a single strand of sense RNA.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: Angahlukaniswa abe izingxenye ezine, okungukuthi, i-alpha, i-beta, i-gamma, ne-delta, okungukuthi ama-CoV e-alpha ne-beta ayaziwa ukuthi athelela abantu.
en-mt: They can be divided into four subtypes, namely, alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, i.e. alpha and beta CoVs are known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: I-spike (S) semvilophu ye-glycoprotein sinamathela kuzamukeli zamaseli e-angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (I-ACE2) kanye ne-dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (I-DPP4) ye-SARS-CoV kanye ne-MERS-CoV, ngokulandelana, bese kwenzeka ukuhlanganiswa kolwelwesi.
en-mt: The spike (S) of the envelope glycoprotein binds to cell receptors for angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, then membrane fusion occurs.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: Isakhi sofuzo se-RNA yegciwane sikhululwa ku-cytoplasm; ngemva kokuphindwa kwesakhi sofuzo segciwane, i-RNA yesakhi sofuzo esihambisana nemvilophu yama-glycoprotein namaphrotheni e-nucleocapsid kwakha ama-vesicle aqukethe i-virion, ezihlanganisa nolwelwesi lwe-plasma ukuze kudedelwe igciwane.
en-mt: The viral RNA gene is released from the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, the RNA of the genome coupled to the envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins form vesicles containing the virion, which fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: Ukulandelana kwezakhi zofuzo zokuqala ze-SARS-CoV-2 kwabikwa ngo-January 10, 2020.
en-mt: The first genome sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV-2 kwatholwa ukuthi iwuhlobo olusha lwe-beta-CoV enomazisi wezakhi zofuzo ezingu-99.98% phakathi namasampula alandelanayo angu-10 aqoqwe endaweni yokuqala yokubheduka, i-Huanan Seafood Market e-Wuhan.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with 99.98% genetic identity during 10 consecutive samples collected from the first outbreak site, Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV-2 ngokuvamile ifana kakhudlwana ne-SARS-CoV kune-MERS-CoV.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is generally more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: Kusetshenziswa i-microscopy yokudluliswa kwe-electron, kwatholwa izinhlayiya ze-SARS-CoV-2 ezingxenyeni ezicace kakhulu ku-epithelium yomgudu womoya kubantu.
en-mt: Using transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were detected in the clearest parts of the airway epithelium in humans.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: I-ACE2 yabantu kwatholwa ukuthi iyisisabeli se-SARS-CoV-2 kanye ne-SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Human ACE2 was found to be a response to SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Nokho, iphrotheni ka-S ye-SARS-CoV-2 izihlanganisa ne-ACE2 yomuntu ngokushesha okukhulu kunaleyo ye-SARS-CoV, okuhambelana neqiniso lokuthi i-SARS-CoV-2 ibangela ukutheleleka okungekho bucayi kakhulu ezigulini kune-SARS-CoV.
en-mt: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 much faster than that of SARS-CoV, which is consistent with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes a less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV-2 ingaphinde futhi yakhe iphrotheni emfushane entsha ekhiqizwa yi-orf3b kanye nephrotheni ekhishwayo ekhiqizwa yi-orf8.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can also synthesize a new short protein produced by orf3b and a secreted protein produced by orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: I-orf3b ye-SARS-CoV-2 ingase idlale indima ku-pathogenicity yegciwane futhi ingase ivimbe ukubonakala kwe-IFNβ; nokho, i-orf8 ayiqukethe noma yisiphi isizinda noma i-motif esebenzayo eyaziwayo.
en-mt: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the pathogenicity of the virus and may inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: Ngo-February 18, 2020, i-Zhou, et al., yabika isakhiwo se-cryo-EM ye-ACE2 yabantu enobude obugcwele ekucaceni okungu-2.9 Å exhumene nesithuthi se-amino acid esiyi-B0AT1.
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution bound to the amino acid transporter B0AT1.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: Kwatholwa ukuthi lokhu okuxhumene, okunezakhiwo ezivulekile nezivalekile, kwahlanganiswa njenge-dimer futhi okuxhumene kwe-ACE2-B0AT1 kukwazi ukuhlanganisa amaphrotheni ka-S amabili, okunikeza ubufakazi bokubonwa kwe-CoV kanye nokutheleleka.
en-mt: It was found that this linker, with open and closed structures, assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 linker was able to bind two S proteins, providing evidence for CoV recognition and infection.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: I-B0AT1 ingase ibe ithagethi yokwelashwa ekuhlungweni kwemithi ukuze kucindezelwe ukutheleleka kwe-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: B0AT1 may be a therapeutic target in drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: Umsuka kanye nombungazi omaphakathi
en-mt: The origin and host of the medium

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: Kuyaziwa ukuthi kokubili i-SARS-CoV kanye ne-MERS-CoV kwaqala emalulwaneni futhi yadlulela kubantu ngamakati e-civet kanye namakameli, ngokulandelana.
en-mt: It is known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated in bats and passed to humans through civet cats and camels, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: Ngokuqhathaniswa kwe-phylogenetic ye-SARS-CoV-2 kanye namanye ama-CoV, amalulwane aqashelwa njengombungazi owumsuka we-SARS-CoV-2 njengoba igciwane elisha lifana ngo-96% nama-CoV amabili afana ne-SARS esuka kumalulwane abizwa ngokuthi i-SL-CoVZX45 yelulwane kanye ne-SL-CoVZX21 yelulwane.
en-mt: In the phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 and other CoVs, bats were recognized as the original host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% similar to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat SL-CoVZX45 and bat SL-CoVZX21.

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: Nokho, ukuthi yimuphi umbungazi owangenelela wasiza igciwane ukuthi leqe umngcele okhona phakathi kwezidalwa ukuze likwazi ukuthelela abantu akwaziwa, futhi umzila wokudluliselwa usazocaciswa.
en-mt: However, which host intervened to help the virus cross the biological barrier to infect humans is unknown, and the route of transmission remains to be elucidated.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: I-Ji, et al., yasikisela ukuthi kungenzeka ukuthi izinyoka ziyisithwali segciwane ukusuka kumalulwane kuye kubantu okwahilela ukuhlanganiswa kwabusha kwezici ezifanayo ngaphakathi kwephrotheni ka-S.
en-mt: Ji, et al., suggested that snakes may be the vector of the virus from bats to humans which involved the recombination of similar elements within the protein of S.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ngokocwaningo, abacwaningi base-Guangzhou, e-China, basikisela ukuthi ama-pangolin - anekhala elide, izilwane ezincelisayo ezidla izintuthane ngokuvamile ezisetshenziswa njengemithi yesintu yase-Chinese - kungenzeka ukuthi angumbungazi omaphakathi we-SARS-CoV-2 ngokusekelwe kuzici zezakhi zofuzo ezingu-99% ku-CoV etholwe kuma-pangolin kanye ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: According to the study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggest that pangolins - long-nosed, ant-eating mammals often used as traditional Chinese medicine - may be the intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99 genetic features % in CoV detected in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: Nokho, umehluko ka-1% osakazeke phakathi kwezakhi zofuzo ezimbili wenza umehluko omkhulu; ngakho-ke, imiphumela eqinisekisiwe yobufazi obuqinile isalindiwe (Umfa. ​(Umfa.33).
en-mt: However, a 1% difference spread between two genes makes a big difference; therefore, the proven results of strong feminism are still awaited (Ref. ​(Ref.33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: Izici ze-physicochemical ye-SARS-CoV-2 ngokwezinga elikhulu azaziwa okwamanje.
en-mt: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely unknown at present.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV kanye ne-MERS-CoV ingakwazi ukuphila ngaphandle kwesidalwa amahora afika ku-48 endaweni eyomile futhi kuze kufike ezinsukwini ezingu-5 ngaphansi komsakama ongu-20 °C no-40%-50%.
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive outside the organism for up to 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV-2 ingase ibe nezici ezifanayo.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may have similar characteristics.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: Kubikwe ukuthi i-SARS-CoV-2 ayizwani nemisebe ye-ultraviolet kanye nokushisa okungu-56 °C imizuzu engu-30; i-ether, u-75% we-ethanol, isibulali-magciwane esine-chlorine, i-peracetic acid, i-chloroform, nezinye izinto ezincibilikisa amafutha, kodwa hhayi i-chlorhexidine, zingenza igciwane lingasebenzi ngempumelelo.
en-mt: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is resistant to ultraviolet radiation and heat of 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate bacteria.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: Ngokuvamile bonke abantu bantula izivikeli-mzimba ezimelena ne-SARS-CoV-2 futhi yingakho besengozini yokuthola igciwane elisha.
en-mt: In general, all people lack antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 and are therefore at risk of contracting the new virus.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Okwamanje, alukho ucwaningo oluningiliziwe olubikiwe mayelana nokusabela kwamasosha omzimba ku-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Currently, no detailed studies have been reported on the immune response to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: Ngakho-ke, singakwazi ukubhekisela kuphela kuzingcwaningo ezidlule zamanye ama-CoV, ikakhulukazi i-SARS-CoV kanye ne-MERS-CoV (Umfa. ​(Umfa.4).4).
en-mt: Therefore, we can only refer to previous studies of other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Ref. ​(Ref.4).4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: Ngokuvamile, ngemva kokuthi igciwane lihlasele umzimba, liqale libonwe amasosha omzimba angokwemvelo ombungazi ngama-receptor okubonwa kwephetheni (ama-PRR) okuhlanganisa ama-receptor afana ne-lectin ohlobo C, i-receptor efana ne-Toll (I-TLR), i-receptor efana ne-NOD (I-NLR), kanye ne-receptor efana ne-RIG ka-I (I-RLR).
en-mt: Typically, after a virus invades the body, it is first recognized by the host's innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptors (TLRs), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and I-RIG-like receptor (RLR).

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: Ngemizila ehlukene, igciwane libangela ukuboniswa kwezici zokuvuvukala, ukwakheka kwamaseli e-dendritic, kanye nokukhiqizwa kwama-interferon ohlobo I (ama-IFN) akhawula ukusakazeka kwegciwane futhi kusheshise i-macrophage phagocytosis yama-antigen egciwane.
en-mt: Through different pathways, the virus causes the expression of inflammatory factors, the formation of dendritic cells, and the production of type I interferons (IFNs) that limit the spread of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: Nokho, iphrotheni ka-N ye-SARS-CoV ingasiza igciwane ukuthi libalekele ukusabela kwamasosha omzimba.
en-mt: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape the immune response.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: Maduzane, ukusabela kwamasosha omzimba okuvumelana nezimo kujoyina impi yokulwa negciwane.
en-mt: Soon, an adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: Ama-T lymphocyte okuhlanganisa amaseli ka-T e-CD4+ ne-CD8+ adlala indima ebalulekile ekuvikeleni.
en-mt: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in immunity.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: Amaseli ka-T e-CD4+ akhuthaza amaseli ka-B ukuthi akhiqize izivikeli zomzimba eziqondene negciwane, kanye namaseli ka-T e-CD8+ abulala ngokuqondile amaseli atheleleke ngegciwane.
en-mt: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells specifically kill virus-infected cells.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: Amaseli asizayo ka-T akhiqiza ama-proinflammatory cytokine ukusiza amaseli avikelayo.
en-mt: Helper T cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help immune cells.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: Nokho, i-CoV ingakwazi ukuvimba ukusebenza kweseli lika-T ngokukhiqiza i-apoptosis yamaseli ka-T.
en-mt: However, CoV can inhibit T cell function by inducing T cell apoptosis.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: Ukungatheleleki kwe-humoral kuhlanganise nezinsiza ezifana ne-C3a kanye ne-C5a kanye nezivikeli-mzimba nakho kubalulekile ekulweni nesifo segciwane.
en-mt: Humoral immunity including components such as C3a and C5a and the immune system is also important in fighting viral disease.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, izivikeli-mzimba ezithathwe kusiguli esiluleme zenza ukuthi i-MERS-CoV ingasebenzi.
en-mt: For example, antibodies taken from a recovered patient neutralize MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: Ngakolunye uhlangothi, ukusabela ngokweqile kwamasosha omzimba kwakha inani elikhulu lama-radical endaweni elingakwazi ukubangela umonakalo omkhulu emaphasheni nakwezinye izitho zomzimba, futhi, esimweni esibi kunazo zonke, ukuhluleka kwezitho zomzimba eziningi futhi ngisho nokufa.
en-mt: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system creates a large amount of radicals in the environment that can cause serious damage to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst case, failure of many organs and even death.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: Isifo se-SARS-CoV-2, esinesici sokuqala njengeqembu, sinamathuba amaningi okugulisa abantu abadala abaphethwe i-comorbidities kanye nabantu besifazane abakhulelwe.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 disease, which has the first characteristic as a group, is more likely to make sick adults suffering from comorbidities and pregnant women.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: Kuyinto evamile ukuthi abantu abachayeke enanini elikhulu lamagciwane noma abanokusebenza kwamasosha omzimba afakwe engcupheni, banethuba eliphakeme lokutheleleka kunabanye abantu.
en-mt: It is normal that people who have been exposed to a large number of germs or have a compromised immune system, have a higher chance of infection than other people.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Isilinganiso sembangela yenkathi yokufukanyelwa kwe-SARS-CoV-2 siyizinsuku ezingu-1-14, ezikhathini eziningi izinsuku ezingu-3-7 ngokusekelwe kucwaningo lwabantu bokuqala abangu-425 e-Wuhan.
en-mt: The average incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, most often 3-7 days based on the study of the first 425 people in Wuhan.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: Nokho, ucwaningo lwabantu abangu-1,099 lubonisa ukuthi inkathi yokufukanyelwa ibiyizinsuku ezingu-3 ngokwesilinganiso futhi ibinobubanzi bezinsuku ezingu-0 ukuya kwezingu-24.
en-mt: However, a study of 1,099 people showed that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwakamuva, njengoba luchazwe ngenhla, lubonise ukuthi inkathi yokufukanyelwa ibiyizinsuku ezingu-4.8 (3.0-7.2) ngokusekelwe kulwazi lwabantu abangu-8,866.
en-mt: A recent study, as described above, showed that the incubation period was 4.8 days (3.0-7.2) based on information from 8,866 people.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: Kubaluleke kakhulu kumagunya ezempilo ukuthi ashintshe isikhathi sokuzivalela ngokusekelwe enkathini yokufukanyelwa enembile, ngaleyo ndleal kuvinjwe abantu abathelelekile kodwa abangenazo izimpawu ukuthi bangadlulisi igciwane kwabanye.
en-mt: It is very important for the health authorities to change the quarantine period based on the correct incubation period, thus preventing infected but asymptomatic people from transmitting the virus to others.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: Njengomkhuba ovamile, abantu abachayekile, noma abathelelekile igciwane, kudingeka ukuthi bazivalele izinsuku ezingu-14.
en-mt: As a general practice, people who have been exposed, or infected with the virus, are required to self-isolate for 14 days.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: Ingabe isikhathi sokuzivalela kufanele sinwetshwe sibe izinsuku ezingu-24?
en-mt: Should the quarantine period be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: Imfiva ngokuvamile iyinkomba enkulu neyokuqala ye-COVID-19, engase ingahambisani nezimpawu noma ezinye izimpawu ezifana nokukhwehlela okungenazo izikhwehlela, ukuphelelwa umoya, ubuhlungu bemisipha, isiyezi, ikhanda elibuhlungu, umphimbo obuhlungu, i-rhinorrhea, ubuhlungu besifuba, isifo sohudo, isicanucanu, nokuhlanza.
en-mt: Fever is usually the main and first indicator of COVID-19, which may not be accompanied by symptoms or other symptoms such as cough without sputum, shortness of breath, muscle pain, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: Ezinye iziguli zabhekana ne-dyspnea kanye/noma i-hypoxemia evikini elilodwa ngemva kokuqala kwesifo.
en-mt: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after disease onset.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: Ezimweni ezibucayi, iziguli zathuthuka ngokushesha zaphathwa isifo sokuphefumula esibucayi, i-septic shock, i-metabolic acidosis, kanye ne-coagulopathy.
en-mt: In severe cases, patients rapidly progressed to acute respiratory distress syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: Iziguli eziphethwe imfiva kanye/noma izimpawu zokuphefumula kanye nemfiva ebucayi, ngisho noma zingekho izinto ezingavamile ezibonwa esithombeni samphaphu, kufanele zihlungelwe igciwane ukuze kube nokuxilongwa okwenziwe ekuqaleni.
en-mt: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even in the absence of abnormalities seen on chest X-ray, should be screened for the virus to make an initial diagnosis.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: Ucwaningo lolwazi lwabantu olwenziwa ekupheleni kuka-December ka-2019 lwabonisa amaphesenti ezimpawu ayethi u-98% owemfiva, u-76% owokukhehlela okungenazo izikhwehlela, u-55% owe-dyspnea, futhi u-3% owesifo sohudo; u-8% wawudinga ukuphefumula ngosizo lomshini.
en-mt: A demographic survey conducted at the end of December 2019 showed that the percentage of symptoms was 98% for fever, 76% for cough without sputum, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% needed to breathe with the help of a machine.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: Ukuthola okufanayo kwabikwa kuzingcwaningo zakamuva ezimbili zeqoqo lomndeni kanye neqoqo elibangelwa ukuthelelelwa umuntu ongenazo izimpawu.
en-mt: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cohort and an asymptomatic cohort.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: Uma kuqhathaniswa, ucwaningo lolwazi lwabantu ngo-2012 lwabonisa ukuthi iziguli ezine-MERS-CoV nazo zazinemfiva (98%), ukukhwehlela okungenazo izikhwehlela (47%), kanye ne-dyspnea (55%) njengezimpawu zazo eziyinhloko.
en-mt: In comparison, a population-based study in 2012 showed that patients with MERS-CoV also had fever (98%), cough without sputum (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: Nokho, u-80% wazo wawudinga ukuphefumula ngosizo lomshini, okungaphezu kakhulu kuneziguli ezine-COVID-19 futhi okuvumelana nezinga eliphakeme kakhulu lokubulala kwe-MERS kune-COVID-19.
en-mt: However, 80% of them required mechanical ventilation, far more than patients with COVID-19 and consistent with the higher lethality rate of MERS than COVID-19.

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: Isifo sohudo (26%) kanye nomphimbo obuhlungu (21%) nakho kwaphawulwa kuziguli eziphethwe i-MERS.
en-mt: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also noted in MERS patients.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: Ezigulini eziphethwe i-SARS, kwaboniswa ukuthi imfiva (99%-100%), ukukhwehlela okungenazo izikhwehlela (29%-75%), i-dyspnea (40%-42%), isifo sohudo (20-25%), nomphimbo obuhlungu (13-25%) kwakuyizimpawu ezinkulu futhi ukuphefumula ngosizo lomshini kwakudingekile cishe ezigulini ezingu-14%-20%.
en-mt: In patients with SARS, it was shown that fever (99%-100%), cough without sputum (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were severely symptomatic and mechanical ventilation was required in approximately 14%-20% of patients.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: Ngo-February 14, ukufa okubangelwa i-COVID-19 kwakungu-2% lapho abantu abagulayo abaqinisekisiwe befinyelela u-66,576 emhlabeni wonke.
en-mt: As of February 14, the death toll from COVID-19 was 2% with confirmed cases reaching 66,576 worldwide.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: Uma kuqhathaniswa, ukufa okubangelwa i-SARS ngo-November 2002 kwangu-10% kwabo bonke abantu abagulayo abaqinisekisiwe abangu-8,096.
en-mt: In comparison, deaths from SARS in November 2002 were 10% of all 8,096 confirmed cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: Nge-MERS, ngokusekelwe kucwaningo lolwazi lwabantu ngo-June 2012, ukufa kwakungu-37% kubantu abagulayo abaqinisekisiwe abangu-2,494.
en-mt: For MERS, based on a population-based survey in June 2012, mortality was 37% among 2,494 confirmed cases.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: Ucwaningo lokuqala lwabika ukuthi u-R0 we-SARS-CoV-2 wawuphakeme ngo-6.47 unesikhewu sokuzethemba (I-CI) esingu-95% kokungu-5.71-7.23, lapho u-R0 we-SARS-CoV wawunobubanzi obusuka ku-2 ukuya ku-4.
en-mt: The first study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, where the R0 of SARS-CoV ranged from 2 to in 4.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: Ukuqhathaniswa kwe-SARS-CoV-2 ne-MERS-CoV kanye ne-SARA-CoV ngokuphathelene nezimpawu zabo, ukufa, kanye no-R0 kumelelwe kokuthi Ithebula Ithebula1.1.
en-mt: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV with respect to their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is represented in Table ​ Table1.1.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: Izinombolo ezingenhla zisikisela ukuthi i-SARS-CoV-2 inekhono eliphakeme kakhulu lokubhebhetheka kune-MERS-CoV kanye ne-SARS-CoV, kodwa inamandla amancane okubulala kunazo zombili.
en-mt: The numbers above suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it has less lethality than both.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ngakho-ke, kuyinselele kakhulu ukulawula umqedazwe we-SARS-CoV-2 kune-MERS-CoV kanye ne-SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Therefore, it is more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: Ukuqalisa kwamaqoqo kuvame ukwenzeka kumndeni ofanayo noma kumbuthano ofanayo noma into yezokuthutha efana nomkhumbi wokungcebeleka.
en-mt: Cluster initiations often occur in the same family or group or in a form of transportation such as a cruise ship.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: Iziguli ngokuvamile zinomlando wokuvakasha noma zihlala e-Wuhan noma ezinye izindawo ezithintekile noma ukuxhumana nabantu abathelelekile noma iziguli emavikini amabili akamuva ngaphambi kokuqala.
en-mt: Patients usually have a history of traveling or living in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected people or patients in the last two weeks before the onset.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: Nokho, kuye kwabikwa ukuthi abantu bangakwazi ukuthwala igciwane ngaphandle kwezimpawu isikhathi eside kunamaviki amabili futhi iziguli ezilashiwe ezikhishiwe esibhedlela zingakwazi ukuphinde zithwale igciwane futhi, okukhipha isixwayiso sokunyusa isikhathi sokuzivalela.
en-mt: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms for longer than two weeks and that treated patients who have been discharged from the hospital can become infected again, prompting a warning to increase the period of self-isolation.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: Iziguli zinenani elivamile noma elincishisiwe lamaseli amhlophe egazi ayi-peripheral (ikakhulukazi ama-lymphocyte) ezigabeni zokuqala.
en-mt: Patients have a normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (mainly lymphocytes) in the early stages.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
