sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: Kuyaphawuleka, ukuthi amakamela athelelekile awagcinanga ukukhipha amagciwane ngomgudu wokuphefumula kuphela kodwa futhi nangomgudu wendle-womlomo, okuphinde kube umzila oyinhloko wokukhishwa kwegciwane elivela kumalulwane.
en-mt: It is noteworthy, that the infected camels not only shed the bacteria through the respiratory tract but also through the fecal-oral tract, which is also the main route of shedding of the virus from bats.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: Nokho, imibuzo isasele njengoba ukugula okuningi kwe-MERS kungenawo umlando wokuxhumana namakamela ngaphambi kokuqala kwezimpawu, kungenzeka ukuthi ukuthelelana okusuka kumuntu kuye komunye noma imizila yokuthelelana engaziwa ehilela izilwane ezingaziwa ezifukamela i-MERS-CoV.
en-mt: However, questions remain as most MERS cases have no history of contact with camels before the onset of symptoms, possibly human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unknown animals harboring MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV-2 yabelana nge-homology ye-nucleotide engu-96.2% ne-CoV RaTG13 yelulwane ehlukaniswe kumalulwane e-Rhinolophus affinis.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: Njengoba kunjalo nge-SARS-CoV kanye ne-MERS-CoV, ukuhlukahluka kokulandelana phakathi kwe-SARS-CoV-2 kanye ne-RaTG13 kukhulu kakhulu ukuthi kungabelwa ubudlelwano bomzali.
en-mt: As with SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence diversity between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign a parentage relationship.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: Lokho kusho ukuthi, amalulwane kungenzeka ukuthi awayena umbungazi owumthombo oseduze we-SARS-CoV-2 ngaphandle kwalapho kutholwa ama-CoV elulwane acishe afane esikhathini esizayo.
en-mt: That said, bats are unlikely to be the proximate host for SARS-CoV-2 unless similar bat CoVs are discovered in the future.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: Kucatshangelwa ukuthi, ababungazi besilwane esimaphakathi se-SARS-CoV-2 kufanele babe phakathi kwezilwane zasendle ezidayiswa futhi zibulawe e-Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, iningi lazo lalihlobene nokugula kokuqala kwe-COVID-19, okubonisa ukuthi kungenzeka ukuthi kwaba nesenzakalo sokuthelelana okusuka kuzilwane kuye kubantu.
en-mt: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wild animals sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, most of which were related to the initial illness of COVID-19, indicating that there may have been an event of transmission from animals to humans .

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Izingcwaningo zakamuva ezimbalwa ezisekelwe ekulandelaneni kwe-metagenomic ziye zasikisela ukuthi iqembu lezilwane ezincane ezincelisayo ezaziwa ngokuthi ama-pangolin (i-Manis javanica) kungenzeka ukuthi zifukamele ama-beta-CoV amadala ahlobene ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) may harbor ancient beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Lawa ma-genome amasha e-pangolin CoV abelana ngo-85-92% we-homology yokulandelana kwe-nucleotide ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: These new pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% of nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Nokho, ahlobene ngokuseduze ngokulinganayo ne-RaTG13 ngomazisi ocishe ube ngu-90% ezingeni lokulandelana kwe-nucleotide.
en-mt: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with almost 90% identity at the nucleotide sequence level.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: Ahlangana abe yizinhlu ezingaphansi ezimbili zamagciwane acishe afane ne-SARS-CoV-2 esihlahleni esi-phylogenetic, esinye sazo sabelana ngesizinda sokunamathisela sesisabeli esifana kakhulu (i-RBD) ne-SARS-CoV-2, nokufana kokulandelana kwe-amino acid okungu-97.4%.
en-mt: They clustered into two subgroups of viruses closely related to SARS-CoV-2 in the phylogenetic tree, one of which shared a highly similar receptor attachment domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4 amino acid sequence similarity %.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: Ngokungafani okukhulu, ama-RBD e-SARS-CoV-2 ne-RaTG13 ahlukene kakhulu, nakuba kunezinga eliphakeme le-genome ebanzi yokulandelana kwe-homology.
en-mt: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are highly divergent, although there is a high degree of genome-wide sequence homology.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwangaphambilini lwama-pangolin agulayo lwabika ukutholwa kwama-contig egciwane kumasampula amaphaphu, okubonakala ehlobene ngokufanayo ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: A previous study of sick pangolins reported the detection of viral contigs in lung samples, which appeared to be closely related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: Lolu cwaningo lwasebenzisa izindlela zokwakhiwa ezihlukahlukene kanye nokuhlelwa okwenziwa ngesandla ukuze kwakhiwe ukulandelana kwe-genome eyingxenye eyakhiwa cishe u-86.3% wobude obuphelele be-genome yegciwane.
en-mt: This study used various construction methods and manual sequencing to construct a partial genome sequence that made up approximately 86.3% of the total length of the viral genome.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Asikwazi ukubekela eceleni ithuba lokuthi i-pangolin ingesinye sezilwane ezingababungazi abaseduze be-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: We cannot exclude the possibility that the pangolin is one of the animals that are the closest hosts of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Nokho, okwamanje abukho ubufakazi obusekela ukuthi i-pangolin ingumsuka oqondile we-SARS-CoV-2 ngenxa yokuhlukahluka kokulandelana phakathi kwe-SARS-CoV-2 kanye ne-SARS-CoV-2 ye-pangolin ehlobene nama-beta-CoV.
en-mt: However, there is currently no evidence to support that the pangolin is the direct source of SARS-CoV-2 due to sequence differences between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin-related SARS-CoV-2 beta-CoVs.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, ibanga eliphakathi kwe-SARS-CoV-2 kanye ne-RaTG13 lifushane nakakhulu phakathi kwe-SARS-CoV-2 kanye ne-SARS-CoV-2 ye-pangolini ehlobene nama-beta-CoV.
en-mt: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolini SARS-CoV-2 related beta-CoVs.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: Umgudu wokuziphendukela we-SARS-CoV-2 kumalulwane, ama-pangolin nezinye izilwane ezincelisayo usazotholwa.
en-mt: The evolutionary path of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be discovered.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: Nakuba i-homology yokulandelana okuphakeme itholiwe kuma-RBD phakathi kwe-SARS-CoV-2 ne-pangolin, i-SARS-CoV-2 ehlobene nama-beta-CoV, i-SARS-CoV-2 ne-RaTG13 kwabelana nge-homology ephakeme yokulandelana kwe-genome ebanzi.
en-mt: Although high sequence homology was found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2 related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share homology high-throughput genome-wide sequencing.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: Kunezinsolo eziphakeme zokuthi izinga eliphakeme lokufana phakathi kwama-RBD e-SARS-CoV-2 ye-pangolini ehlobene nama-beta-CoV kanye ne-SARS-CoV-2 kuqhutshwa ukuziphendukela kokuhlangana okuxhumana ngokukhethwa.
en-mt: There is a strong suspicion that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolini SARS-CoV-2 relative to beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by the evolution of interaction through selection.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: Esinye isiphakamiso sincoma ukuhlanganiswa kabusha okuphakathi kwe-SARS-CoV-2 ye-pangolini ehlobene ne-beta-CoV kanye ne-RaTG13 kusilwane sesithathu sasendle.
en-mt: Another proposal suggests recombination between pangolini SARS-CoV-2 related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in a third wild animal.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: Njengamandla aqhuba ukuziphendukela, ukuhlanganiswa kabusha kusakazekile phakathi kwama-beta-CoV.
en-mt: As a driving force for evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Isiphetho asikafinyelelwa ngokuqondene nomsuka we-zoonotic eseduze ye-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: A conclusion has not yet been reached regarding the near-zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwama-HCoV a-pathogenic kakhulu, umsuka we-zoonotic ye-HCoV-229E, i-HCoV-OC43, i-HCoV-NL63 kanye ne-HCoV-HKU1 nawo ucwaningiwe.
en-mt: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 has also been investigated.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: Ubufakazi be-phylogenetic bubonise ukuthi kokubili i-HCoV-NL63 kanye ne-HCoV-229E kungenzeka ukuthi kwaqala kuma-CoV elulwane, kuyilapho amagciwane angumzali e-HCoV-OC43 kanye ne-HCoV-HKU1 etholwe kumagundane.
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E may have originated from bat CoVs, while the parent viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 were derived from mice.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Kubikwe ukuthi i-CoV yelulwane ebizwa ngokuthi i-ARCoV.2 (i-Appalachian Ridge CoV) etholwe elulwaneni elinemibala emithathu laseNyakatho Melika yabonisa ubudlelwano obuseduze ne-HCoV-NL63.
en-mt: It has been reported that a bat CoV named ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) found in the North American three-colored bat showed a close relationship with HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: Ngakolunye uhlangothi, i-HCoV-229E yayihlobene ngokwezakhi zofuzo nenye i-CoV yelulwane, ebizwa ngokuthi i-Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, eyatholwa e-Ghana, kuyilapho ama-camelid aye asolwa ngokuba umbungazi wayo oseduze.
en-mt: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, named Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was discovered in Ghana, while camelids have been suspected to be its closest host.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: Ukuze sicacise, ulwazi lwamanje oluphathelene nemisuka eyizilwane yama-HCoV aziwayo lufinyezwe Kumfanekiso ​1 kanye Nethebula 2.
en-mt: For clarity, current information regarding the animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​ Figure1 1 and Table ​ Table2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: Ukuhlaziywa kwe-phylogenetic kunikeze ubufakazi bezigameko zokuthelelana kwezidalwa zama-HCoV emlandweni.
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence of historical HCoV transmission events.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
targetString: Ngenkathi i-HCoV-OC43 isuka kwesinye isilwane ukuze idluliselwe kubantu yasuka ezilwaneni ezifuywayo cishe ngo-1890, kwaqoshwa ubhubhane lwesifo sokuphefumula .
en-mt: When HCoV-OC43 was transferred from one animal to humans and from domestic animals around 1890, an epidemic of respiratory disease was recorded.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
targetString: Umlando wokuthelelana kwezidalwa ezihlukahlukene we-HCoV-229E awucacile kakhulu.
en-mt: The cross-species history of HCoV-229E is very unclear.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
targetString: Kutholwe ama-alpha-CoV elulwane ahlobenene-HCoV-229E.
en-mt: Bat alpha-CoVs related to HCoV-229E have been detected.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
targetString: Phakathi kwawo kukhona i-alpha-CoV ye-alpaca.
en-mt: Among them is the alpha-CoV of the alpaca.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
targetString: Ubufakazi obumbalwa busekela ukudluliswa kwegciwane lisuka emalulwaneni liye kubantu ngokuqondile.
en-mt: Few lines of evidence support direct transmission from bats to humans.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
targetString: Okokuqala, abantu hhayi ama-alpaca kungenzeka ukuthi baxhumane namalulwane endaweni ezungezile efanayo.
en-mt: First, humans and not alpacas are likely to interact with bats in the same environment.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: Kunalokho, abantu abasondelana ngokuseduze nama-alpaca.
en-mt: Instead, humans are closely related to alpacas.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: Okwesibili, ama-alpha-CoV elulwane ahlobene ne-HCoV-229E ahlukahlukene futhi awakubangeli ukugula kumalulwane, kuyilapho i-alpha-CoV ye-alpaca yabangela ukubheduka kwesifo sokuphefumula kuzilwane ezithelelekile.
en-mt: Second, the bat alpha-CoVs related to HCoV-229E are heterogeneous and do not cause disease in bats, while the alpaca alpha-CoV caused outbreaks of respiratory disease in infected animals.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
targetString: Okugcina, i-alpha-CoV ye-alpaca ayikatholwa kuzilwane zasendle.
en-mt: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been detected in wild animals.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: Ngenxa yalokho, ngeke silishalazele ithuba lokuthi ama-alpaca athola i-alpha-CoV ehlobene ne-HCoV-229E kubantu.
en-mt: As a result, we cannot rule out the possibility that alpacas acquire an alpha-CoV related to HCoV-229E from humans.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: Eqinisweni, amalulwane awumthombo oqondile wamagciwane abangela ukugula kwabantu okuhlanganisa igciwane lamarabi, igciwane le-Ebola, igciwane le-Nipah kanye negciwane le-Hendra.
en-mt: In fact, bats are a direct source of viruses that cause human illness including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: Ngakho akumangalisi ukuthi amalulwane kungenzeka adlulisele i-HCoV-229E kubantu ngokuqondile.
en-mt: It is therefore not surprising that bats may transmit HCoV-229E directly to humans.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Ngakolunye uhlangothi, lapho ama-alpha-CoV elulwane esebenza njengeqoqo lezakhi zofuzo ze-HCoV-229E, ama-alpaca kanye namakamela e-dromedary kungenzeka ukuthi angumbungazi omaphakathi odlulisela igciwane kubantu, njengoba kunjalo nge-MERS-CoV.
en-mt: On the other hand, where bat alpha-CoVs serve as a genetic cluster for HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels are likely to be the intermediate host for human transmission, as is the case with MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: I-MERS-CoV iyisibonelo esihle sokuthelelana kwezidalwa ezingafani kusukela kumalulwane kuye kumakamela e-dromedary kuye kubantu.
en-mt: MERS-CoV is a good example of cross-species transmission from bats to dromedary camels to humans.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: Umsuka wokuziphendukela kwe-MERS-CoV evela kumalulwane uyaziwa ekuhlonzweni kwayo kokuqala futhi uqiniswe ngokutholiwe okulandelayo.
en-mt: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known from its initial identification and has been confirmed by subsequent discoveries.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: Kusobala ukuthi amalulwane anikeza izinhlobonhlobo zamagciwane ithuba lokuthi kube nokushintshana kwezingxenye zezakhi zofuzo phakathi kwezilwane ezihlukene kanye nokuthelelana kwezilwane ezihlukene.
en-mt: It is clear that bats provide an opportunity for a variety of pathogens to exchange genetic components between different animals and infect different animals.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: Impilo ende, amakoloni aminyene, ukusondelana komphakathi okuseduze kanye nekhono elinamandla lokundiza konke kuyizimo ezikahle zokuthi amalulwane abe 'umbhebhethekisi wegciwane' okahle.
en-mt: Long lives, dense colonies, close social proximity and a strong ability to fly are all ideal conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: Ngakolunye uhlangothi, sekungamakhulu eminyaka i-MERS-CoV yethulwe kumakamela e-dromedary.
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for centuries.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: Ivumelaniseke kahle kulawa makamela aphenduke ekubeni umbungazi omaphakathi aba umbungazi ozinzile nongumthombo ongokwemvelo.
en-mt: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host into a stable host and a natural resource.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: I-MERS-CoV ibangela ukugula okuncane futhi inezinga lokushintsha eliphansi kulezi zilwane.
en-mt: MERS-CoV causes less disease and has a low mutation rate in these animals.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: Ukutheleleka kwayo kubantu kuyiphutha futhi abantu bahlala bengumbungazi wokugcina we-MERS-CoV njengoba ukudluliswa kwayo kungakwazi ukulondolozwa.
en-mt: Its transmission to humans is erratic and humans remain the final host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be maintained.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: Ngokungafani nendima yamakamela ekudlulisweni kwe-MERS-CoV, indima yama-pangolin, uma ikhona, ekudlulisweni kwe-SARS-CoV-2 ihlukile.
en-mt: Unlike the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: Ngokukhethekile, ama-beta-CoV e-pangolin abangela ukugula kakhulu kuma-pangolin.
en-mt: Specifically, pangolin beta-CoVs cause severe illness in pangolins.

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Angase abe umbungazi wokugcina wama-beta-CoV ahlobene ne-SARS-CoV-2, ngokufana nama-civet esimweni se-SARS-CoV.
en-mt: They may be the final host of beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: Amathuba ambalwa okuthelelana kwezidalwa ezingafani nge-SARS-CoV-2 kusukela ezilwaneni kuye kubantu kufanele zicatshangelwe noma zingacatshangelwa kuzingcwaningo zesikhathi esizayo.
en-mt: Several possibilities of cross-species transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans should be considered or not in future studies.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Okokuqala, amalulwane kungenzeka abe umbungazi ongumthombo wegciwane elihlobene ne-SARS-CoV-2 elicishe lifane ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: First, bats may be the source host for a SARS-CoV-2-related virus that closely resembles SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: Abantu bangase badlale indima efanayo namalulwane ngokuhlinza izilwane noma ukumbiwa kwamalahle.
en-mt: Humans may play a similar role to bats through animal surgery or coal mining.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
targetString: Okwesibili, ama-pangolin angase abe umbungazi okhulisayo omaphakathi lapho igciwane elihlobene ne-SARS-CoV-2 lisanda kwethulwa khona.
en-mt: Second, pangolins may be an intermediate breeding host in which the SARS-CoV-2-related virus has recently been introduced.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
targetString: Abantu batheleleka ngegciwane ngokuhlinza nokudla inyama ezingelwayo.
en-mt: People become infected with the virus through surgery and eating game meat.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kungenzeka ukuthi izilwane eziningi ezincelayo okuhlanganisa nezilwane ezifuywayo zingachayeka ku-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: It is possible that many mammals including pets can be exposed to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: Kudingeka inhlolovo yezivikeli-mzimba zezilwane ezifuywayo nezasendle.
en-mt: A survey of the immune systems of domestic and wild animals is required.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Okwesithathu, njengoba kushiwo ngenhla, ukuhlanganiswa kabusha nokuvunyelaniswa nesimo kwe-SARS-CoV-2 kungenzeka kwenzeke esilwaneni sesithathu esixhumene nakho kokubili amalulwane nama-pangolin.
en-mt: Third, as mentioned above, the recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 may have occurred in a third animal related to both bats and pangolins.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: Ukucingwa kwesilwane esiwumsuka we-SARS-CoV-2 kusaqhubeka.
en-mt: The search for the animal source of SARS-CoV-2 is ongoing.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwezinhlobo ezihlukahlukene zababungazi abayizilwane, kunezici ezintathu ezinkulu ohlangothini lwegciwane ezibalulekile ekwenzeni ama-CoV eqe umngcele wezidalwa.
en-mt: Apart from the variety of animal hosts, there are three major factors on the viral side that are important for CoVs to cross the animal boundary.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Okokuqala, inani lawo eliphakeme loshintsho ekuphindweni kwe-RNA.
en-mt: First, its high rate of change in RNA replication.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: Uma kuqhathaniswa namanye amagciwane e-RNA anomucu owodwa, isilinganiso samanani oshintsho lwama-CoV singase sibhekwe “njengesincane” kuye “kwesiphakeme” ngokwesilinganiso soshintsho esingu ~10-4 unyaka ngamunye ngesikhungo ngasinye sesi-2, kuye ngesigaba sokuvumelanisa kwe-CoV kubabungazi abasha.
en-mt: Compared to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the average mutation rates of CoVs may be considered “low” to “high” with a mutation rate of ~10-4 per year per 2 centers, depending on the stage of CoV adaptation to new hosts.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: Ama-CoV ane-exoribonuclease yokufuna amaphutha, ukususwa kwayo kuphumela ekushintsheni okuphakeme kakhulu nasekwehleni kwamandla noma ukungakwazi ukukhula ngendlela efanele.
en-mt: CoVs have an error-prone exoribonuclease, the deletion of which results in high mutation rate and reduced viability or inability to grow properly.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Ngokuthakazelisayo, i-nucleotide analogue Remdesivir iyaziwa ukuthi icindezela ukuphindeka kwe-CoV ngokuvinjwa kwale exoribonuclease kanye ne-RNA polymerase encike ku-RNA.
en-mt: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: I-Remdesivir ingenye yama-ejenti athembisa kakhulu alwa ne-SARS-CoV-2 ezohlolwa kuzingcwaningo zokwelashwa.
en-mt: Remdesivir is one of the most promising agents against SARS-CoV-2 to be tested in clinical trials.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: Noma kunjalo, amanani oshintsho lwama-CoV aphakeme cishe ngesigidi kunalawo ababungazi.
en-mt: However, the mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of the host.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, inani loshintsho livame ukuba phezulu uma ama-CoV engavumelanisiwe kahle nombungazi.
en-mt: Furthermore, the mutation rate is often higher if CoVs are not well adapted to the host.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Uma kuqhathaniswa ne-SARS-CoV enenani loshintsho eliphakeme, inani loshintsho le-SARS-CoV-2 libonakala liphansi, okusikisela izinga eliphezulu lokuvunyelaniswa nabantu.
en-mt: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 appears to be low, suggesting a high level of human adaptation.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Kucatshangelwa ukuthi, kungenzeka selivunyelanisiwe kakade nomunye umbungazi osondelene nabantu.
en-mt: It is thought that, it may have already been synchronized with another host that is close to humans.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwe-SARS-CoV-2, lokhu kuphinde kusebenze ku-MERS-CoV, evumelana kahle namakamela e-dromedary.
en-mt: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which adapts well to dromedary camels.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: Kucatshangelwa ukuthi cishe akunakwenzeka ukuthi ushintsho lwezakhi zofuzo lungabangela imigomo nemishanguzo yamagciwane emelene ne-SARS-CoV-2 ukuthi ingasebenzi ngokushesha.
en-mt: It is thought that it is unlikely that a genetic change would cause vaccines and antiviral drugs against SARS-CoV-2 to become ineffective quickly.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Okwesibili, i-genome enkulu ye-RNA kuma-CoV isebenzisa ukuthamba okwengeziwe ekushintshweni kwe-genome kushintsho nokuhlanganiswa kabusha, ngaleyo ndlela kunyuswe ithuba le-co-evolution yezidalwa ezihlukahlukene, elizuzisayo ekuveleni kwama-CoV amasha lapho izimo zifaneleka.
en-mt: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts more flexibility on genome modification and recombination, thus increasing the possibility of co-evolution of different organisms, which is beneficial in the emergence of new CoVs when conditions are suitable.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Lokhu kusekelwa amafreyimu ahlukile amaningi okufunda avulekile nokusebenza kwephrotheni akhiqizelwa isiphetho esingu-3′ se-genome.
en-mt: This is supported by the many different open reading frames and protein functions generated for the 3′ end of the genome.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Okwesithathu, ama-CoV ahlalal ashintsha amathempulethi ngokungahleliwe phakathi nokuphindwa kwe-RNA ngendlela ehlukile “yokukhetha-kokukopisha”.
en-mt: Third, CoVs randomly change templates during RNA replication in a unique “copy-selection” manner.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: Kumbungazi osebenza njengesitsha sokuxuba, ukushintsha kohlobo kwenzeka njalo phakathi ne-transcription ye-CoV RNA.
en-mt: In a host that acts as a mixing vessel, type switching occurs frequently during the transcription of CoV RNA.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: Ama-RNA a-homologous kakhulu anobude obugcwele kanye na-subgenomic angase ahlangane kabusha ukuze akhe ama-CoV amasha.
en-mt: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs may recombine to form new CoVs.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: Ubufakazi obuyi-phylogenetic bokuhlanganiswa kabusha okungokwemvelo butholwe kukho kokubili i-HCoV-HKU1, i-HCoV-OC43, kanye nama-CoV esilwane njenge-SL-CoV yelulwane kanye ne-batCoV-HKU9.
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence for natural recombination was found in both HCoV-HKU1, HCoV-OC43, and animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Ukusebenzisana kwegciwane nombungazi ngokuqondene nokutheleleka
en-mt: Virus-host interactions in infection

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwezici ezintathu zegciwane ezishiwo ngenhla, ukusebenzisana kwegciwane nesisabeli sombungazi kungesinye isici esiyinhloko esinethonya ekuthelelaneni kwezidalwa ezingafani.
en-mt: Apart from the three factors of the virus mentioned above, the interaction of the virus with the host's response is another main factor influencing the infection of different organisms.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: Lapha, ukuhlanganiswa kabusha kwe-SARS-CoV kubhekwa njengesibonelo esivamile, esabonisa ubufakazi bokukhethwa okuphozithivu phakathi nezehlakalo zokuthelelana kwezidalwa ezihlukene.
en-mt: Here, the recombination of SARS-CoV is considered as a common example, which showed evidence of positive selection during cross-infection events.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Ngokusekelwe ekuhlaziyweni okuqhathanisayo phakathi kwabantu abahlukanisiwe kanye nama-SARS-CoV e-civet, kucatshangelwa ukuthi i-SARS-CoV ibhekana nokuvumelana nesimo okusheshayo kubabungazi abahlukene, ikakhulukazi ngoshintsho ku-RBD yephrotheni ka-S.
en-mt: Based on a comparative analysis between human isolates and civet SARS-CoVs, it is hypothesized that SARS-CoV undergoes rapid adaptation to different hosts, mainly through changes in the RBD of the S protein.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: Ngokuvamile, i-RBD kuphrotheni ka-S ye-CoV isebenzisana nesisabeli seseli futhi ikhethwa ngokuqinile ukusabela kwesivikeli-mzimba sombungazi.
en-mt: In general, the RBD in the S protein of CoV interacts with the host cell and is strongly selected for the host's immune response.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: Ku-SARS-CoV, i-RBD ikuma-amino acid esi-318 kuye kweyesi-510 engxenyeni ye-S1, enamathela ku-ACE2 yomuntu kanye nama-coreceptor ayo ukuze kungene igciwane.
en-mt: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is at amino acids 318 to 510 in the S1 segment, which binds to human ACE2 and its coreceptors for virus entry.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: I-RBD ye-SARS-CoV iyakwazi ukubona izisabeli ze-ACE2 yezilwane ezihlukene, okuhlanganisa ilulwane, i-civet, igundane nenja ye-raccoon, okuvumela ukuthelelana ngegciwane kwezidalwa ezihlukene.
en-mt: The RBD of SARS-CoV can recognize the ACE2 receptors of different animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing the virus to infect different organisms.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Eqinisweni, izinsalela ezingu-6 kuphela ze-amino acid okwaphawulwa ukuthi zihlukile kokuhlukanisiwe kwegciwane labantu kanye ne-civet ku-RBD okungu-4 kukho kutholakala ku-motif enamathela kusisabeli ukuze isebenzelane nesisabeli se-ACE2.
en-mt: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to differ between human and civet virus isolates in the RBD of which 4 are found in the motif binding to the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: I-SARS-CoV ye-civet inoshintsho lwe-K479N kanye ne-S487T ku-RBD yayo, okungase kunyuse izinga lokuhlangana lokusebenzelana kwephrotheni ye-spike nesisabeli se-ACE2 yomuntu.
en-mt: The civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which may increase the rate of interaction of the spike protein with the human ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: Ngamanye amazwi, lolu shintsho lwama-amino acid amabili lungase lubaluleke ekuvumelanisweni kwegciwane kubantu.
en-mt: In other words, this change of two amino acids may be important for the adaptation of the virus to humans.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kuyaphawuleka ukuthi i-SARS-CoV-2 inesisabeli esifanayo seseli ne-SARS-CoV.
en-mt: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 has a similar cellular response to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: Umehluko ka-30% phakathi kwe-SARS-CoV-2 ne-SARS-CoV kuyunithi ye-S1 yephrotheni ka-S usho ukuthi izinga lokuhlangana lephrotheni lika-S ne-ACE2 yabantu kungenzeka ukuthi lishintshile.
en-mt: The 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 subunit of the S protein means that the degree of association of the S protein with human ACE2 may have changed.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: Empeleni, ucwaningo lwe-cryo-EM libonisa izinga eliphakeme lokugoqa okungu-10- ukuya ku-20- lalokhu kugoqa kunalokho okuphakathi kwe-ACE2 yabantu nephrotheni ka-S ye-SARS-CoV.
en-mt: In fact, cryo-EM studies show a 10- to 20-fold higher degree of this folding than that between human ACE2 and the S protein of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Kuzophinde futhi kuthakazelise ukunquma ukuthi ingabe iyadingeka yini enye i-coreceptor ekuthelelekeni kwe-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: It will also be interesting to determine whether another coreceptor is required for SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: Ngokuthakazelisayo, i-HCoV-NL63 iphinde inamathele ku-ACE2 kodwa ngengxenye ehlukile ka-S.
en-mt: Interestingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: Kukhona ezinye izisabeli ze-HCoV, njengama-aminopeptidase N e-HCoV-229E, kanye ne-9-O-acetylated sialic acid ye-HCoV-OC43.
en-mt: There are other HCoV antibodies, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Angase futhi abhekwe njengesizathu sokuzivumelanisa ngempumelelo kwama-CoV kubantu ngemva kokuthelelana kwezidalwa ezihlukene esuka kubabungazi bawo abayizilwane.
en-mt: They may also be considered as a reason for the successful adaptation of CoVs to humans after cross-infection from their animal hosts.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwezisabeli ezingamaseli, umphumela wokuthelelana kwezidalwa ezihlukene ngama-HCoV uphinde futhi ulawulwe ukuncika kwesinye isidalwa nezici zomkhawulo.
en-mt: In addition to cellular responses, the outcome of host infection with HCoVs is also controlled by host-to-host and host-specific factors.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: Ukwehluka kwalawa maphrotheni ombungazi phakathi kwabantu nababungazi abawumthombo ongokwemvelo wama-HCoV njengamalulwane, amakamela e-dromedary kanye namagundane kungase kubangele umngcele wokuthelelana kwezidalwa ezihlukene.
en-mt: Differences in these host proteins between humans and natural hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and mice may result in cross-species transmission.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: Ama-HCoV kufanele athathe izici zokuncika kumnikazi futhi aphazamise izici zokuvimvela kombungazi ukuze kube nokuthelelana kwezidalwa okuyimpumelelo.
en-mt: HCoVs must acquire host-dependent properties and disrupt host immunity for successful host transmission.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: Ngokuqondene nalokhu, izinqumi ezingamangqamuzana kule ndawo ebalulekile yokusebenzelana nombungazi wegciwane zisazobonwa futhi ziphawulwe.
en-mt: In this regard, the molecular determinants of this important site of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: Ukuhlungwa okubanzi kwe-genome okungachemile kokuncika kombungazi kanye nezici zokukhawulwa ze-SARS-CoV-2 ngokusebenzisa ubuchwepheshe besimanje be-CRISPR kungase kuzuzise.
en-mt: Genome-wide unbiased screening of host dependence and restriction factors of SARS-CoV-2 using modern CRISPR technology may be beneficial.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero
targetString: Ukuqhamuka kwama-HCoV amasha: ukubuyela ekuqaleni
en-mt: Emergence of new HCoVs: back to the beginning

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: Ukwehlukahluka kwama-CoV elulwane kunikeza amathuba amaningi okuvela kwama-HCoV amasha.
en-mt: The diversity of bat CoVs provides many opportunities for the emergence of new HCoVs.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: Ngalo mqondo, ama-CoV elulwane asebenza njengeqoqo lezakhi zofuzo zama-HCoV.
en-mt: In this sense, bat CoVs act as a genetic cluster for HCoVs.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, ushintsho olusheshayo kanye nokuhlanganiswa kabusha kwezakhi zofuzo kuphinde kuqhube ukuziphendukela kwe-HCoV futhi kusebenza njengezinyathelo ezimbili ezibalulekile kule nqubo.
en-mt: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive the evolution of HCoV and serve as two important steps in this process.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, ukutholwa noma ukulahleka kwezakhi zofuzo ezenza ikhodi yephrotheni entsha kunamandla okuwashintsha kakhulu ama-phenotype egciwane.
en-mt: For example, the acquisition or loss of genes that code for a new protein has the potential to significantly alter the phenotype of a virus.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: Phakathi kwamaphrotheni ayinsiza e-SARS-CoV, i-ORF8 kucatshangwa ukuthi ibalulekile ekuzivumelaniseni nabantu, njengoba amagciwane elulwane ahlobene ne-SARS-CoV ahlukaniswa kodwa atholwa ekhiqiza amaphrotheni e-ORF8 ahlukile.
en-mt: Among the accessory proteins of SARS-CoV, ORF8 is thought to be important for adaptation to humans, as bat viruses related to SARS-CoV were isolated but found to produce different ORF8 proteins.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: Isici sokususwa kwe-29-nucleotide sama-SARS-CoV sitholwe ezinhlotsheni ezihlukanisiwe ekuqaleni komqedazwe wabantu.
en-mt: A 29-nucleotide deletion feature of SARS-CoVs was detected in strains isolated at the beginning of the human pandemic.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: Lokhu kususwa kuhlukanisa i-ORF8 ibe i-ORF8a kanye ne-ORF8b futhi kucatshangwa ukuthi iwushintsho oluzivumelanisayo olukhuthaza ukushintshwa kwababungazi.
en-mt: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes host switching.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwalokho, i-SARS-CoV ingase ibe nomlando wokuhlanganiswa kabusha nezinhlu zama-CoV e-alpha kanye ne-gamma, lapho kwatholwa khona inani elikhulu lezindawo zokuhlanganiswe kabusha okuncane ku-RNA polymerase encike ku-RNA.
en-mt: Alternatively, SARS-CoV may have a history of recombination with alpha and gamma CoV lineages, where a large number of small recombination sites were found in RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: Izindawo zokuhlanganiswa kabusha zatholwa futhi ku-nsp9, engxenyeni enkulu ye-nsp10, nasezingxenyeni ze-nsp14.
en-mt: Recombination sites were also found in nsp9, in most of nsp10, and in parts of nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Ngokufanayo, kuye kwaboniswa ukuthi umqedazwe i-MERS-CoV yabhekana nezehlakalo zokuhlanganiswa kabusha phakathi kwezinhlu ezihlukene, okwenzeka kumakamela e-dromedary e-Saudi Arabia.
en-mt: Similarly, it has been shown that the MERS-CoV epidemic experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwe-SARS-CoV kanye ne-MERS-CoV, izehlakalo zokuhlanganiswa kabusha ziye zaphawulwa kwamanye ama-HCoV, lapho ama-HCoVs ehlangana kabusha namanye ama-CoV esilwane kuzakhi zawo zofuzo ezingenaso isakhiwo.
en-mt: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have been observed in other HCoVs, where HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: Kufanele futhi kuqashelwe ukuthi ukukhethwa kokwenziwa kungase kube nesandla ezinguqukweni ezingahlosiwe kuma-genome egciwane, okungase kube umphumela wokukhulula amagciwane ezingcindezeni zokukhetha ezisetshenzisiwe, njengalezo zamasosha omzimba zombungazi.
en-mt: It should also be noted that artificial selection may contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, which may result in releasing viruses from applied selective pressures, such as those of the host's immune system.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: Isibonelo sale miphumela siwukulahleka kwe-ORF4 enobude obuphelele kuhlobo lwephrothothayiphu ethi HCoV-229E, ngenxa yokususwa kwe-nucleotide ekabili.
en-mt: An example of these effects is the loss of full-length ORF4 in the prototype strain HCoV-229E, due to a double nucleotide deletion.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: Nakuba i-ORF4 ephelele yabonwa kumagciwane elulwane nekamela ahlobene ne-HCoV-229E, i-alpha-CoV ye-alpaca ibonisa ukufakwa kwe-nucleotide eyodwa, okuholela ekushintsheni kwefreyimu.
en-mt: While the complete ORF4 was observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV shows a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frame shift.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: Okokugcina kodwa okubalulekile, ukuziphendukela kwama-HCoV amasha kuphinde kuqhutshwe ingcindezi yokukhethwa kubabungazi bayo abawumthombo.
en-mt: Last but not least, the evolution of new HCoVs is also driven by selection pressure on their source hosts.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: Zazingekho izimpawu noma kwakunezimpawu ezincane kuphela ezitholiwe lapho amalulwane etheleleka ngama-CoV, okubonisa ukuvumelaniswa okufanayo phakathi kwama-CoV namalulwane.
en-mt: No symptoms or only minor symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating a similar interaction between CoVs and bats.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: Kubonakala sengathi amalulwane avumelaniswe kahle nama-CoV ngokwesakhiwo nendlela yokusebenza.
en-mt: Bats appear to be well adapted to CoVs structurally and functionally.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, ukuphazamiseka kokusetshenziswa kokusabela okukhuthaza ukuvuvukala kumalulwane kuyinciphisa kalula i-pathology eqaliswa ama-CoV.
en-mt: For example, disruption of the pro-inflammatory response in bats easily reduces the pathology induced by CoVs.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwalokho, umsebenzi weseli elingumbulali ongokwemvelo kumalulwane uyacindezelwa ngenxa yokwenyuka kokusabela kwesivimbi sesisabeli seseli elingumbulali ongokwemvelo elithi NKG2/CD94 kanye nezinga lokuboniswa eliphansi lamangqamuzana esigaba I esiyinkimbinkimbi se-histocompatibility.
en-mt: Additionally, natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to increased reactivity of the natural killer cell receptor inhibitor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of class I histocompatibility complex cells.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, izinga eliphakeme lezidalwa ezisabela kumoya-mpilo (i-ROS) ezakhiwe ngomsebenzi wokugaywa kokudla okuphakeme kwamalulwane kungase kuthinte kokubili ukucindezelwa kokuphindwa kwe-CoV futhi kuthinte ukuhlolwa kwamaphutha nge-exoribonuclease, ngaleyo ndlela kunikeza ingcindezi yokukhethwa yokwakhiwa kwezinhlobo zegciwane ezi-pathogenic kakhulu lapho zethulwa kumbungazi omusha.
en-mt: In addition, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) produced by the high digestive activity of bats may affect both the suppression of CoV replication and affect the evaluation of errors by exoribonuclease, thus providing a selection pressure for the creation of more pathogenic virus strains where introduced to the new host.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: Izinhlobo ze-CoV ezi-pathogenic kakhulu zingase futhi zishintshe ngokuhlanganiswa kabusha, okuholela ekutholweni kwamaphrotheni amasha noma izici zephrotheni zokuvumelaniswa kombungazi.
en-mt: Highly pathogenic CoV strains may also change by recombination, leading to the discovery of new proteins or protein features for host adaptation.

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: Ngenxa yalokho, akuyona nje inhlanhla ukuthi ama-HCoV amasha amathathu avele emashumini amabili eminyaka edlule.
en-mt: Consequently, it is no coincidence that three new HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: Ama-CoV awagulisani noma abangele izimpawu ezincane kubabungazi bawo abayinhloko njengamalulwane namakamela.
en-mt: CoVs do not infect or cause mild symptoms in their primary hosts such as bats and camels.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: Aphindeka ngokushesha ngaphandle kokukhuthaza ukusabela okuqinile kwamasosha omzimba.
en-mt: They recur quickly without stimulating a strong immune response.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: Lapha kunezimfihlo zokuthi kungani izithwali ezingenazo izimpawu zibonwa nokuthi yini ebangela izimo ezibucayi ekuguleni kwabantu.
en-mt: Here are the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes critical conditions in human illness.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: Izimpawu ezibucayi ngokuyinhloko zibangelwa ukusebenza kakhulu kwamasosha omzimba kanye nesiphepho se-cytokine lapho kunokusabela kwamasosha omzimba okuqinile, umonakalo wamaphaphu uba mkhulu kakhulu.
en-mt: Acute symptoms are mainly caused by overactive immune system and cytokine storm where there is a strong immune response, lung damage is more severe.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: Ngokuhlukile, kulabo abangazibonisi izimpawu zokugula, ukusabela kwamasosha omzimba kuye kwahlukaniswa kabili ekuphindweni kwe-CoV.
en-mt: In contrast, in those who do not show symptoms of illness, the immune response has been divided in two to CoV replication.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: Isu elifanayo lokuhlukanisa ukusabela kwamasosha omzimba lingase libe nemiphumela ezuzisayo ekwelashweni okumelene ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: A similar strategy to modulate the immune response may have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: Ukusabela kwe-interferon kuqine ngokukhethekile kumalulwane.
en-mt: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: Ngenxa yalokho, ukusetshenziswa kohlobo I lwe-interferon okungenani ezigabeni zokuqala zokutheleleka nge-SARS-CoV-2 kubantu kufanele kuzuzise.
en-mt: Consequently, the use of type I interferon at least in the early stages of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, ukusetshenziswa kwe-NLRP3 inflammasome kumalulwane akusebenzi.
en-mt: Furthermore, activation of the NLRP3 inflammasome in bats is inactive.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Ngokwalokhu kucabanga, ukuvinjwa kwe-NLRP3 inflammasome nge-MCC950 kungase kube usizo ekwelashweni kwe-COVID-19.
en-mt: According to this reasoning, inhibition of the NLRP3 inflammasome by MCC950 may be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: Ukuvela kwe-SARS-CoV-2 kulandela itimu evamile yokuvela kwe-SARS-CoV kanye ne-MERS-CoV.
en-mt: The evolution of SARS-CoV-2 follows the common theme of the evolution of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Nakuba kutholwe i-beta-CoV yelulwane eyabelana ngo-95% we-nucleotide homology ne-SARS-CoV, kukhona futhi i-CoV yelulwane eyabelana ngo-96% we-nucleotide homology ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: While a bat beta-CoV has been found that shares 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV, there is also a bat CoV that shares 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: Nakuba ama-civet nezinye izilwane ezimakethe kutholwe ukuthi zifukamela amagciwane afana ne-SARS-CoV, ababungazi abamaphakathi abaseduze be-SARS-CoV-2 abakatholwa.
en-mt: Although civets and other market animals have been found to harbor viruses similar to SARS-CoV, the closest intermediate hosts of SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kutholwe ama-beta-CoV e-pangolin anesakhiwo esifanayo ne-SARS-CoV-2, okubonisa ukuthi ama-pangolin kungenzeka ukuthi angabanye ababungazi abamaphakathi noma ama-beta-CoV ama-pangolin angase abe nesandla ezingxenyeni zezakhi zofuzo enguqulweni yokugcina ye-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Pangolin beta-CoVs have been found to have the same structure as SARS-CoV-2, indicating that pangolins may be other intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs may contribute to genetic components in the final version of SARS- CoV-2.

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: Yize imibuzo isamile, abukho ubufakazi bokuthi i-SARS-CoV-2 yakhiwe umuntu ngenhloso noma ngephutha.
en-mt: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 was created by man on purpose or by mistake.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ama-CoV abuyele eshashalazini ngenxa yokubheduka kwakamuva kwe-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: CoVs have returned to the theater due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: Ukucwaningwa kwama-CoV emalulwaneni nezinye izilwane kuwushintshe kakhulu umbono wethu wokubaluleka kwemisuka ye-zoonotic nemithombo eyizilwane yama-HCoV ekuthelelaneni kwabantu.
en-mt: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has significantly changed our view of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal sources of HCoVs in human infection.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: Ubufakazi obusakazekile bubonisa ukuthi i-SARS-CoV, i-MERS-CoV kanye ne-SARS-CoV-2 inomsuka oyilulwane futhi idluliselwa kubantu ngababungazi abamaphakathi.
en-mt: Anecdotal evidence suggests that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are of bat origin and are transmitted to humans by intermediate hosts.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: Njengoba ukutheleleka nge-SARS-CoV kusuka ekuthintaneni okuphakathi kwabantu nama-civet ezimakethe, ukuvala izimakethe zezilwane eziphilayo nokubulala ama-civet kwakungase kuqede umqedazwe we-SARS.
en-mt: Since SARS-CoV infection came from direct contact between humans and civets in markets, closing down live animal markets and killing civets could have ended the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ngokucabanga okufanayo, ama-pangolin kufanele akhishwe ezimakethe ezidayisa izinto eziphilayo ukuze kuvinjelwe ukutheleleka oku-zoonotic, kucatshangelwa ukutholwa kwezinhlu eziningi zama-beta-CoV e-pangolin ahlobene ngokuseduze ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from organic markets to prevent zoonotic infection, considering the discovery of multiple beta-CoV strains in pangolin closely related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: Nokho, ukuthi iyadluliselwa yini nokuthi idluliselwa kanjani i-SARS-CoV-2 kubantu ngama-pangolin nezinye izilwane ezincelisayo kusazocaciswa ezingcwaningweni zesikhathi esizayo.
en-mt: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans by pangolins and other mammals remains to be determined in future studies.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: Ngakolunye uhlangothi, i-MERS-CoV ibilokhu ikhona kumakamela e-dromedary isikhathi eside.
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been present in dromedary camels for a long time.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: Lawa makamela ayithuluzi elibalulekile lezokuthutha kanye nomthombo oyinhloko wenyama, ubusi, isikhumba nemikhiqizo kavolo kubantu basendaweni.
en-mt: These camels are an important means of transport and the main source of meat, honey, leather and wool products for the local people.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: Asakazeke kabanzi e-Middle East nase-Africa.
en-mt: Widespread in the Middle East and Africa.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ngakho kuyinto engenakwenzeka ukuthi kubulawe wonke amakamela ukuze kulawulwe i-MERS, njengoba kwenzeka ezimakethe zezilwane zasendle e-China ukuze kuvinjwe ukusakazeka kwe-SARS-CoV ne-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: So it is impossible to kill all the camels to control MERS, as is happening in the wild animal markets in China to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: Ukuze kuvinjwe ukubheduka okuphindayo kwe-MERS, kufanele kusetshenziswe indlela eningilizayo ukuze kwakhiwe imigomo esebenzayo emelene ne-MERS-CoV yamakamela, ehambisana nezinye izinyathelo zokulawula isifo.
en-mt: In order to prevent the re-emergence of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be used to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other disease control measures.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: Njengoba singakwazi ukuqeda lawa magciwane, ama-genotype amasha angase avele ukuze abangele ukubheduka.
en-mt: Since we cannot eradicate these viruses, new genotypes may emerge to cause outbreaks.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: Izinhlobonhlobo zama-CoV a-zoonotic ziyajikeleza ehlane.
en-mt: A variety of zoonotic CoVs circulate in the wild.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: Ngokukhethekile, ama-CoV elulwane anamandla e-zoonotic ahlukahlukene kakhulu.
en-mt: In particular, bat CoVs have highly variable zoonotic potential.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: Kukhona amathuba amaningi okuthi lawa ma-CoV e-zoonotic ashintshe futhi ahlangane kabusha, okuzophumela kuma-CoV amasha akwazi ukuthelelana kakhulu kanye/noma abulale abantu esikhathini esizayo.
en-mt: There is a high probability that these zoonotic CoVs will mutate and recombine, resulting in new CoVs that can become more infectious and/or lethal to humans in the future.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: Isiko lokudla izilwane zasendle kwezinye izindawo zase-China kufanele liyekwe ukuze kuncishiswe ukuxhumana okungadingekile phakathi kwabantu nezilwane.
en-mt: The practice of eating wild animals in some parts of China should be stopped to reduce unnecessary human-animal contact.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Ngezigameko ze-SARS, i-MERS kanye ne-COVID-19, kufanele kube khona uhlelo lokulungela nokusabela olungcono kakhulu.
en-mt: With SARS, MERS and COVID-19 incidents, there must be a better preparedness and response plan.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: Empeleni, amagciwane amaningi anesikhathi eside ekhona emhlabeni.
en-mt: In fact, many viruses have been around for a long time.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Ahlala ezindaweni zawo ezingokwemvelo kuze kube yilapho ethola ithuba lokuphuma.
en-mt: They stay in their natural habitats until they get a chance to get out.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Nakuba amalulwane enezici eziningi ezikhuthaza ukusakazwa kwamagciwane, ithuba lokuthi abantu baxhumane namalulwane nezinye izilwane zasendle angacishiswa uma abantu befundiswa ukuthi baqhele kuzona.
en-mt: Although bats have many characteristics that promote the transmission of pathogens, the opportunity for people to come into contact with bats and other wildlife can be reduced if people are taught to stay away from them.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: Ukugadwa okuqhubekayo kwezilwane ezincelisayo kuyadingeka ukuze kuqondwe kangcono i-ecology yama-CoV nababungazi bawo abangokwemvelo, okuzoba usizo ekuvimbeni ukutheleleka okusuka ezilwaneni kuye kubantu kanye nokubheduka kwesikhathi esizayo.
en-mt: Continued surveillance of mammals is needed to better understand the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will be helpful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Uma sesiphetha, indlela engcono kakhulu yokuvimba i-zoonosis yamagciwane iwukuba abantu baqhele endaweni ezungezile eyimithombo engokwemvelo yamagciwane a-zoonotic.
en-mt: In conclusion, the best way to prevent zoonotic diseases is to keep people away from environments that are natural sources of zoonotic diseases.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Izingxenye ezimbalwa ze-puzzle yomsuka we-zoonotic ye-SARS-CoV-2 azikatholakali.
en-mt: Several pieces of the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Okokuqala, uma amalulwane edlulisa igciwane eliwukhokho we-SARS-CoV-2 kuma-pangolin, kuzozuzisa ukubona ukuthi kungaphansi kwaziphi izimo amalulwane nama-pangolin engakwazi ukwabelana ngokufana kwendawo ezungezile.
en-mt: First, if bats transmit the ancestral SARS-CoV-2 virus to pangolins, it will be beneficial to see under what conditions bats and pangolins can share a similar environment.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Okwesibili, uma amalulwane edlala indima eqonde kakhulu ekuthelelekeni kwabantu, kufanele kutholwe ukuthi abantu baxhumana kanjani namalulwane.
en-mt: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human infection, how humans interact with bats must be determined.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Okwesithathu, uma isilwane esincelisayo sisebenza njengombungazi wangempela omaphakathi, indlela esisebenzelana ngayo nezidalwa ezihlukahlukene okuhlanganisa abantu, amalulwane nama-pangolin kufanele icaciswe.
en-mt: Third, if a mammal serves as a true intermediate host, how it interacts with a variety of organisms including humans, bats and pangolins must be elucidated.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: Okokugcina, njengoba izilwane eziningi ezincelisayo kuhlanganise nezilwane ezifuywayo zingase zichayeke ku-SARS-CoV-2, kokubili ukugadwa nokutheleleka kokucwaninga kufanele kwenziwe.
en-mt: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals may be exposed to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and infection research should be conducted.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Uma kungase kube ilulwane, i-pangolin noma esinye isilwane esincelisayo, kulindelwe ukuthi i-SARS-CoV-2 noma amagciwane ayo angumzali acishe afane azotholwa kumbungazi wawo ongokwemvelo esikhathini esizayo.
en-mt: If it could be a bat, pangolin or other mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its closely related parent viruses will be found in its natural host in the future.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Ukucwaningwa okuqhubekayo kule ndawo kuzochaza umzila wokuziphendukela kwe-SARS-CoV-2 ezilwaneni, nemiphumela ebalulekile ekuvinjweni naskulawulweni kwe-COVID-19 kubantu.
en-mt: Continued research in this area will define the evolution pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications for the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: Ukubuyekezwa kombandela wokuxilongwa kwalabo “abasolwa” futhi “abaqinisekisiwe” ukuthi baphethwe i-COVID-19 kuyadinga
en-mt: A review of the diagnostic criteria for those who are “suspected” and “confirmed” to be suffering from COVID-19 is required

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Ngo-6 February 2020, ithimba lethu lalishicilele umhlahlandlela weseluleko esisheshayo sokuxilongwa nokwelashwa kokutheleleka kwe-coronavirus entsha ka-2019 (2019-nCoV), futhi lo mhlahlandlela wanikeza okuhlangenwe nakho kwethu kanye nokwenza ireferensi efanele yokulwa lolu bhubhane lomhlaba wonke.
en-mt: On February 6, 2020, our team published a quick advice guide for the diagnosis and treatment of the new 2019 coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guide provided our experience and made the right reference to fight this global epidemic.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Nokho, isifo se-coronavirus sika-2019 (I-COVID-19) isifo esisha, ukuqapha nokuqonda kwethu kuyanyuka ngokusekelwe kucwaningo oluqhubekayo nokuhlangenwe nakho kwezinqubo zokwelashwa; yingakho, amasu okuxilongwa nokwelashwa eqhubeka ebuyekezwa njalo.
en-mt: However, the 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is a new disease, our vigilance and understanding is increasing based on ongoing research and clinical experience; therefore, diagnostic and treatment strategies are constantly being updated.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: Kule ncwadi, siphendule ukuphawula okukodwa okumayelana nomhlahlandlela wethu futhi sanikeza umbandela wokuhlonzwa omusha walabo “abasolwa” futhi “okuqinisekisiwe” ukuthi bayagula ngokuvumelana ne-Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (uhlelo lwesikhombisa) olukhishwa yi-National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
en-mt: In this letter, we responded to one of the comments regarding our guideline and provided a new identification criterion for those who are "suspected" and "confirmed" to be sick according to the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh edition) issued by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Ngo-December 2019, i-coronavirus entsha ka-2019 (2019-nCoV) yayibangele ukubheduka, manje okubizwa ngokusemthethweni ngokuthi i-coronavirus disease 2019 (I-COVID-19) futhi igciwane liqanjwe ngokuthi i-severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: In December 2019, the new 2019 coronavirus (2019-nCoV) had caused an outbreak, now officially called the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus was named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS -CoV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: Ngo-11 March 2020, i-WHO yabhekisela ku-COVID-19 njengobhubhane.
en-mt: On 11 March 2020, the WHO referred to COVID-19 as a pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
