targetString: Ukuze kuliwe nokutheleleka kwe-SARS-CoV-2, ithimba lethu lisungule umhlahlandlela wokusabela okusheshayo futhi ushicilelwe ku-inthanethi ku-Military Medical Research ngo-06 February 2020.
en-mt: To combat SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid response guide and it was published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: Ithole ukunakwa okukhulu kusukela yashicilelwa.
en-mt: It has received a lot of attention since its publication.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Qaphela nokho ukuthi i-COVID-19 iyisifo esisha, ukuqapha kanye nolwazi ngayo luya ngokuya lwanda ngokusekelwe kulokho okutholwa kucwaningo kanye nokuhlangenwe nakho kwezokwelashwa; yingakho, amasu okuxilongwa nokwelashwa eqhubeka ebuyekezwa.
en-mt: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, awareness and knowledge about it is increasing based on research findings and clinical experience; hence, diagnostic and treatment strategies are continuously updated.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo i-Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 eyakhishwa yi-National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), phakathi kuka-16 January 2020 kuya ku-3 March 2020, iye yakhipha imiqulu eyisikhombisa lapho ezinye izinto zishintshwe ngokuphawulekayo.
en-mt: For example the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), between 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020 , has released seven volumes where some things have been changed significantly.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Umhlahlandlela wethu wathola ukuphawula okuvela ku-Zhou et al., bethula isiphakamiso esilula samaphuzu ngokusekelwe kokuhlangenwe nakho kwabo.
en-mt: Our guide received comments from Zhou et al., presenting a simple suggestion of points based on their experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Umsebenzi wabo wengeza ubufakazi obusha womhlahlandlela wethu futhi wenza ukubhekisela okubalulekile kwalolu bhubhane emhlabeni kabanzi.
en-mt: Their work adds new evidence to our guide and makes an important reference to this epidemic in the world at large.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Siyawutusa umsebenzi wabo obalulekile futhi sidlulisa ukubonga kwethu.
en-mt: We appreciate their valuable work and express our gratitude.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Nokho, umebenzi wabo udinga ukubuyekezwa ngokuvumelana ne-Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Uhlelo lwesikhombisa locwaningo) yakamuva nezingcwaningo zakamuva.
en-mt: However, their manufacturer needs to be updated according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Seventh Research Edition) and the latest research.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Ngokohlelo lwesikhombisa (3 March 2020), ukuze kuqinisekiswe ukugulwa okusolwayo kudingeka ukuthi kuhlangniswe noma iyiphi into eyodwa yezici zomlando we-epidemiological nezinto ezimbili zokuboniswa kwezokwelshwa ukuze kwenziwe ukuhlaziywa okubanzi, noma idinga ukuhlangabezana nezinto ezintathu zokuboniswa kwezokwelashwa ezingenawo umlando ocacile we-epidemiological:
en-mt: According to the seventh edition (March 3, 2020), in order to confirm the suspected illness, it is necessary to combine any one of the characteristics of the epidemiological history with two clinical indicators for a comprehensive analysis, or it needs to meet three clinical indicators without a clear epidemiological history:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Umlando we-epidemiological: (1) umlando wokuvakashela noma wokuhlala edolobheni lase-Wuhan nezindawo ezizungezile, noma eminye imiphakathi lapho okubikwe khona ukugula kwe-COVID-19 ezinsukwini ezingu-14 ezidlule ngaphambi kokuqala kwezimpawu; (2) umlando wokuxhumana nabantu abatheleleke nge-SARS-CoV-2 (ngokuhlola kwe-nucleic acid okuphozithivu); (3) umlando wokuxhumana neziguli eziphethwe imfiva noma izimpawu zokuphefumula edolobheni lase-Wuhan nezindawo ezizungezile, noma eminye imiphakathi lapho kubikwe khona i-COVID-19 ezinsukwini ezingu-14 ngaphambi kokuqala kwezimpawu; (4) umlando wokuhlangana neziguli eziningi eziqinisekisiwe (iziguli ≥ ezingu-2 ezinemfiva kanye/noma izimpawu zokuphefumula ezivele phakathi namaviki angu-2 ezindaweni ezincane, njengasekhaya, ehhovisi, ekilasini lasesikoleni, njll).
en-mt: Epidemiological history: (1) history of visiting or living in the city of Wuhan and its surrounding areas, or other communities where a case of COVID-19 has been reported in the past 14 days before the onset of symptoms; (2) history of contact with persons infected with SARS-CoV-2 (by positive nucleic acid test); (3) history of contact with patients suffering from fever or respiratory symptoms in the city of Wuhan and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 has been reported in the 14 days before the onset of symptoms; (4) history of contact with multiple confirmed patients (≥ 2 patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms that appeared within 2 weeks in small places, such as home, office, school classroom, etc).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Ukubonakala kwezokwelashwa: (1) imfiva kanye/ noma izimpawu zokuphefumula; (2) ezinezici zomfanekiso wokutheleleka kwe-COVID-19; (3) ingqikithi yesibalo samaseli egazi amhlophe abonisa isibalo se-lymphocyte esivamile, esehlile, noma esinciphile esigabeni sokuqala.
en-mt: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/or respiratory symptoms; (2) with features typical of the infection of COVID-19; (3) total white blood cell count showing a normal, decreased, or decreased lymphocyte count at baseline.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Ukuxilongwa kokugula okuqinisekisiwe kufanele kusekelwe ekuguleni okusolwayo okunento eyodwa yobufakazi obulandelayo be-pathogenic noma be-serological: (1) ukuhlola okuphozithivu kwe-PCR yesikhathi sangempela se-SARS-CoV-2; (2) ukulandelana kwe-genome ephelele yegciwane okubonisa i-homogeneity ephakeme kumagciwane aziwayo e-coronavirus entsha; (3) ukuba phozithivu ngokuba nesivikeli-mzimba esiqondile se-IgM kanye nesivikeli-mzimba se-IgG ye-SARS-CoV-2 ekuhloleni kwe-serum; noma ushintsho lwesivikeli-mzimba esiqondile se-IgG ye-SARS-CoV-2 esisuka kuphozithivu siye kunegethivu, noma i-titer ekhula izikhathi ezingu-≥4 esigabeni sokululama esingaphezu kwaleso sesigaba esibucayi.
en-mt: The diagnosis of a confirmed illness must be based on a suspected illness with one of the following pathogenic or serological evidence: (1) a positive real-time PCR test for SARS-CoV-2; (2) the sequence of the complete genome of the virus showing high homogeneity in the known viruses of the new coronavirus; (3) being positive by having specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody for SARS-CoV-2 in the serum test; or a change in SARS-CoV-2 specific IgG antibody from positive to negative, or a titer that increases ≥4 times in the recovery phase over that of the acute phase.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Siyabona ukuthi ukuhlola kwesikhathi sangempela kwe-PCR ye-nucleic acid kumgudu wokuphefumula noma kumasampula egazi sengezwe ezinhlelweni zesibili (18 January 2020) nezesithathu (22 January 2020).
en-mt: We see that real-time testing of nucleic acid PCR in respiratory tract or blood samples has been added in the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) programs.

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: Ukutholwa oku-pathogenic kwesampula legazi kwengezwe ezinhlelweni zesine (27 January 2020) nezesihlanu (8 February 2020); futhi ubufakazi be-serological bufakwe ohlelweni lwesikhombisa.
en-mt: Pathogenic detection of the blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) programs; and serological evidence is included in the seventh edition.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Lezi zinguquko ezisekelwe kumsebenzi oqhubekayo wabacwaningi wokucinga ikhithi yokutholwa kwe-nucleic acid ephakeme yokuxilongwa okusheshayo, kanye namasampula omgudu wokuphefumula okuhlanganisa isampula legazi, okunyuse ukutholakala kwezicubu ezihlukene, futhi kwasekela ukulethwa komphumela ophozithivu wesivikeli-mzimba esithile kumbandela oqinisekisiwe.
en-mt: These changes are based on the ongoing work of researchers to search for a kit for the detection of high-quality nucleic acid for rapid diagnosis, and for respiratory tract samples including a blood sample, which increased the availability of different tissues, and supported the delivery of a positive result of a certain antibody in a confirmed condition.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwalokho, kukhona ubufakazi obengeziwe obusikhumbuza ukuthi siqaphe ngeziguli ezinezimpawu ezingavamile nalezo ezingenazo izimpawu.
en-mt: Besides, there is more evidence to remind us to be careful with patients with unusual symptoms and those without symptoms.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Yingakho, ishadi lokugeleza le-Zhou et al. kufanele libuyekezwe, njengoba libhekisela kumuntu ongenazo izimpawu zokwelashwa “njengosengozini ephansi”.
en-mt: Therefore, the flow chart of Zhou et al. it should be revised, as it refers to a person without clinical symptoms as "low risk".

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: Inqubo yamaphuzu nayo idinga ukuqinisekiswa emsebenzini nasezifundweni zokwelapha eziqhubekahyo.
en-mt: The scoring process also needs to be validated in practice and in ongoing clinical studies.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Ekuphetheni, sithemba ukuthi kunobufakazi obengeziwe obuzayo futhi sicela ukuthi abafundi baphawule.
en-mt: In conclusion, we hope that there is more evidence to come and we ask that readers comment.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Ukuze kwenziwe ukuxilongwa “kokugula okusolwayo” kanye “nokugula okuqinisekisiwe”, situsa ukuthi kulandelelwe futhi kulalelwe imihlahlandlela emisha yamazwe ekhaya labo.
en-mt: In order to make a diagnosis of "suspected illness" and "confirmed illness", we recommend to follow and listen to the new guidelines of the countries in their home.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Ithimba lethu lizophinde futhi libuyekeze umhlahlandlela wethu ukuze sinikeze usizo.
en-mt: Our team will also update our guide to provide assistance.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: I-Bangladesh ibike ukufa okusha okuyisihlanu okubangelwe i-COVID-19, inani eliphakeme kakhulu losuku
en-mt: Bangladesh reported five new deaths due to COVID-19, the highest number of the day

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Izolo, i-Bangladesh iqinisekise ukufa okusha okuyisihlanu okubangelwe i-COVID-19 ngalolo suku.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 that day.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Leli inani eliphakeme kunawo wonke losuku elibangelwe igciwane.
en-mt: This is the highest number of the day caused by the virus.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: Kusukela izolo, i-Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, i-Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) ibike ukuthi inani elibikiwe labantu abagulayo lingu-114 kanye nabangu-33 abaluleme abahlezi ekhaya.
en-mt: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported that the reported number of sick people is 114 and 33 recovered people are staying at home.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Kurekhodwe ingqikithi yabantu abangu-17 abafile.
en-mt: A total of 17 deaths were recorded.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Esithangameni sezindaba ze-inthanethi, umqondisi we-IEDCR, uDkt. Meerjady Sabrina Flora, uthe abantu abashonile bahlanganisa abantu besilisa abane kanye nowesifazane oyedwa.
en-mt: In an online news conference, the director of IEDCR, Dr. Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the dead included four men and one woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: Ngokusho kukaDkt. Meerjady, ababili bebeneminyaka engaphezu kuka-60, ababili bebephakathi kuka-51 no-60, futhi oyedwa ubephakathi kuka-41-50.
en-mt: According to Dr. Meerjady, two were over 60, two were between 51 and 60, and one was between 41-50.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Uphinde wathi ababili bebeqhamuka e-Dhaka.
en-mt: He also said that two were from Dhaka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: I-World Health Organization (WHO) imemezele ukuthi i-COVID-19 iwubhubhane ngo-March 11.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Isikhulu sasesibhedlela sitshele i-Anadolu Agency, umthombo wezindaba wasendaweni, ukuthi omunye wabashonile bekungu-Jalal Saifur Rahman, umqondisi we-Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, owanakekelwa e-Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
en-mt: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news source, that one of the dead was Jalal Saifur Rahman, director of the Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was treated at Kuwait Maitree Hospital.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: NgoMgqibelo, kusimemezelo sevidiyo ye-inthanethi, Ungqongqoshe wase-Bangladesh Wezokuthutha Zomgwaqo u-Obaidul Quader uthe ezokuthutha zomphakathi zizovalwa isikhathi eside kunaleso esihleliwe, kuze kube yilo Mgqibelo ozayo.
en-mt: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladesh's Minister of Road Transport Obaidul Quader said that public transport will be closed for longer than planned, until this coming Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Lokhu kuvalwa kwezithuthi zomphakathi kwakuqale ngo-March 26 futhi bekuhlelwe ukuthi kuzophela ngoMgqibelo, April 4.
en-mt: This closure of public transport started on March 26 and was scheduled to end on Saturday, April 4.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: Ukuthuthwa kwezimpahla ezibalulekile -- ezokwelashwa, uphethiloli nokudla -- kusavunyelwe.
en-mt: Transport of essential goods -- medical supplies, fuel and food -- is still allowed.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: Izigameko zokuqala ezirekhodiwe zesifo se-COVID-19 e-Bangladesh zaba ngo-March 8, kubantu ababili ababuya bevela e-Italy kanye nonkosikazi womunye wabo.
en-mt: The first recorded cases of the COVID-19 disease in Bangladesh occurred on March 8, in two people returning from Italy and the wife of one of them.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: Ngo-March 19, laba abathathu basebeluleme kakade.
en-mt: By March 19, the three had already recovered.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: Inani labaphethwe i-SARS-CoV-2 lidlula isigidi esisodwa emhlabeni jikelele
en-mt: The number of people infected with SARS-CoV-2 exceeds one million worldwide

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: NgoLwesine, ingqikithi yenani labantu abaphethwe i-SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus ladlula isigidi esisodwa emhlabeni jikelele, ngokusho kwedatha ye-Johns Hopkins University.
en-mt: On Thursday, the total number of people infected with the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus exceeded one million worldwide, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Okungenani ukufa okuyizinkulungwane ezingu-52 kwahlotshaniswa ne-COVID-19, ukugula okubangelwa i-coronavirus.
en-mt: At least 52 thousand deaths were associated with COVID-19, the illness caused by the coronavirus.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Lokhu kwenzeke ngosuku olufanayo lapho i-Malawi iqinisekise ukugula kwayo kokuqala okubangelwe i-coronavirus futhi i-Zambia ibe nokufa kwayo kokuqala okuhlobene ne-coronavirus.
en-mt: This happened on the same day that Malawi confirmed its first illness caused by the coronavirus and Zambia had its first death related to the coronavirus.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: I-North Korea ithe, kusukela ngoLwesine, ingelinye lamazwe ambalwa angenaso isifo se-coronavirus.
en-mt: North Korea has said, as of Thursday, that it is one of the few countries that does not have a case of the coronavirus.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Ngayizolo, i-World Health Organization ifake umbiko wokugula okuqinisekisiwe okungu-1,051,635, okuhlanganisa ukugula okungu-79,332 emahoreni angamashumi amabili nane angaphambi kuka-10 a.m. ngokwe-Central European Europe (0800 UTC) ngo-April 4.
en-mt: The day before, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed illnesses, including 79,332 illnesses in the twenty-four hours before 10 am according to Central European Europe (0800 UTC) on April 4.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: E-United States, kurekhodwe ukugula okubangelwa i-coronavirus okungaphezu kwezinkulungwane ezingu-244, okuhlobene nokufa okucishe kube ngu-5,900.
en-mt: In the United States, more than 244,000 coronavirus-related illnesses have been recorded, with nearly 5,900 deaths.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: I-CBS News ibike, icaphuna idatha ye-Johns Hopkins University, ukuthi kube khona ukufa okungaphezu kuka-1,000 e-US ngoLwesithathu okubangelwe ukutheleleka kwe-coronavirus.
en-mt: CBS News reported, citing data from Johns Hopkins University, that there were more than 1,000 deaths in the US on Wednesday caused by the coronavirus infection.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: Emhlabeni jikelele, amazwe amemezele izinyathelo eziqinile zokuvimbela ukubhebhetheka kwesifo.
en-mt: Around the world, countries have announced strict measures to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: NgoLwesine, u-Sergei Sobyanin, usodolobha wase-Moscow, unwebe ukuvalwa thaqa kwedolobha kuze kube u-May 1.
en-mt: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city's lockdown until May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: Ezweni kabanzi, Umongameli u-Vladimir Putin umemezele ukuthi abantu base-Russia bazoqhubeka beholelwa ngaphandle kokuya emsebenzini kuze kube u-April 30.
en-mt: In the wider world, President Vladimir Putin has announced that Russians will continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: Iphalamende lase-Portugal livotele ukunweba isimo esiphuthumayo sikazwelonke ngezinsuku ezingu-15; ivoti liphasiswe amavoti angu-215 abantu abavumile, abayishumi abavotanga, futhi oyedwa ubenevoti elimelene nalokhu.
en-mt: Portugal's parliament voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote was passed with 215 votes for, ten against, and one against.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: I-Saudi Arabia inwebe isikhathi sokubuya ekhaya sasemadolobheni angcwele ase-Mecca nase-Medina ukuze siqhubeke usuku lonke; ngaphambilini, isikhathi sokubuyela ekhaya besiphakathi kuka-3 p.m. no-6 a.m.
en-mt: Saudi Arabia has extended the curfew of the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last all day; previously, the time to return home was between 3 pm and 6 am

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: I-Thailand ihlela ukusebenzisa isikhathi sokubuyela ekhaya esiphakathi kuka-10 p.m. no-4 a.m.
en-mt: Thailand plans to use a curfew between 10 pm and 4 am

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: Umbusi wase-Ohio, u-Mike DeWine, umemezele ukuthi isifundazwe silule umthetho waso wokuhlala ekhaya kuze kube u-May 1.
en-mt: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced that the state has extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Izitolo e-Australia zinciphise imikhawulo yokuthenga iphepha lasendlini encane ekuthengeni ngakunye
en-mt: Stores in Australia have reduced the limits of buying toilet paper for each purchase

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: NgeSonto nangoMgqibelo kusihlwa, inxanxathela yezitolo zase-Australia u-Woolworths no-Coles unciphise umkhawulo waso wokuthengwa kwephepha lendlu yangasese ukuze umuntu athenge amabili kanye nephakethe elilodwa ekuthengeni ngakunye esitolo ezweni lonke, ngokulandelana.
en-mt: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian supermarkets Woolworths and Coles reduced their toilet paper purchase limit to two and one pack per store nationwide, respectively.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: U-ALDI uphinde wethula umkhawulo wephakethe elilodwa, ngoMsombuluko.
en-mt: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: Le mikhawulo iphostwe njengemiyalezo ekuphumeni, nasemakhasini e-Facebook alesi sitolo.
en-mt: These restrictions are posted as messages at checkout, and on the store's Facebook pages.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Abathengi bebeqhubeka bewathenga inqwaba yawo ngenxa yokwesaba i-COVID-19 uma kwenzeka kudingeka ukuthi bazihlukanise.
en-mt: Consumers continued to stockpile them for fear of COVID-19 in case they needed to self-isolate.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: NgoLwesithathu, u-Woolworths uphinde wakhawula ukuthengwa kwephepha lendlu yangasese kulabo abalethelwa ekhaya ukuze kube iphekhi eyodwa nge-oda ngalinye.
en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited home delivery toilet paper purchases to one pack per order.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Lezi zinguquko zilandela ezangaphambilini zomkhawulo wamaphekhi amane ekuthengeni ngakunye owethulwe u-Woolworths no-Coles ngo-March 4 no-5.
en-mt: The changes follow previous four-pack limits per purchase introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: U-Coles, kusitatimende sayo sezindaba sango-March 8, yabika ukuthi ngomkhawulo wamaphekhi amane obekiwe, "izitolo eziningi zisaphelelwa impahla cishe ngemva kwehora lokulethwa kwayo", futhi ibize isidingo "esingenakuqhathaniswa", kuyilapho u-ALDI, kuphosti yayo ye-Facebook ngoLwesibili, ithe "okungalindelekile".
en-mt: Coles, in its March 8 press release, reported that with the four-pack limit imposed, "many stores are still out of stock almost an hour after delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in its Facebook post on Tuesday, it said "unexpected".

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: Ukudayiswa "kunyuke kakhulu" ngeviki elidlule, ngokusho komkhulumeli wakwa-Woolworths.
en-mt: Sales were "significantly up" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesman.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: Isitolo sakwa-Costco e-Canberra naso siphinde sakhawula inani elivunyelwe ukuze libe amaphekhi amabili ngeviki elidlule.
en-mt: A Costco store in Canberra also limited the quantity allowed to two packs last week.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Ukuze kubhekwane nokushoda, u-Coles u-ode amaphakheji amakhulu kakhulu kubahlinzeki futhi wamemezela nokwanda kokudilivwa, u-Woolworths u-ode isitokwe esengeziwe, kuyilapho u-ALDI enze izitokwe zesipesheli esihleliwe sangoLwesithathu ukuthi sitholakale ngokushesha.
en-mt: To deal with the shortage, Coles ordered larger packages from suppliers and announced increased deliveries, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for Wednesday's planned special available immediately.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: U-Russell Zimmerman, umqondisi ophezulu we-Australian Retailers Association, uthe abadayisi bayazama ukunyusa isitokwe, kodwa imikhawulo yomkhandlu wendawo ephathelene nesikhathi sokudiliva kwamaloli kwenza izinto zibe nzima.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, senior director of the Australian Retailers Association, said retailers were trying to increase stock, but local council restrictions on truck delivery times were making things difficult.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Ulindele ukuthi izindleko zokukhiqiza zinyuke, njengoba abahlinzeki bezama ukuhlangabezana nesidingo, nezipesheli ezimbalwa.
en-mt: He expects production costs to rise, as suppliers try to meet demand, with fewer offers.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: NgoLwesibili, u-ALDI wamemezela ukuthi ngenxa yokukhululwa ngokushesha kwesitokwe, ezinye izitolo azikwazi ukuqhubeka nesipesheli sangoLwesithathu.
en-mt: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that due to the immediate release of stock, some stores could not continue the Wednesday special.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: Kumbiko we-News.com.au, uDkt. Gary Mortimer, uchwepheshe wezokudayisa wase-Queensland University of Technology, uthe izitolo zigcwalisa isitokwe njalo ngobusuku.
en-mt: In a News.com.au report, Dr. Gary Mortimer, a retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said stores were restocking every night.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Uphawule wathi iphepha lasendlini encane liyinto enesisindo, okuholela ekutheni kube nenani eliphansi lezitokwe uma kuziwa ngokwezinombolo, futhi, uma seliphelile, lishiya isikhala esikhulu sivulekile, okuqinisa umuzwa wokuthi liyanquleka.
en-mt: He noted that small household paper is a heavy item, which leads to a low number of stocks when it comes to numbers, and, when it's gone, it leaves a lot of space open, which reinforces the feeling that it is missing.

sourceString: Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: U-Coles no-Woolworths banombono [othi] uma bekukhona izinto eziningi kumashalofu, uma umkhiqizo ofana namaroli ephepha lasendlini encane kanye nesanithayiza kungase [kuthengwe] futhi kukhona ngobuningi, cishe unganciphisa uvalo kusho u-Russell Zimmerman ngokwe-ABC News.
en-mt: Coles and Woolworths have an idea [that] if there were more things on the shelves, if products like toilet paper rolls and toilet paper could be [purchased] and there is more, it would probably reduce panic said Russell Zimmerman according to ABC News.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: Umkhiqizi wephepha langasese elikhiqizwe kabusha i-Who Gives a Crap uthe ngoLwesithathu bese bephelelwe isitokwe.
en-mt: The manufacturer of recycled toilet paper Who Gives a Crap said on Wednesday they were out of stock.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: U-Kimberly-Clark, owenza i-Kleenex Toilet Tissue, kanye no-Solaris Paper eyenza i-Sorbent, ugcizelele ukuthi basebenza u-24/7 ukuze bagcine umkhiqizo ukhona, ngokusho kombiko we-News.com.au.
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, insisted they are working 24/7 to keep the product available, according to a report by News.com.au.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: I-Domain.com, isayithi yokudayiswa kwezindlu, ibike ukuthi abanye abadayisi bezindlu banikeza iphepha lamahhala kumuntu wokuqala obhidile kuma-auction e-Melbourne, lapho kuqhutshwa ama-auction ambalwa ngenxa yokuthi abathengi banesikhathi sokuphumula ngenxa yempelaviki ende ye-Labour Day.
en-mt: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported that some real estate agents are offering free papers to the first bidder at auctions in Melbourne, where fewer auctions are being held because buyers have time off due to the Labor Day long weekend.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: Inguqulo yangoLwesine ye-NT News, iphephandaba elishicilelwa nsuku zonke lase-Darwin, lafaka isithasiselo esinamakhasi ayisishiyagalombli ahloselwe ukusikwa futhi asetshenziswe njengephepha langasese.
en-mt: Thursday's edition of the NT News, Darwin's daily newspaper, included a supplement with pages of parchment intended to be cut out and used as toilet paper.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Izitolo ziqale zangabaza ukubeka imikhawulo, ngokusho kombiko we-ABC Australia ngo-March 3 lapho zathi azinazo izinhlelo zokwethula imikhawulo yokuthenga.
en-mt: Stores initially hesitated to impose restrictions, according to a report by ABC Australia on March 3 when they said they had no plans to introduce shopping restrictions.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: U-Russell Zimmerman wengeze ukuthi eminye imikhiqizo nayo inesidingo esiphezulu, okuhlanganisa amamaski, amasanithayiza, ukudla okomisiwe, insipho yokuwasha nofulawa.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitizers, dried foods, laundry soap and flour.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: Ngokufanayo, ngaphandle kwase-Australia, ngeSonto ebusuku i-supermarket edayisa ku-inthanethi yase-Britain i-Ocado yabonwa ikhawula ukuthengwa kwephepha langasese i-Andres ukuze kube kubili kuphekhi enamaroli angu-12.
en-mt: Similarly, outside Australia, on Sunday night British online supermarket Ocado was seen limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two in a pack of 12 rolls.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: I-World Health Organization ibiza i-COVID-19 ngobhubhane
en-mt: The World Health Organization is calling COVID-19 a pandemic

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Ngolwesithathu, i-World Health Organization (WHO) ibize uqubuko oluqhubekayo lwe-COVID-19 — isifo esibangelwa i-coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — ubhubhane.
en-mt: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) called the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — a pandemic.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Yize igama elithi "ubhubhane" lubhekisela ezingeni isifo esisaphazeke ngayo, hhayi endleleni izibonelo eziqondile eziyingozi ngayo, u-WHO ubonise ukunakekela isidingo sokuqhuba ohulumeni ekuthatheni isinyathelo:
en-mt: Although the word "epidemic" refers to the extent to which the disease has spread, not to how dangerous specific examples are, the WHO has shown concern for the need to drive governments to take action:

sourceString: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: Wonke amazwe asangakwazi ukushintsha inqubo yalo bhubhane.
en-mt: All countries can still change the course of the epidemic.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: Uma amazwe ephenya, ehlola, elapha, ehlukanisa, elandelela futhi esabela ngokulawula iminyakazo yabantu, kusho u-Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Umqondisi-Ophethe we-WHO.
en-mt: When countries investigate, test, treat, isolate, track and respond by controlling people's movements, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO Executive Director.

sourceString: We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction.
targetString: Sikhathazeke kakhulu ngakho kokubili ukusabalala okusemazingeni athusayo nanzima kanye nokuntuleka komnyakazo okusemazingeni athusayo.
en-mt: We are deeply concerned about both the alarming and severe proliferation and the alarming lack of movement.

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: Ngokusho kuka-Dr. Tom Frieden, obengumqondisi odlule we-United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, ubhubhane "alunasiqhathaniso sangaphambili."
en-mt: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, former director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, said the epidemic was "unprecedented."

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Wathi, ngokuphawula okumenyezelwe ku-CNN ngo-February, "ngaphandle kwemfuluwenza, alikho elinye igciwane lokuphefumula elilandelelwe kusukela livela kuze kube yilapho libhebhetheka umhlaba wonke."
en-mt: He said, in comments broadcast on CNN in February, "except for the flu, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from its emergence to its global spread."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: U-Ghebreyesus uveze umbono ofanayo, ethi "asikaze sibone ngaphambili ubhubhane olususwe inhlansi ye-coronavirus."
en-mt: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar opinion, saying that "we have never seen before an epidemic that was sparked by the coronavirus."

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: Uqhubekile, "futhi askikaze ngaphambili sibone ubhubhane olungalawuleka ngesikhathi esifanayo."
en-mt: He continued, "and we have never before seen an epidemic that can be controlled at the same time."

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: Isimo esisha sobhubhane silandela isinqumo sika-WHO's sango-January sokubiza uqubuko njengenkathazo yomhlaba wonke yesimo esiphuthumayo sempilo yomphakathi.
en-mt: The new pandemic status follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a global public health emergency.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: Umqondisi we-United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's, u-Dr. Anthony Fauci, uthe ngokuqubuka, "okusalayo, kusazoba kubi nakakhulu."
en-mt: The director of the United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "the rest, it's going to get worse."

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: Kusukela Ngolwesine, i-Associated Press ibike ukuthi kube nezibonelo okungenani ezingu-126,000 ze-COVID-19 umhlaba wonke, okuholele ngaphezu kuka-4,600 wabafile.
en-mt: As of Thursday, the Associated Press reported that there have been at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in more than 4,600 deaths.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Ubhubhane lwe-2019–20 coronavirus lingubhubhane oluqhubekayo lwesifo se-coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19), olubangelwa i-severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Ukuqubuka kwakhonjwa e-Wuhan, China, ngo-December 2019, kwameyezelwa ngokuthi Isimo Esiphuthumayo Sempilo Yomphakathi Emazweni Onke Esikhathazayo ngo-30 January 2020, futhi sabhekwa njengobhubhane ngo-11 March 2020.
en-mt: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and declared a pandemic on 11 March 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-10 April 2020, izibonelo ezinembile eziyizigidi ezingu 1.61 ze-COVID-19 ziye zabikwa emazweni nemingcele angu-210, okuholela kwabangu-97,000 abafile ngokuqiniseka.
en-mt: As of 10 April 2020, 1.61 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in 97,000 confirmed deaths.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Abantu abangaba ngu-364,000 balulamile.
en-mt: About 364,000 people have recovered.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: Inani lezibonelo zokubhubha liye lalinganiselwa ku-4% e-China, ngesikhathi esifanayo ezembulunga zisuka ku-13.04% e-Algeria kuye ku-.08% e-New Zealand.
en-mt: The number of examples of death has been estimated at 4% in China, while at the same time it has gone from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Izimpawu ezivamile zihlanganisa ukushisa, ukukhwehlela nokuphelelwa umoya.
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Izinkinga zingase zihlanganise i-pneumonia ne-acute respiratory distress syndrome.
en-mt: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Isikhathi sokuchayeka kuya kwesibonisa izimpawu ngokuvamile siba ezinsukwini ezinhlanu, kodwa kungadonsa kusuka kwezimbili kuye kweziyishumi nane.
en-mt: The time from exposure to symptoms is usually five days, but can last from two to fourteen.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Alikho ikhambi elaziwayo noma inqubo yokwelapha enganqoba igciwane.
en-mt: There is no known cure or treatment that can defeat the virus.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: Indlela yokwelapha emqoka ebheka izimpawu nokunakekela okusizayo. Izindlela zokuvikela eziphakanyisiwe zihlanganisa ukuhlanza izandla, ukumboza umlomo lapho ukhwehlela, ukugcina ibanga phakathi kwakho nabanye, nokuqapha nokuzihlukanisa kubantu abasola ukuthi kungenzeka bathelelekile.
en-mt: The primary treatment approach focuses on symptoms and supportive care. Recommended preventive measures include washing your hands, covering your mouth when you cough, keeping a distance from yourself and others, and being careful and isolating yourself from people you suspect may be infected.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: Amagunya emhlabeni wonke sebesabele ngokubeka imingcele kwezokuhamba, ukuhlukaniswa, izikhathi zokunyakaza, izinyathelo ezilawula ubungozi ezindaweni zokusebenza, nokuvalwa kwezindawo.
en-mt: Authorities around the world have responded by imposing travel restrictions, isolation, movement times, risk management measures in workplaces, and closures.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: Lolu bhubhane seluholele ekuphazamisekeni okunzima komnotho nenhlalo emhlabeni wonke, ukuhlehliswa noma ukukhanselwa kwezemidlalo, ezenkolo, ezombangazwe nezenzakalo zamasiko, kanye nokuntuleka okusabalele kwezinto eziyisidingo eziqedwe ukuthenga ngamawala.
en-mt: The pandemic has led to severe economic and social disruption around the world, the postponement or cancellation of sports, religious, political and cultural events, as well as widespread shortages of basic necessities due to impulse buying.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Izikole kuhlanganise amavasithi zivaliwe izwe lonke noma emazweni angu 193, okuthinta amaphesenti angu-99.4 ngokunembile weningi labafundi umhlaba wonke.
en-mt: Schools including universities are closed all over the country or in 193 countries, which affects exactly 99.4 percent of the majority of students worldwide.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: Ulwazi oluyiphutha mayelana negciwane sekusabalele ku-inthanethi, futhi sekube khona nezimo zikucwasa ngobuzwe nokubandlululwa kwabantu base-China, nabanye abantu abavela Empumalanga nabozalo nokubukeka kwasemazweni Enyakatho ye-Asia, nabanye abavela ezindawe ezinezibonelo eziningi zegciwane.
en-mt: Misinformation about the virus has spread on the Internet, and there have been cases of ethnic discrimination and discrimination against Chinese people, other people from the East and North Asian countries, and others from places with many examples of the virus.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Ngenxa kokuncishiswa kwezinga kwezokuhamba nokuvalwa kwezimboni ezinkulu, kube khona ukuncipha ekungcolisweni komoya nama-carbon emissions.
en-mt: Due to the reduction in traffic and the closure of large factories, there has been a reduction in air pollution and carbon emissions.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Amagunya kwezempilo e-Wuhan, China (inhloko-dolobha yesifunda sase-Hubei) ibike uxhaxha lwezibonelo zenyumoniya ezinomsuka ongaziwa ngo-31 December 2019, kanti uphenyo lwavulwa ekuqaleni kuka-January 2020.
en-mt: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a series of pneumonia cases of unknown origin on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was opened in early January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Izibonelo eziningi bezihlobene ne-Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market ngakho igciwane licabangelwa ukuba nomsuka ovela ngokuthathelwa esilwaneni.
en-mt: Most of the samples were related to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market so the virus is believed to have an animal origin.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: Igciwane elibangele ukuqubuka laziwa ngokuthi i-SARS-CoV-2, igciwane eliqalayo ukuvela elihlobene eduze nama-coronaviruses elulwane, ama-coronaviruses e-pangolin, ne-SARS-CoV. Umuntu wokuqala owaziwayo owakhombisa izimpawu kwatholakala kamuva ukuthi waqala ukugula ngo-1 December 2019, futhi lowo muntu akazange neze abe nokuhlobana okusobala noxhaxha lwe-wet market.
en-mt: The virus causing the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, an emerging virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV. The first known person to show symptoms was later found to have become ill on 1 December 2019, and that person had no apparent connection to the wet market chain.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Kuxhaxha lokuqala lwezibonelo ezabikwa ngo-December 2019, Izingxenye ezintathu zatholakala zixhuma emakethe.
en-mt: In the first series of examples reported in December 2019, three parts were found connecting to the market.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: Ngomhlaka-13 March 2020, umbiko ongaqinisekisiwe ovela ku-South China Morning Post waphakamisa ukuthi isibonelo esilandelela emuva ku-17 November 2019, somuntu weminyaka engu-55 ubudala wesifundazwe sase-Hubei, singase sibe esokuqala. Ngomhlaka-26 February 2020, i-WHO yabika ukuthi, njengoba izibonelo ezintsha zibikwa zincipha e-China kodwa zikhula ngamawala e-Italy, e-Iran, nase-South Korea, isibalo sezibonelo ezintsha ezingaphandle kwe-China bese zisedlulile isibalo sezibonelo ezintsha zase-China okokuqala.
en-mt: On 13 March 2020, an unconfirmed report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case tracing back to 17 November 2019, of a 55-year-old man from Hubei province, may be the first. On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases are reported to be decreasing in China but increasing rapidly in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside of China has surpassed the number of new cases in China for the first time.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Kungenzeka kube nokubika ngaphansi kwezibonelo, ikakhulukazi phakathi kwalabo abanezimpawu ezisivivi.
en-mt: There may be under-reporting of specimens, especially among those with mild symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Ngo-26 February, izibonelo ezincane zase zibikiwe phakathi kwentsha, labo abono-19 nangaphansi bakha u-2.4% wezibonelo umhlaba wonke. Umeluleki oyinhloko wesayensi wase-United Kingdom's, u-Patrick Vallance, walinginasela u-60% womphakathi wase-British uzodinga ukutheleleka ukuze i-effective herd immunity izofinyeleleka.
en-mt: As of 26 February, fewer cases had been reported among young people, with those aged 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide. The United Kingdom's chief scientific advisor, Patrick Vallance, predicted that 60% of the British population would need to be infected so that effective herd immunity would be achieved.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Izibonelo zibhekisela esibalweni sabantu abahlolelwe i-COVID-19, futhi ukuhlolwa kwabo okuqinisekisa ukuqinisekiswa ngokuhambelana nenqubo yomthetho.
en-mt: The examples refer to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose tests confirm confirmation in accordance with the legal process.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-23 March, alikho izwe ebeselihlole ngaphezulu kuka-3% wenani labantu balo, futhi amazwe amaningi ayenemithetho egwema ukuhlolwa kwalabo abanezimpawu ezisivivi nje, njenge-Italy, i-Netherlands, i-Spain, ne-Switzerland.
en-mt: As of March 23, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries had laws avoiding testing those with mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Ucwaningo olwanyatheliswa ngo-16 March lwathola ukuthi e-China, kuze kube ngu-23 January, isilinganiso esingu-86% sokuthelelana nge-COVID-19 sasingakatholakali, futhi lokhu kuthelelana okungabhaliwe phansi yikona okungumthombo ka-79% wezibonelo ezibhalwe phansi zesifo.
en-mt: A study published on 16 March found that in China, as of 23 January, an average of 86% of infections with COVID-19 had not been detected, and this undocumented infection was the source of 79% of documented cases of the disease.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Ukuhlaziya kwezibalo okwanyatheliswa ngo-30 March kwalinganisela ukuthi izinombolo zokutheleleka e-Italy ziphakeme kakhulu kunezibonelo ezibikiwe.
en-mt: A statistical analysis published on 30 March estimated that the numbers of infections in Italy are much higher than the reported examples.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: Ukulinganisela kokuqala kwesibalo esilula sokuzala (R0) se-COVID-19 besiku-1.4 kuye ku-2.4.
en-mt: The first estimate of the simple reproduction ratio (R0) for COVID-19 was 1.4 to 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Ucwaningo olunyatheliswe i-US Center for Disease Control and Prevention luphethe ngokuthi kungase kube ngu-5.7.
en-mt: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention concluded that it may be 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: Amantu abaningi abane-COVID-19 bayalulama.
en-mt: Most people with COVID-19 recover.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Labo abangalulami, isikhathi kusukela ekwakhekeni kwezimpawu kuye ekufeni siphakathi kwezinsuku ezingu-6 nezingu-41, ezivame kakhulu kube izinsuku ezingu-14.
en-mt: For those who do not recover, the time from the onset of symptoms to death is between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-10 April 2020, okungenani ukufa kwabangu-97,000 kwabekwa njengesizathu se-COVID-19.
en-mt: As of 10 April 2020, at least 97,000 deaths were attributed to COVID-19.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: E-China, kusukela ngo-5 February cishe u-80% wabafile waba yilabo abangaphezulu kuka-60, futhi u-75% uvele unezinkinga ezingokwempilo ezikhona kakade ezihlanganisa izifo zenhliziyo noshukela. Izibalo ezisemthethweni zokufa ngobhubhane lwe-COVID-19 ngokujwayelekile kubhekisela kubantu abafile abahlolwa baqinisekiselwa i-COVID ngokusho kwenqubo yomthetho.
en-mt: In China, as of 5 February nearly 80% of the dead were over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health problems including heart disease and diabetes. Official statistics on deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who have been tested positive for COVID according to the legal process.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: Isibalo sabafile esiyiqiniso se-COVID-19 kungenzeka sikhulu kakhulu, njengoba singahlanganisi wonke umuntu ofa ngaphandle kokuhlola - isib. ekhaya, ekhaya labadala, etc.
en-mt: The true death toll for COVID-19 is likely to be much higher, as it does not include everyone who dies without testing - e.g. home, nursing home, etc.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: Idatha eyingxenye evela e-Italy yathola ukuthi isibalo sokufa okweqile phakathi nobhubhane yeqa izibalo ezisemthethweni zokufa ngenxa ye-COVID ngo-4-5x.
en-mt: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official number of deaths due to COVID by 4-5x.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Ongumkhulumeli we-U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) wavuma "Siyazi ukuthi[isibalo esikhishiwe sokufa] singaphansi ngokulinganisa", inkulumo ehambelana nemibiko ye-anecdotal yokubala ngaphansi e-U.S. Ukulinganisa ngaphansi okunjalo kuvamile ukwenzeka uma kunobhubhane, njengomshayabhuqe we-H1N1 swine flu ngo-2009. Ukufa okuqala okwaqinisekiswa kwaba e-Wuhan ngo-9 January 2020.
en-mt: A spokesperson for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) admitted "We know that [the released death toll] is underestimated", a statement that matched anecdotal reports of undercounting in the US. Such underestimation is common in pandemics, such as the H1N1 swine flu pandemic of 2009. The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: Ukufa kokuqala okwenzeka ngaphandle kwezwe lase-China uqobo kwenzeka ngo-1 February e-Philippines, futhi ukufa kokuqala okwenzeka ngaphandle kwase-Asia kwenzeka e-France ngo-14 February.
en-mt: The first death outside China itself occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia occurred in France on 14 February.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: Ngo-28 February, ngaphandle kwezwe lase-China uqobo, ukufa kwabangaphezu kweshumi nambili kwaqoshwa e-Iran, e-South Korea, nase-Italy.
en-mt: On 28 February, outside of China itself, more than a dozen deaths were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Ngo-13 March, amazwe nezindawo ezingaphezulu kwamashumi amane ayesebike ukufa, kuwowonke amazwekazi ngaphandle kwe-Antarctica. Kunezinyathelo eziningana ngokuvamile ezisebenziselwa ukubala izinga lokufa.
en-mt: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on all continents except Antarctica. There are several measures commonly used to calculate the death rate.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Lezi zinombolo ziyahluka ngendawo nangaphezu kwesikathi, futhi zithonywa ubukhulu bokuhlola, isimo senqubo sokunakekela kwezezempilo, izinhlobo zokulashwa, isikhathi kusukela kuqale ukuqubuka, nezici zomphakathi njengobudala, ubulili, nempilo iyonke. I-death-to-case ratio ibonisa isibalo sabafile ubahlukanise ngenombolo yezibonelo ezihloliwe phakathi negebe elithile lenkathi.
en-mt: These numbers vary by location and over time, and are influenced by the size of the test, the nature of the health care system, types of treatment, time since the onset of the outbreak, and social factors such as age, gender, and overall health. The death-to-case ratio shows the number of deaths divided by the number of cases tested during a certain time interval.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: Ngokusekela ngezibalo ze-Johns Hopkins University, i-global death-to-case ratio ngu-6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) kusukela ngo-10 April 2020.
en-mt: Based on statistics from Johns Hopkins University, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: Isibalo siyahluka ngendawo.
en-mt: The number varies by location.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: E-China, ukulinganisa kwe-death-to-case ratio kwehla kusuka ku-17.3% (kulabo abanezimpawu ezavela ngo-1–10 January 2020) kuye ku-0.7% (kulabo abanezimpawu ezavela ngo-1 February 2020). Ezinye izinyathelo zihlanganisa i-case fatality rate (CFR), yona ebonisa iphesenti yabantu abahloliwe abafayo ngenxa yesifo, ne-infection fatality rate (IFR), yona ebonisa iphesenti yabathelelekile (abahloliwe nabangahloliwe) abafayo ngenxa yesifo.
en-mt: In China, the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptoms that appeared 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptoms that appeared on 1 February 2020). Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which shows the percentage of people tested who die from the disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which shows the percentage of infected people (tested and untested) who die from the disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Lezi zibalo azincikile esikhathini futhi zilandela inani labantu abathile kusuka ekuthelelekeni ngesixazululo sesibonelo.
en-mt: These statistics are independent of time and follow the number of individuals from infection with the sample solution.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: Inqwaba yezifundiswa ike yazama ukubala lezizinombolo zamanani abantu athile.
en-mt: A number of scholars have tried to calculate these numbers for the values of certain people.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: I-University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine ilinganisela ukuthi i-infection fatality rate yobhubhane selulonke iphakathi kuka-0.1% no-0.39%.
en-mt: The University of Oxford's Center for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate of the epidemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: Ukulinganisa okuphakeme kwaleli banga kuyahambisana nemiphumela evela ekuhloleni okungahleliwe kwe-COVID-19 e-Germany, futhi ucwaningo lwezibalo ezihlaziya imiphumela yokuhlola okulinganiselwa yi-CFR.
en-mt: The high estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the random testing of COVID-19 in Germany, and the statistical study analyzing the results of the tests estimated by the CFR.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: I-WHO iyagomela ukuthi ubhubhane lungalawuleka.
en-mt: WHO asserts that the epidemic can be controlled.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: Iqophelo nobude bangempela bokuqubuka akuqinisekisi futhi kungahluka ngendawo.
en-mt: The actual quality and duration of the outbreak is uncertain and may vary by location.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: U-Maciej Boni we-Penn State University wathi, "Uma eyekwa engabhekiwe, ukuqubuka okuthelelanayo kuyadamba sdalwa bese kuqala ukuncipha lapho isifo siphelelwa abagcini esingabathola.
en-mt: Maciej Boni of Penn State University said, "If left unchecked, infectious outbreaks slow down and start to decline when the disease runs out of potential hosts.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: Kodwa kucishe kube okungenakwenzeka ukwenza ukuqagela okusile njengamanje mayelana nokuthi lokho kuzoba nini".
en-mt: But it's almost impossible to make wild guesses right now about when that will be".

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: Umeluleki omkhulu wezokwelapha kahulumeni wase-China u-Zhong Nanshan wathi "kungenzeka kube skuphelile ngo-June" uma wonke amazwe engenza umnyakazo wokulandela izinyathelo ze-advn ye-WHO yokuvimba ukusabalala kwegciwane.
en-mt: The Chinese government's chief medical adviser Zhong Nanshan said that "it may be over by June" if all countries make a move to follow WHO's advn measures to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: Ngo-17 March, u-Adam Kucharski we-London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine wakhuluma wathi i-SARS-CoV-2 "izohamba izungeza, ngokunamandla unyaka owodwa noma emibili".
en-mt: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine spoke and said that SARS-CoV-2 "will be circulating, strongly for a year or two".

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: Ngokusho kocwaningo lwe-Imperial College eholwa ngu-Neil Ferguson, ukuzihlukanisa ngokomzimba nezinye izinyathelo kuzodingeka "kuze kube yilapho ikhambi litholakala (ngokuhlambisela izinyanga ezingu-18 noma ezengeziwe)".
en-mt: According to an Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical isolation and other measures will be needed "until a cure is found (probably 18 months or more)".

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: U-William Schaffner we-Vanderbilt University wathi, "Ngicabanga ukuthi akunakwenzeka ukuthi le-coronavirus—ngoba idluliselana kalula—izonyamalala unomphela" ingase futhi "iphenduke isifo sezinkathi zonyaka, izibuyele njalo ngonyaka".
en-mt: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University said, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so easily transmitted—will disappear forever" and it could also "become a seasonal disease, returning every year".

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: Indluzula yokubuya iyoncika ekuvikelekeni okuqinile komhlambi nezinga lokuzishintsha
en-mt: The rate of return will depend on the robustness of the herd and the rate of replacement

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: Izimpawu ze-COVID-19 zingaba ezingaqondile kokunye futhi abantu abathelelekile bangase bangabi nezimpawu.
en-mt: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be non-specific and infected people may have no symptoms.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: Izimpawu ezivame kakhulu ezimbili ukushisa (88%) nokukhwehlela okomile (68%).
en-mt: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: Izimpawu ezivame kancane zihlanganisa ukukhathala, ukwakheka kwamathe namafinyila esifubeni (phlegm), ukuphelelwa inzwa yokunuka, ukuphelelwa umoya, ubuhlungu bomsipha namalunga, umphimbo obuhlungu, ukunkenketha kwekhanda, amakhaza, ukuhlanza, i-hemoptysis, uhudo, noma i-cyanosis. I-WHO ithe ngokungageji umuntu oyedwa kwabayisithupha ugula kakhulu futhi abe nenkinga yokuphefumula.
en-mt: Less common symptoms include fatigue, build-up of saliva and mucus in the chest (phlegm), loss of sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis. The WHO said that one in six people will become seriously ill and have respiratory problems.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: I-U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) inohlu olubonisa izimpawu zesimo esiphuthumayo njengobunzima lapho uphefumula, ubuhlungu obuphikelelayo esifubeni noma ukucindezeleka, ukudunyelwa esithubeni, ubunzima uma uvuka, nobuso obuhlaza noma izindebe; ukunakekela okusheshayo kwezokwelapha kuyakhuthazwa uma lezi zimpawu zikhona. Ukuthuthuka kwesifo kulokhu kungaholela kusifo senyumoniya enzima, i-acute respiratory distress syndrome, i-sepsis, i-septic shock nokufa.
en-mt: U.S. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has a list of emergency symptoms such as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, shortness of breath, difficulty waking up, and pale face or lips; Immediate medical attention is recommended if these symptoms are present. The progression of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: Abanye balabo abathelelekile bangase bangabi nazo izimpawu, bangabi nezimpawu zokwelapha kodwa imiphumela yabo yokuhlola iqinisekisa ukutheleleka, ngakho abacwaningi sebekhiphe iseluleko sokuthi labo ababe nokuthintana okuseduze nalabo abaqinisekisiwe kumelwe baqaphwe eduze futhi bazilongwe ukuze kuqinisekwe unkungabikho kwesifo.
en-mt: Some of those infected may have no symptoms, no clinical symptoms but their test results confirm the infection, so researchers have issued advice that those who had close contact with those confirmed must be closely monitored and tested to ensure the absence of the disease.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: Ukulinganisa kwe-China kwabangenazo izimpawu i-ratio range isuka kwabambalwa kuye ku-44%.
en-mt: China's estimated asymptomatic ratio ranges from a few to 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: Inkathi evamile yokufudumala (inkathi ephakathi kokutheleleka nokuvela kwezimpawu) kunebanga elisuka kolulodwa kuye kwezingu-14 izinsuku; ngokujwayelekile kuba izinsuku ezinhlanu. Ukwenza isibonelo sokungaqiniseki, ukulinganisa ingxenye yabantu abane-COVID-19 abalahlekelwa inzwa yapho yokunuka ekuqaleni yayingu-30% futhi kamuva yehla yaba ku-15%.
en-mt: The normal incubation period (the period between infection and the appearance of symptoms) ranges from one to 14 days; usually five days. To illustrate the uncertainty, the estimated proportion of people with COVID-19 who lose their sense of smell was initially 30% and later dropped to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: Eminye imininingwane yendlela isifo esisabalala ngayo isadingidwa kwayimanje.
en-mt: Some details of how the disease spreads are still being debated.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
