targetString: Isifo sikholelwa ukuthi sisabalala ngokuyinhloko phakathi nokuthintana okuseduze nangamaconsi amancane akheka lapho ukhwehlela, uthimula, noma ukhuluma; lapho othintana eduze engaba kumitha elingu-1 kuye ku-2 (u-3 kuye ku-6 amagxathi).
en-mt: The disease is believed to spread mainly through close contact and through small droplets formed when you cough, sneeze, or talk; where the closest contact is about 1 to 2 meters (3 to 6 paces).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: Ucwaningo luthole ukuthi ukukhwehlela okungamboziwe kungaholela amaconsi ukuthi ahambe ibanga elingafika kumamitha angu-4.5 (15 amagxathi) kuye kumamitha angu-8.2 metres (27 amagxathi).
en-mt: Studies have found that uncovered coughing can lead droplets to travel up to 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: Abanye baphakamise ukuthi igciwane lingase lidluliselwe ngamaconsi amancane ahlala isikhathi esijana emoyeni, angaba khona phakathi nokukhuluma. Amaconsana okuphefumula nawo angase akheke phakathi nokukhipha umoya wokuphefumula, kuhlanganise nalapho ukhuluma, yize ngokuvamile igciwane lingahambi ngomoya.
en-mt: Some have suggested that the virus may be transmitted through small droplets that stay in the air for a short time, which can be present during speech. Respiratory droplets may also form during exhalation, including when speaking, although the virus is usually not airborne.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: Amaconsi angahlala emilomeni noma emakhaleni abantu abaseduze noma kwenzeke ahogelwe angene emaphashini.
en-mt: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of nearby people or be inhaled into the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Ezinye izinqubo zokwelapha njenge-intubation ne-cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) angase abangele ukuchicha kokuphefumula ukuba kufutheke bese umphumela ube ukusaphazeka ngomoya.
en-mt: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory failure to worsen and result in respiratory distress.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Ingase isabalale futhi lapho othile ethinta indawo enegciwane, okuhlanganisa isikhumba, bese ezithinta amehlo, ikhala, noma umlomo.
en-mt: It can also be spread when someone touches an infected area, including the skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: Noma kukhona ukukhathazeka ukuthi ingase yande ngothuvi, ingozi ikholelwa ukuthi iphansi.
en-mt: Although there is concern that it may increase further, the risk is believed to be low.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Uhulumeni wase-China uliphikile ithuba lokwenzeka kokuthatheleka kwegciwane le-SARS-CoV-2 ngokuthinta umlomo ngemva kokuthintana nendle. Igciwane linengozi yokuthelelana kakhulu phakathi nezinsuku ezintathu zokuqala nje lapho kuvela izimpawu yize ukusabalala kungenzeka ngaphambi kokuvela kwezimpawu futhi nasezigabeni zokugcina zesifo.
en-mt: The Chinese government has denied the possibility of the SARS-CoV-2 virus being transmitted by touching the mouth after contact with feces. The virus is most contagious within the first three days after symptoms appear, although transmission can occur before symptoms appear and in the later stages of the disease.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Abantu bahlolwe batholakala benalo igciwane izinsuku ezifika kwezintathu ngaphambi kokuvela kwezimpawu okubonisa ukuthi ukudlulisela kungenzeka ngaphambi kokwakheka kwezimpawu ezimqoka.
en-mt: People have tested positive for the virus up to three days before symptoms appear, indicating that transmission can occur before the development of significant symptoms.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: Imibiko embalwa kuphela yezibonelo ezingenazo izimpawu eziqinisekiswe elebhu ebonisayo, kodwa ukudluliselana ngaphandle kwezimpawu kuye kwakhonjwa amanye amazwe phakathi nophenyo lokulandelela ukuthintana.
en-mt: Only a few reports of asymptomatic specimens have been lab-confirmed, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified in other countries during contact tracing investigations.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: I-European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) ibeka ukuthi yize ingacaci kahle indlela isifo esisabalala kalula ngayo, umuntu oyedwa ngokuvamile uthelela abanye ababili noma abathathu. Igciwane liqhubeka liphila amahora kuya ezinsukwini ngaphezulu kwezinto.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that although it is not clear how easily the disease spreads, one person usually infects two or three others. The virus can survive for hours to days on surfaces.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: Ngokuqondile, igciwane litholakale litholakala kuze kufike ezinsukwini ezintathu kupulastiki (i-polypropylene) no-304 ku-stainless steel, usuku olulodwa kumakhadibhodi, futhu kuze kube amahora amane ethusini.
en-mt: Specifically, the virus was found to be present for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, one day on cardboard, and up to four hours on copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: Lokhu, kodwa, kuyahluka kuncike esimweni sokufudumala nezinga lokushisa nokubanda. Izilwane zasekhaya nezinye izilwane ziye zakholwa zatholakala ngempela zinayo i-COVID-19.
en-mt: This, however, varies depending on the temperature and the temperature. Pets and other animals have been believed to actually be infected with COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Abukho ubufakazi bokuthi izilwane zingakwazi ukudlulisela igciwane kubantu, yize amaguya e-British eyala ukuthi umuntu azihlanze izandla ngemuva kokuthinta izilwane, njengoba kunjalo ngemva kokuthinta izindawo abantu abanegciwane okungenzeka bazithintile.
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals can transmit the virus to people, although British authorities recommend that people wash their hands after touching animals, as well as after touching surfaces that infected people may have touched.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: I-Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) igciwane elisha, elaqala ukuhlukaniswa kubantu abathathu ababenesifo senyumoniya bexhumene noxhaxha lwezibonelo sokugula ngokuphefumula e-Wuhan.
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new virus, which was first isolated from three people who had pneumonia linked to a series of respiratory illness specimens in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Zonke izimpawu zegciwane elisha le-SARS-CoV-2 zenzeka ngendlela ehlobene nemvelo yama-coronaviruses. Ngaphandle komzimba womuntu, igciwane liyafa ngenzipho yasekhaya, njengoba incibilikisa isivikelo sayo sangaphandle.I- SARS-CoV-2 ihlobene eduze ne-SARS-CoV yokuqala.
en-mt: All symptoms of the new SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in a manner related to the nature of coronaviruses. Outside the human body, the virus dies at home, as it dissolves its external protection. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the first SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Icabangelwa ukuba nomsuka wokuthathelana ngokusuka esilwaneni.
en-mt: It is caused by having an animal origin.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwezakhi zofuzo kuveze ukuthi ngokofuzo i-coronavirus ibuthelana ndawonye nohlobo lwe-Betacoronavirus, izinhlobo ezingaphansi ze-Sarbecovirus (i-lineage B) zombili neminonjana ephuma kumalulwane.
en-mt: Genetic studies have shown that the coronavirus is genetically related to Betacoronavirus, a subspecies of Sarbecovirus (lineage B) both with traces from bats.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: Iyafana ngo-96% kulo lonke izinga lezakhi lamasampula amanye amalulwane. (BatCov RaTG13).
en-mt: It is 96% identical across all nutrient levels to other bat samples. (BatCov RaTG13).

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: Ngo-February 2020, abacwaningi base-China bathola ukuthi kune-amino acid eyodwa qwaba ehlukile ezingxenyeni ezithile zokuhleleka kwezakhi phakathi kwamagciwane avela kuma-pangolins nakulawo abantu.
en-mt: In February 2020, Chinese researchers discovered that there is a single amino acid difference in certain parts of the sequence between bacteria from pangolins and those from humans.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: Konke ukuqhathanisa kwezakhi kuze kube kulolusuku kuthole ukuthi kungaba u-92% uqobo wezakhi ophakathi kwe-coronavirus ye-pangolin ne-SARS-CoV-2, okunganele ukuthi kufakazele ukuthi ama-pangolins angabagcini abaphakathi.
en-mt: All the genetic comparisons to date have found that there is 92% genetic similarity between the pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is enough to prove that pangolins are intermediate hosts.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: Ukutheleleka ngegciwane kungenzeka kokunye kutholakale ngokubona izimpawu, yize ukuqiniseka ekugcineni kuvela ngokuguqula i-transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) yokuchicha kothelelwe noma ngesithombe se-CT.
en-mt: Viral infection can sometimes be detected by seeing the symptoms, although the final certainty comes from reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected saliva or CT imaging.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Ucwaningo oluqhathanisa i-PCR ne-CT e-Wuhan luphakamise ukuthi i-CT izwela kangcono kakhulu kune-PCR, yize ukucaca kwayo kungaphansi, njengoba izithombe zayo eziningi zeqela kwezinye izinqubo zamanyumoniya nezifo.
en-mt: A study comparing PCR and CT in Wuhan suggested that CT is more sensitive than PCR, although its clarity is lower, as many of its images overlap with other pneumonia processes and diseases.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: Kusukela ngo-March 2020, i-American College of Radiology iphakamisa ukuthi "i-CT akufanele isebenziselwe ukuphenya noma ukuthi ibe inqubo yokuqala yokuhlola i-COVID-19".
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology suggests that "CT should not be used to investigate or be the first diagnostic procedure for COVID-19".

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: I-WHO isinyathelise imithetho emibalwa ye-RNA yokuhlola i-SARS-CoV-2, eyokuqala yakhishwa ngo-17 January.
en-mt: The WHO has published several guidelines for RNA testing for SARS-CoV-2, the first of which was issued on 17 January.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Uvivinyo lusebenzisa i-real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
en-mt: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: Uvivinyo lungenziwa ngamasampula ekuphefumula noma ngegazi.
en-mt: The test can be done with breath or blood samples.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: Imiphumela ngokuvamile itholakala enkathini engaba amahora ambalwa kuye ezinsukwini.
en-mt: Results are usually available within a few hours to days.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: Ngokuvamile lolu vivinyo lwenziwa nge-swab ye-nasopharyngeal yize i-swab yomphimbo nayo ingasebenziswa. Isibalo samalebhu nezinkampani zithuthukisa ukuvuvinya ngendlela yemvelo, ekwazi ukuthola ama-antibodies.
en-mt: Usually this test is done with a nasopharyngeal swab although a throat swab can also be used. A number of labs and companies are developing tests that are natural, able to detect antibodies.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-6 April 2020, ayikho neyodwa kulezi eye yaphuma phambili njengeyanele ngokunemba ukuba igunyazelwe ukusebenziswa yonke indawo.
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, none of these have emerged as sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: E-US uvivinyo lwenqubo engokwemvelo oluthuthukiswe i-Cellex ligunyaziwe ukuthi lisebenziswe ngezimo eziphuthumayo ngamalebhu anezitifiketi kuphela.
en-mt: In the US the biological process test developed by Cellex is approved for emergency use only by certified labs.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: Izici zesithombe sezimfanelo kuma-radiographs neze-computed tomography (CT) zabantu ababonisa izimpawu zihlanganisa i-asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities ne-absent pleural effusions.
en-mt: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of symptomatic individuals include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: I-Italian Radiological Society ihlanganisa ndawonye i-online database yomhlaba wonke yokutholwe ngezithombe zezibonelo eziqinisekisiwe.
en-mt: The Italian Radiological Society is putting together a worldwide online database of radiographic findings of certified specimens.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: Ngenxa yokugaxekela kwezinye izifo njenge-adenovirus, ukuthatha izithombe ngaphandle kokuqinisekisa kwe-PCR kuba nomkhawulo ekunembeni ukukhomba i-COVID-19.
en-mt: Due to cross-contamination with other diseases such as adenovirus, imaging without PCR confirmation is limited in the accuracy of identifying COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: Ucwaningo olukhulu e-China luqhathanise imiphumela yesifuba ye-CT neye-PCR futhi yabonisa ukuthi yize isithombe sinezinga elincane ekucaciseni ukutheleleka, siyashesha futhi sizwela kakhulu, okuphakamisa ukucatshangelwa njengethuluzi lokuvivinya ezindaweni epidemic zomqedazwe.
en-mt: A large study in China compared the results of chest CT and PCR and showed that although the image has a low level in identifying the infection, it is fast and very sensitive, which suggests consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas of the epidemic.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: Ama-convolutional neural networks asekelwe ku-artificial intelligence athuthukisiwe ukuze akwazi ukuphenya izici zezithombe zegciwane ngawo womabili ama-radiographs ne-CT.
en-mt: Convolutional neural networks based on artificial intelligence have been developed to be able to investigate the characteristics of viral images with both radiographs and CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: Amasu okuvikela ukudluliselana ngegciwane ahlanganisa ukugcina ngokuphelele inhlanzeko yomuntu siqu, ukuhlanza izandla, ukugwema ukuthinta amehlo, ikhala, noma umlomo ngezandla ezingahlanziwe, nokukhwehlela noma ukuthimula usebenzisa iphepha lokusula bese ufaka iphepha lokusula ngokuqondile emgqomeni.
en-mt: Strategies to prevent transmission include maintaining good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into the bin.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: Labo okungenzeka ukuthi sebethole ukutheleleka bakhuthazwa ukuthi bagqoke isembozo sobuso emphakathini.
en-mt: Those who may have contracted the infection are encouraged to wear a face covering in public.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Izinyathelo zokuqhelelana ngokomzimba nakho kukhuthaziwe ukuze kuvikelwe ukudluliselana. Ohulumeni abaningi babeke imingcele noma baxwayisa ngohambo olungabalulekile oluya noma oluvela emazweni athintwe ubhubhane.
en-mt: Physical distancing measures are also encouraged to prevent transmission. Many governments have restricted or warned against non-essential travel to or from countries affected by the pandemic.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: Kodwa, igciwane selifinyelele izinga lokusaphazeka emiphakathini kabanzi ezingxenyeni zomhlaba.
en-mt: But, the virus has reached the level of spreading in communities in many parts of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: Lokhu kusho ukuthi igciwane lisaphazeka phakathi emiphakathini, futhi amanye amalungu omphakathi awazi ukuthi atheleleka kephi noma kanjani. Abahlinzekeli bezempilo abanakekela othile okungenzeka ukuthi uthelelekile bakhuthazwa ukuthi basebenzise indlela emisiwe yokuqapha, ukuqapha ukuthintana, nokuvikela amehlo. Ukulandelela abathintekile indlela ebalulekile kumagunya ezempilo babone umthombo wokuthelelana futhi bavimbe ukudluliselana okuqhubekayo.
en-mt: This means that the virus is still spreading within communities, and some members of the community do not know where or how they are infected. Health care providers caring for someone who may be infected are encouraged to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection. Tracing those affected is an important way for health authorities to identify the source of infection and prevent further transmission.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Ukusebenzisa idatha yendawo evela komakhala ekhukhwini ngohulumeni ngalenjongo sekususe ukukhathazeka ngamalungelo obumfihlo, i-Amnesty International nezinye izinhlangano ezingaphezu kuka-100 zikhipha isitatimende esibizela imingcele kule ndlela yokubhekwa.
en-mt: The use of location data from pocket noses by governments for this purpose has raised concerns about privacy rights, with Amnesty International and more than 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for restrictions on this form of surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Sekunama-app omakhal'ekhukhwini ahlukene afakiwe noma aphakamiselwe ukusebenziswa ngokuzithandela, futhi kusukela ngo-April 7, 2020, amaqembu ochwepheshe angaphezu kweshumi nambili abesebenza ngezixazululo ezizwana nobumfihlo, njengokusebenzisa i-Bluetooth ukuze ufake ilogi yokusondelana komsebenzisi kwabanye omakhal-ekhukhwini.
en-mt: Various mobile apps have been installed or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen technical groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other mobile devices.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: Abasebenzisi sebengathola umyalezo lapho kwenzekile basondelana nothile ohloliwe waqinisekiswa ukuba ne-COVID-19. Kunemibono eyiphutha ezungezayo yezindlela zokuvikela ukutheleleka; ngokwesibonelo, ukuhlambulula ikhala nokuhahaza nge-mouthwash akusebenzi.
en-mt: Users can receive a message when they have been in close contact with someone who has been tested and confirmed to have COVID-19. There are misconceptions circulating about ways to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash does not work.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: Alikho ikhambi le-COVID-19, yize izinhlangano eziningi zisebenzela ekulakheni.
en-mt: There is no cure for COVID-19, although many organizations are working on one.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Ukuhlamba izandla kuyakhuthazwa ukuze kuvikelwe ukwanda kwesifo.
en-mt: Hand washing is encouraged to prevent the spread of disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: I-CDC iphakamisa ukuthi abantu bahlanze izandla njalo ngensipho namanzi okungenani imizuzwana engamashumi amabili, ikakhulukazi lapho uphuma endlini yangasese noma izindla zibonakala ukungcola; ngaphambi kokudla; nangemuva kokufinya, kokukhwehlela, noma ukuthimula.
en-mt: The CDC suggests that people wash their hands regularly with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially when you leave the bathroom or the toilet is visibly dirty; before eating; and after sneezing, coughing, or sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Isizathu salokhu ukuthi ngaphandle komzimba womuntu, igciwane libulawa insipho yasekhaya, ngoba iqhumisa ibhamuza layo lesivikelo.
en-mt: The reason for this is that outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, because it bursts its protective bubble.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: I-CDC iphinde yakhuthaza ukusebenziswa kwe-sanitizer yesandla esekelwe nge-alcohol okungenani ibe no-60% we-alcohol ngevolumu uma insipho namanzi engatholakali ngaleso sikhathi.
en-mt: The CDC also recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume if soap and water are not available at the time.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: I-WHO ikhuthaza abantu ukuthi bagweme ukuthinta amehlo, ikhala, noma umlomo ngezandla ezingahlanziwe.
en-mt: WHO encourages people to avoid touching their eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: Izindawo zingakwazi ukuswa ukungcola ngezixazululo ezimbalwa (phakathi nomzuzu owodwa wokuchayeka kusibulala magciwane endaweni ye-stainless steel), kuhlanganisa u-62–71% we-ethanol, u-50–100% we-isopropanol, u-0.1% we-sodium hypochlorite, u-0.5% we-hydrogen peroxide, no-0.2–7.5% we-povidone-iodine.
en-mt: Surfaces can be disinfected with several solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant on the stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Ezinye izixazululo, njenge-benzalkonium chloride ne-chrohexidine gluconate, zisebenza ngezinga eliphansi.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: I-CDC ikhuthaza ukuthi uma isibonelo se-COVID sisolwa noma siqinisekiswa endaweni enjenge hhovisi noma inkulisa, zonke izindawo ezinjengama hhovisi, izindlu zangasese, izindawo ezivamile, imishini esebenziswa yibo bonke njengamathebhulethi, izikrini ezithintwayo, amakhibhodi, izilawula kude, nemishini ye-ATM abantu abagulayo abayisebenzisile, kumelwe ibulawe amagciwane.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that if a case of COVID is suspected or confirmed in an environment such as an office or daycare, all areas such as offices, restrooms, common areas, devices that are used by all such as tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines that are sick people used, it must be disinfected.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: Izinhlangano zezempilo zikhuthaza ukuthi abantu bazisithe umlomo nekhala ngendololwane noma ngethishu lapho bekhwehlela, noma bethimula, bese belahla noma iyiphi ithishu ngokushesha.
en-mt: Health organizations recommend that people cover their mouth and nose with their elbow or a tissue when they cough or sneeze, and discard any tissue immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Amamaski abahlinzi aphakanyiselwa labo okungenzeka ukuthi bathelelekile, njengoba ukugqoka imaski kubeka umkhawulo ebuningini nebanga lamaconsi okuphefumula aphuma etsaza lapho ukhuluma, uthimula, futhi ukhwehlela.
en-mt: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask limits the amount and distance of respiratory droplets that are released when you talk, sneeze, and cough.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: I-WHO isikhiphe iziqondiso mayelana nesikhathi nendlela yokusebenzisa imaski.
en-mt: The WHO has issued guidelines on when and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: Ngokusho kuka-Stephen Griffin, i-virologist e-University of Leeds, "Ukugqoka imaski kunganciphisa ukuthambekela [ya] kubantu ukuthi bazithinte ubuso, okuyiwona mthombo omkhulu wokutheleleka ngaphandle kwenhlanzeko efanele yezandla. "Amamaski aphinde akhuthazwa ukuba asebenziswe yilabo abanakekela othile okungenzeka ukuthi unesifo.
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the tendency [of] people to touch their face, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene. "Masks are also encouraged to be used by those who care for someone who may have the disease.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: I-WHO ikhuthaze ukuthi abantu abangaguli bangagqoka amamaski kuphela uma besengozi ephakeme, njengalabo abanakekela umuntu one-COVID-19, yize futhi bevuma ukuthi ukugqoka amamaski kungabasiza abantu bagweme ukuzithinta ubuso.
en-mt: The WHO has recommended that people who are not sick can only wear masks if they are at high risk, such as those caring for someone with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks can help people avoid touching their faces.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Amazwe amaningi aseqalile ukukhuthaza ukuthi amalungu omphakathi kumele asebenzise amamaski obuso.
en-mt: Many countries have started to encourage that members of the public must use face masks.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: E-U.S., i-CDC ikhuthaza ukugqoka imaski eyenziwe ngendwangu kunokusebenzisa eyabezempilo. I-China ikhuthaze ngokuqondile ukuthi amalungu omphakathi angaguli asebenzise amamaski abezempilo alahlwayo, ikakhulukazi lapho usondelana kakhulu ngo-(1 imitha (3 ft) noma ngaphansi) nabanye abantu.
en-mt: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing cloth masks rather than medical ones. China has specifically encouraged non-ill members of the public to use disposable medical masks, especially when in close contact (1 meter (3 ft) or less) with other people.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: I-Hong Kong ikhuthaza ukugqoka imaski yabahlinzi lapho uthatha izinto zokuhamba zomphakathi noma uhlezi ezindaweni ezigcwele.
en-mt: Hong Kong encourages wearing surgical masks when taking public transportation or sitting in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: Abasebenzi bezempilo e-Thailand's bakhuthaza abantu ukuthi benze amamaski ngendwangu emakhaya bese bewahlanza nsukuzonke.
en-mt: Thailand's health workers encourage people to make cloth masks at home and clean them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: I-Czech Republic ne-Slovakia yavala ngokomthetho ukuphumela emphakathini ungayigqokile imaski noma ukumboza ikhala nomlomo.
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned by law going out in public without wearing a mask or covering the nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Ngo-16 March, i-Vietnam yacela wonke umuntu ukuthi agqoke imaski lapho eya ezindaweni zomphakathi ukuze azivikele yena futhi nabanye.
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam asked everyone to wear a mask when going to public places to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: Uhulumeni wasse-Austria waphoqa ukuthi wonke umuntu ongena esitolo sokudla kumele agqoke imaski yobuso.
en-mt: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a restaurant must wear a face mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: U-Israel ucele zonke izakhamuzi ukuthi zigqoke imaski yobusa lapho zisemphakathini.
en-mt: Israel has asked all citizens to wear a government mask when in public.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: I-Taiwan, njengoba ibiqhubeka ikhiqiza amamaski ayizigidi eziyishumi ngosuku kusukela phakathi neyanga ka-March, icele abagibeli bezitimela namabhasi asedolobheni ukuthi bagqoke amamaski obuso ngo-1 April.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing 10 million masks a day since mid-March, has asked passengers on trains and city buses to wear face masks on April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: I-Panama isikwenze kwaba impoqo ukugqoka imaski yobuso noma nini lapho uphumela ngaphandle, ngesikhathi esifanayo ikhuthaza ukuzakhela wena ekhaya imaski yobuso kulabo abangakwazi ukuthenga amamaski obuso.
en-mt: Panama has made it mandatory to wear a face mask whenever you go outside, while at the same time encouraging home-made face masks for those who cannot afford face masks.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Amamaski obuso abesetshenziswa kabanzi e-Japan, e-South Korea, e-Malaysia, nase-Singapore.
en-mt: Face masks were widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: Ukuzihlukanisa ngokuhlala (okwaziwa futhi ngokuthi ukuzihlukanisa ngokomzimba) kuhlanganisa izinyathelo zokulawula ukuthelelana okuhloselwe ukunensisa ukusabalala kwesifo ngokunciphisa ukuthintana eduze kwabantu.
en-mt: Social isolation (also known as physical isolation) includes infection control measures aimed at slowing the spread of disease by reducing close contact.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Izindlela zihlanganisa ukuhlukanisa; imingcele kwezohambo; nokuvalwa kwezikole, izindawo zomsebenzi, izitediyamu, amatiyetha, nezikhungo zokuthenga.
en-mt: Methods include classification; travel restrictions; and closure of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters, and shopping centers.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Abantu ngabanye bangakwazi ukusebenzisa izindlela zokuzihlukanisa ngokuhlala emakhaya, ukukhawula ukuvakasha, ukugwema izindawo ezigcwele, ukubingelela ngaphandle kokuthintana, nokuzihlukanisa ngokomzimba kwabanye.
en-mt: Individuals can use self-isolation measures by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded places, greeting people without touching, and physically isolating themselves from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Ohulumeni abaningi manje sebephoqa noma bakhuthaza i-social distancing kulezo zindawo ezithintwe ubhubhane.
en-mt: Many governments are now enforcing or encouraging social distancing in those areas affected by the epidemic.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: Isibalo esiphakeme sombuthano esiphakanyiswa amagatsha kahulumeni we-US nezinhlangano zezempilo yehliswa ngokuphazima kweso kubantu abangu-250 (uma kwakungekho ukusabalala kwe-COVID-19 endaweni) yabekwa ku-50 people, kwathi kamuva yafika kubantu abangu-10.
en-mt: The maximum number of gatherings proposed by US government branches and health organizations was suddenly reduced from 250 people (if there was no spread of COVID-19 in the area) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Ngo 22 March 2020, i-Germany yavala ngokomthetho umbuthano womphakathi ongaphezu kwabantu ababili. Abadala asebekhulile nalabo abanezimo zempilo ezikhona njengoshukela, isifo senhliziyo, isifo sokuphefumula, isifuthefuthe, namasosha omzimba awahlokayo babhekene nengozi yokugula okunzima nezinkinga futhi i-CDC ibaxwayisile ukuthi bahlale emakhaya ngangokunokwenzeka ezindaweni zomphakathi ezinobhubhane. Ekuphetheni kuka-March 2020, i-WHO namanye amagatsha kwezempilo baqala ukusebenzisa igama elithi 'ukuzihlukanisa ngokomzimba' esikhundleni salelo elithi 'ukuzihlukanisa ngokuhlalisana', ukuze kucace ukuthi inhloso ukunciphisa ukuthintana ngokomzimba ngesikhathi esifanayo kugcinwe ukuxhumana ngokuhlalisana, ngendlela ye-inthanethi noma ngokwesikhala.
en-mt: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people. The elderly and those with existing health conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, asthma, and weakened immune systems are at risk of serious illness and complications and the CDC has warned them to stay at home as much as possible in public areas with epidemics. At the end of March 2020, the WHO and other branches of health began to use the term 'physical isolation' instead of 'social isolation', to make it clear that the aim is to reduce physical contact while at the same time maintaining social contact, online or spatially.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: Ukusebenziswa kwetemu elithi "ukuzihlukanisa ngokuhlalisana" bese liholeleeziphethweni zokuthi abantu kumele bahlanganyele ngokuphelele ekuzihlukaniseni ngokuhlala, kunokuthi kubakhuthaze ukuthi baqhubeke bethintana nabanye ngezindlela ezihlukile. Amanye amagunya akhuphe iziqondiso kwezempilo yobulili ezingasebenziswa lapho kusaqhubeka ubhubhane.
en-mt: The use of the term "social isolation" then leads to the conclusion that people must fully participate in social isolation, rather than encouraging them to continue to interact with others in different ways. Some jurisdictions have issued guidelines on sexual health that cannot be used during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Lezi zihlanganisa izikhuthazo zokuhlanganyela ubulili nomuntu ohlala naye kuphela, ongenalo igciwane noma izimpawu zegciwane.
en-mt: These include incentives to have sex only with a partner, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: Ukuzihlukanisa ngokuba sekhaya yikho okukhuthaziwe kulabo abatholakele ne-COVID-19 nalabo abasola ukuthi kungenzeka bathelelekile.
en-mt: Self-isolation by staying at home is recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they may have been infected.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: Abaphathela Ezempilo bakhiphe imiyalo enabile yokuzihlukanisa ngokuba sekhaya ngokufanele. Ohulumeni abaningi baphoqile noma bakhuthaza ukuzivalela kwawo wonke umuntu ohlala ezindaweni ezithintekile.
en-mt: Health officials have issued extensive orders to self-isolate and stay at home accordingly. Many governments have mandated or encouraged self-isolation for everyone living in affected areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: Iziqondiso ezisinda kakhulu zokuzivalela ekhaya zidluliselwe lulabo abakumaqembu asengozini enkulu.
en-mt: The heaviest guidelines for self-isolation have been extended to those in high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Labo okungenzeka bachayeke kothile one-COVID-19 nalabo abasanda kuvakashela izwe noma isifunda esinokudluliselana okwandile bakhuthaziwe ukuthi bazivalele izinsuku ezingu-14 kusukela ngesikhathi esingaba esokuchayeka okokugcina.
en-mt: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently visited a country or region with high transmission are encouraged to self-isolate for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: Amasu okulawula ubhubhane ukuvalela noma ukucindezela, nokunciphisa.
en-mt: Epidemic control strategies include containment or suppression, and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: Ukuvalela kulandelelwa ezigabeni zokuqala zobhubhane futhi inhloso ukuthungatha bese kuhlukaniswa labo abathelelekile nokuthi kwethulwe ezinye izinhlelo zokulawula ukuthelelana kanye namakhambi ukuze kuvinjwe isifo singasabalali siye nakwabanye abantu.
en-mt: Quarantine is monitored in the early stages of an epidemic and the aim is to identify and isolate those who are infected and to introduce other infection control programs and remedies to prevent the disease from spreading to other people.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Uma kungasenzeki ukuvalela ukusabalala kwesifo, imizamo ibe isisuka iye esigabeni sokunciphisa: kuthathwa izinyathelo zokunensisa ukusabalala nokunciphisa imiphumela yaso ekusebenzeni kwezokunakekela impilo nasemphakathini.
en-mt: If it is not possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation phase: measures are taken to slow the spread and reduce its effects on health care operations and the community.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Ukubhanqa zombili izinyathelo zokuvalela nokunciphisa kungase kulandelelwe ngesikhathi esisodwa.
en-mt: Pairing both containment and mitigation measures can be tracked at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: Ukucindezela kudinga izinyathelo eziqine kakhulu ukuze kuhlehliswe ubhubhane ngokunciphisa isibalo esilula zokuzala sibe ngaphansi kuka-1. Ingxenye yokunakekela ukuqubuka kwesifo esithathelanayo ukuzama ukunciphisa isiqongo somshayabhuqe, okwaziwa ngokuthi ukucabaza umugqa womshayabhuqe.
en-mt: Suppression requires more drastic measures to reverse the epidemic by reducing the simple reproduction rate to less than 1. Part of managing an outbreak of an infectious disease is trying to reduce the peak of the epidemic, known as suppressing the epidemic line.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Lokhu kunciphisa ingozi yokuthi imisebenzi yezezempilo itholakale ikhungatheka bese inikeza isikhathi esengeziwe sokuthi imithi namakhambi kwakhiwe.
en-mt: This reduces the risk of health workers being overwhelmed and allows more time for medicines and remedies to be developed.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Ukungenela okungathinti ezemithi okungalawula ukuqubuka kuhlanganisa izinyathelo zokuzivikela komuntu siqu, njengonhlanzeko yezandla, ukugqoka imaski yobuso, ukuzivalela, izinyathelo zomphakathi ezihlose ukuhlukanisa ngokomzimba njengokuvala izikole nokukhansela izenzakalo zemibuthwano yeningi; ukuhlanganyela ekukhuthazeni umphakathi ukuthi wamukele futhi ubambe iqhaza ekungeneleni okunjalo such; kanjalo nezinyathelo ezingezemvelo njengokuhlanza izindawo. Izenzo eziqine kakhulu zokuvalela ukuqubuka zathathwa e-China lapho ubukhulu bezinga lokuqubuka bucaca, njengokuvala ngokuphelele amadolobha, nokuphoqa imithetho evikela ukuvakasha.
en-mt: Non-pharmacological interventions to control outbreaks include personal protective measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face masks, self-isolation, social distancing measures such as closing schools and canceling public gatherings; participate in encouraging the public to accept and participate in such interventions; as well as non-environmental measures such as cleaning up areas. The most drastic measures to contain the outbreak were taken in China when the scale of the outbreak became clear, such as completely closing down cities, and enforcing laws that protect tourism.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Amanye amazwe nawo athole izinyathelo ezihlukene ezihloselwe ekubekeni umngcele ekusabalaleni kwegciwane.
en-mt: Other countries have also adopted different measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: I-South Korea yethule ukubukwa kweningi futhi yenza ukuvalelwa ngokwezindawo, futhi yakhipha izixwayiso ngokunyakaza kwalabo abathelelekile.
en-mt: South Korea introduced mass screenings and quarantines, and issued warnings about the movement of those infected.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: I-Singapore ihlinzekele ukusekela kwezemali kulabo abathelelekile bazivalele futhi yaphoqa inkokhelo ephakeme kulabo abahlulekile ukwenza njalo.
en-mt: Singapore provided financial support for those infected to self-isolate and imposed a higher payment on those who failed to do so.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: I-Taiwan ikhuphule umkhiqizo wamamaski obuso futhi yabeka isigwebo sokuqhwaga ngezimpahla zokwelapha. Ukulingisa isimo kwe-Great Britain ne-United States kubonisa ukuthi ukunciphisa (ukunensisa kodwa hhayi ukumisa ukwanda komshayabhuqe) futhi ukucindezela (ukuhlehlisa ukukhula komshayabhuqe) kunezinselele ezinkulu.
en-mt: Taiwan has increased production of face masks and imposed a penalty for extorting medical supplies. Simulations of Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping the spread of the epidemic) and suppression (reversing the growth of the epidemic) have major challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Imithetho yokunciphisa eyinhloko ingase inciphise isidingo esinzima sezokunakekela impilo ngo-2/3 nokufa ngengxenye, noma kunjalo isiphetho kube ukufa kwamakhulu ezinkulungwane nokukhungatheka kwezinhlelo zezempilo.
en-mt: Major austerity measures may reduce the critical need for health care by 2/3 and deaths by half, but the end result is hundreds of thousands of deaths and the collapse of health systems.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: Ukucindezela kungase kube ngcono kodwa kudinga ukugcinwa uma nje igciwane liqhubeka lizungeza umphakathi wesintu (noma kuze kube yilapho ikhambi litholakala, uma lokho kufika kuqala), njengoba ukudluliselana kugxuma ngokushesha lapho izinyathelo zikhululekiswa.
en-mt: The pressure may be better but it needs to be maintained as long as the virus continues to circulate in the human population (or until a cure is found, if that comes first), as transmission jumps as soon as measures are relaxed.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Ukungenela isikhathi eside ukuze kucindezelwe ubhubhane kudala izindleko emphakathini nakwezomnotho.
en-mt: Prolonged interventions to suppress the epidemic create social and economic costs.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Ayikho imithi egunyaziwe ngokuqondile yokulwa ne-COVID-19, kodwa imizamo yokuyakha isendleleni, kuhlanganisa ukuhlola imithi ekhona kakade.
en-mt: There are no drugs approved specifically to fight COVID-19, but efforts to develop them are underway, including testing existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: Ukuthatha imithi etholakala ezitolo, ukuphuza izinto eziwuketshezi, nokuphumula kungasiza kudambise izimpawu.
en-mt: Taking over-the-counter medications, drinking fluids, and resting can help relieve symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: Kuye ngokuncika ngobunzima, ukulapha umoya wokuphefumula, uketshezi olungeniswayo, nokusekela ukuphefumula kungase kudingeke.
en-mt: Depending on the severity, respiratory therapy, intravenous fluids, and respiratory support may be necessary.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: Ukusebenzisa ama-steroids kungase kulalaze imiphumela.
en-mt: Using steroids may worsen the results.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Izakhi eziningi ebezigunyaziwe ekusebenzeni kwezinye izifo ezandayo ziyaphenywa ukuze zisebenziswe ekulapheni i-COVID-19.
en-mt: Many compounds that have been approved for use in other emerging diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: I-WHO yaphinde yakhipha ukuthi amanye "amakhambi amadala nawasekhaya" angakwazi ukuhlinzekela  impumuzo kulezimpawu ezidalwa i-SARS-CoV-19.
en-mt: The WHO also released that some "old and home remedies" can provide relief from the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: Ukuphakamisa amandla nokuvumelanisa ezokunakekela ezempilo ngokwesidingo seziguli ze-COVID-19 kuphakanyiswa i-WHO njengesinyathelo esibucayi sokusabela kuqubuko.
en-mt: Increasing capacity and adapting health care to the needs of patients with COVID-19 is recommended by the WHO as a critical step in the response to the outbreak.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: I-ECDC ne-European regional office le-WHO bakhiphe imihlahlandlela yezibhedlela nabanakekeli bempilo abayinloko ngokugudluza izinsiza ngezigaba ezingafani, okuhlanganisa ukugxilisa imisebenzi yamalebhu ekuhloleni i-COVID-19, ukukhansela izinqubo ezikhethwayo lapho kungenzeka, ukuhlunga nokuhlukanisa iziguli ze-COVID-19 eziqinisekisiwe, nokuphakamisa amandla okunakekela okubucayi ngokuqeqsha izisebenzi nokwandisa isibalo sezisizi zokuphefumula nemibhede.
en-mt: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary health care providers on shifting resources to different sectors, including focusing laboratory activities on testing for COVID-19, canceling elective procedures when possible, sorting and isolating confirmed COVID-19 patients, and elevating critical care capacity by training staff and increasing the number of ventilators and beds.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: Kunemibono ehlukene mayelana nokuthi isibonelo sokuqala (obizwa ngesiguli seqanda) savela kuphi.
en-mt: There are different opinions about where the first example (the so-called egg patient) came from.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Isibonelo sokuqala esaziwayo se-coronavirus entsha sibuyela emuva ku-1 December 2019 e-Wuhan, e-Hubei, e-China.
en-mt: The first known case of the new coronavirus dates back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Esikhathini esingaba inyanga, isibalo sezibonelo ze-coronavirus e-Hubei saphakama kancane.
en-mt: In about a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei rose slightly.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Lezi bezixhumene kakhulu ne-Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, ephinde idayise izilwane eziphilayo, futhi umbono ukuthi igciwane lavela kwesinye sizinhlobo zalezi zilwane; noma, ngamanye amagama, sinomsuka wokuthathelwa esilwaneni. Uxhaxha lwamanyumoniya lwembagela engaziwa lwabhekwa ngo-26 December futhi lalashwa ngudokotela u-Zhang Jixian e-Hubei Provincial Hospital, owabikela i-Wuhan Jianghan CDC ngo-27 December.
en-mt: These were closely linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sells live animals, and the theory is that the virus came from one of these species; or, in other words, we have an animal origin. The unknown suspect's pneumonia cluster was diagnosed on 26 December and treated by doctor Zhang Jixian at Hubei Provincial Hospital, who reported to the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Ngo-30 December, iqembu lodokotela e-Wuhan Central Hospital laxwayisa abanakwabo nge-"coronavirus efana ne-SARS".
en-mt: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital warned their colleagues about a "coronavirus similar to SARS".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Odokotela abayisishigalombili, abahlanganisa u-Li Wenliang, bayalwa amaphoyisa ngokusakaza amahlebezi ayiphutha, omunye futhi, u-Ai Fen, wathethiswa abaphathi bakhe ngokuhlaba umkhosi.
en-mt: Eight doctors, including Li Wenliang, were reprimanded by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by his superiors for raising the alarm.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: I-Wuhan Municipal Health Commission kamuva yakhipha isaziso somphakathi ngo-31 December futhi yabikela ne-WHO.
en-mt: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later issued a public notice on December 31 and reported to the WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Izibonelo ezanele zenyumoniya engaziwa zase zibikelwe amagunya ezempilo e-Wuhan ukuthi zingasusa uphenyo ekuqaleni kuka-January. Ezigabeni zokuqala zokuqubuka, isibalo sezibonelo saphindeka okungenani njalo ngemuva kwezinsuku eziyisikhombisa nengxenye.
en-mt: Enough samples of the unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to launch an investigation in early January. In the early stages of the outbreak, the number of specimens increased at least every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Ekuqaleni naphakathi kuka-January 2020, igciwane lasabalala laya nakwezinye izifunda zase-China, lisizwa ukuthutha ngenxa Yonyaka Omusha Wase-China nokuthi i-Wuhan iyihabhu yezokuthutha nokushintshana kojantshi abakhulu.
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other regions of China, helped by transportation due to the Chinese New Year and the fact that Wuhan is a transportation and exchange hub on major railways.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Ngo-20 January, i-China yabika cishe izibonelo ezingu-140 ngosuku olulodwa, okuhlanganisa abantu ababili e-Beijing noyedwa e-Shenzhen.
en-mt: On 20 January, China reported about 140 cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Kamuva idatha esemthethweni yabonisa ukuthi abantu abangu-6,174 bese bebonisa izimpawu ngo-20 January 2020. Kusukela ngo-26 March, i-United States iyidlulile i-China ne-Italy ngibalo esiphakeme sezibonelo eziqinisekisiwe emhlabeni. Kusukela ngo-9 April 2020, izibonelo ezingaphezu kuka-1.61 wesigidi ziye zabikwa umhlaba wonke; abantu abangaphezulu kuka-97,000 bafile futhi abangaphezulu kuka-364,000 balulamile.
en-mt: Later official data showed that 6,174 people showed symptoms on 20 January 2020. As of 26 March, the United States has surpassed China and Italy in the highest number of confirmed cases in the world. As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million specimens have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Okungenani amazwe nezindawo ezingu-200 zibe naso okungenani isibonelo esisodwa.
en-mt: At least 200 countries and territories have at least one example.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Ngenxa yobhubhane e-Europe, amazwe amaningi endaweni yase-Schengen isibeke umngcele wokunyakaza ngenkululeko futhi aphakamisa ukulwulwa komngcele.
en-mt: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen area have imposed restrictions on free movement and are proposing border extensions.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Ukusabela kwesizwe kuhlanganise izinyathelo zokugcinwa njengokuvalelwa (okwaziwa ngokuthi iziqondiso zokuhlala ekhaya, iziqondiso zokukhosela lapho ukhona, noma ukuvala phansi) nezikhathi ezimisiwe. Kusukela ngo 2 April, cishe izigidi ezingu-300 zabantu, noma u-90% wenani labantu, bangaphansi kwendlela ethile yokuvala phansi e-United States, abantu abangaphezulu kwezigidi ezingu-50 zabantu ziphansi kokuvala phansi e-Philippines, okungenani izigidi ezingu-59 zabantu ziphansi kokuvala phansi e-South Africa, futhi izinkulungwane zezigidi ezingu-1.3 zabantu ziphansi kokuvala phansi e-India.
en-mt: The nation's response included containment measures such as lockdowns (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdowns) and curfews. As of April 2, about 300 million people, or 90% of the population, are under some form of unemployment in the United States, more than 50 million people are under unemployment in the Philippines, and at least 59 million people are below the poverty line in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are below the poverty line in India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Ngo-26 March, izinkulungwa zezigidi ezingu-1.7 zbantu emhlabeni wonke bebengaphansi kohlobo lokuvala phansi, okube sekukhuphuka kwaba izinkulungwane zezigidi ezingu-2.6 zabantu ezinsukwini ezimbili kamuva—okungaba izingxenye ezintathu zenani labantu bomhlaba.
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 million people worldwide were under a lockdown, which rose to 2.6 billion people two days later—about three-quarters of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Isibonelo sokuqala eziqinisekisiwe se-COVID-19 silandelelwe emuva ku-1 December 2019 e-Wuhan; umbiko owodwa ongaqinisekisiwe uphakamisa ukuthi isibonelo sokuqala saba ngo-17 November.
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 was traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests that the first instance took place on 17 November.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Udokotela u-Zhang Jixian wabheka uxhaxha lwezibonelo zenyumoniya yembangela engaziwa ngo-26 December, khona lapho insibhedlela sakhe sabikela i-Wuhan Jianghan CDC ngo-27 December.
en-mt: Doctor Zhang Jixian examined a series of pneumonia specimens of unknown cause on 26 December, which his hospital reported to the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Ukuhlola kokuqala kofuzo kwezibonelo zeziguli ngo-27 December 2019 kwabonisa ukuba khona kwe-coronavirus efana ne-SARS.
en-mt: The first genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 showed the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Isaziso somphakathi sakhishwa yi-Wuhan Municipal Health Commission ngo-31 December.
en-mt: A public notice was issued by the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on December 31.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: I-WHO yabikelwa ngosuku olufanayo.
en-mt: The WHO was notified on the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Njengoba lezi zaziso zivela, odokotela e-Wuhan baxwayiswa amaphoyisa "ngokusakaza amahlebezi" aphathelene nokuqubuka.
en-mt: As the alerts emerged, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police about "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: I-Chinese National Health Commission yaqala ngokugomela ukuthi "abukho ubufakazi" bokudliliselana komuntu nomuntu.
en-mt: The Chinese National Health Commission began by asserting that there was "no evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ekuphetheni kuka-January, uhulumeni wase-China waqalisa umkhankaso omkhulu kamuva owachazwa unobhala jikelele we-Chinese Communist Party u-Xi Jinping ngokuthi "impi yabantu" yokuvalela ukusaphazeka kwegciwane.
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a massive campaign later described by Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: Kulokho okubizwe ngokuthi "ukuvalelwa okukhulu emlandweni wesintu", intambo ngenhlanzeko yamenyezelwa ngo-23 January yokuvala ukungena nokuphuma e-Wuhan, eyandiselwa inani lamadolobha angu-15 cities e-Hubei, okuthinta inani lezigi zabantu ezingu-57.
en-mt: In what has been called the "biggest lockdown in human history", a lockdown was announced on January 23 to block entry and exit from Wuhan, which was extended to 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of 57 people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: Ukusebenzisa imoto yakho bekuvinjelwe edolobheni.
en-mt: Using your car was prohibited in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: Ukugubha Unyaka Omusha e-China (25 January) kwakhanselwa ezindaweni eziningi.
en-mt: Chinese New Year celebrations (January 25) were canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: Abasemagunyeni baphinda bamemezela ukwakhiwa kwesibhedlela sesikhashana, i-Huoshenshan Hospital, eyaqedwa ezinsukwini ezingu-10.
en-mt: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Esinye isibhedlela sakhiwa kamuva, i-Leishenshan Hospital, ukuze sinakekele iziguli ezengeziwe.
en-mt: Another hospital was built later, Leishenshan Hospital, to care for more patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Ngaphezu kokwakha izibhedlela ezintsha, i-China futhi yaguqula izindawo ezingu-14 e-Wuhan, njengezikhungo zemihlangano nezitediyamu, zaba yizibhedlela zesikhashana. Ngo-26 January, uhulumeni waqalisa ezinye izinyathelo zokuvalela ukuqubuka kwe-COVID-19, okuhlanganisa ukukhipha izimemezelo zezempilo zabahambi nokunweba iholidi Lomkhosi weNtwasahlobo.
en-mt: In addition to building new hospitals, China also converted 14 places in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals. On 26 January, the government initiated other measures to contain the outbreak of COVID-19, including issuing health declarations for travelers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Amanyuvesi nezikole ezweni nawo avalwa.
en-mt: Universities and schools in the country were also closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: Izifunda zase-Hong Kong ne-Macau zaqalisa izinyathelo ezimbalwa, ikakhulukazi ngokuphathelene nezikole namanyuvesi.
en-mt: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau implemented several measures, especially in relation to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Izinyathelo zokusebenza ukude zaqaliswa ezifundeni ezimbalwa zase-China.
en-mt: Remote working measures were implemented in several regions of China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Imikhawulo yokuhamba yamiswa ngaphakathi nangaphandle kwe-Hubei.
en-mt: Travel restrictions were imposed in and out of Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: Ezokuthutha zomphakathi zathuthukiswa, futhi amanyuziyemu kulo lonke elase-China avalwa isikhashana.
en-mt: Public transportation was improved, and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: Ukulawula ukunyakaza komphakathi kwafakwa kumadolobha amaningi, futhi kuqhathaniswe ukuthi okungenani izigidi zabantu ezingu-760 (okungaphezulu kwengxenye yenani labantu) zabhekana nohlobo lomkhawulo wangaphandle. Ngemuva kokuthi ukuqubuka kungene esigabeni sakho sembulunga ngo-March, amagunya ase-China athatha izinyathelo eziqinile zokuvikela igciwane ukuthi "lingangeni" livela kwamanye amazwe.
en-mt: Control of social movement was imposed in many cities, and it is estimated that at least 760 million people (more than half of the population) faced a form of external restriction. After the outbreak entered its global stage in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "immigrating" from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, i-Beijing ibeke ukuvalewa okuyimpoqo kwezinsuku ezingu-14 kubo bonke abahambi bamazwe abafikayo edolobheni. Ngo-23 March, izwe eliyinhloko e-China bekunesibonelo esisodwa kuphela sokudlulisela ngaphakathi ezinsukwini ezinhlanu ngaphambili, kulesi senzakalo ngomhambi obebuyela e-Guangzhou evela e-Istanbul.
en-mt: For example, Beijing has imposed a mandatory 14-day quarantine on all international travelers arriving in the city. On 23 March, the main country in China had only one example of internal transmission five days earlier, in this case by a traveler who was returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: On 24 March 2020, uNdunankulu wase-China u-Li Keqiang wabika ukuthi ukusabalala kwezibonelo ezidluliselene ngaphakathi bekuvinjiwe nokuthi ukuqubuka bekulawuliwe e-China.
en-mt: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of internally transmitted samples had been stopped and that the outbreak had been brought under control in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Ngosuku olufanayo lokwenziwa lula kwemikhawulo yokuhamba e-Hubei, ngaphandle kwe-Wuhan, izinyanga ezimbili ngemva kokuphoqelelwa kokuvala phansi. I-Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs yamemezela ngo-26 March 2020 ukuthi ukungena kwabanama-visa noma abanezimvume zokuhlala kuzomiswa kusukela ngo-28 March kuqhubeke, ngaphandle kwemininingwane eqondile yokuthi lenqubomgomo izophela nini.
en-mt: On the same day of the easing of travel restrictions in Hubei, outside Wuhan, two months after the forced shutdown. The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that the entry of those with visas or residence permits will be suspended from 28 March onwards, without specific details on when this policy will end.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
