targetString: I-Allergic contact dermatitis, i-contact urticaria syndrome noma i- hypersensitivity to alcohol noma ama-additives akhona kuma-alcohol hand rubs awavamile ukuba khona.
en-mt: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs are rare.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: Isimo esiphansi sokubangela i-irritant contact dermatitis sibe okukhangayo uma siqhathaniswa nokuhlanza izandla ngensipho namanzi.
en-mt: The low risk of causing irritant contact dermatitis is attractive compared to hand washing with soap and water.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: Kungakhathaliseki ukusebenza kwazo, izimeleli ezingenamanzi azikwazi ukuhlanza izandla ezintweni zemvelo, kodwa zibulala amagciwane nje.
en-mt: Regardless of their effectiveness, water-free hand sanitizers cannot clean hands from natural substances, but only kill germs.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: Kungalesi sizathu ukuthi ama-hand sanitizers awasebenzi kahle njengensipho namanzi ekuvikeleni ukusabalala kwama-pathogens amaningi, njengoba ama-pathogens eqhubeka esezandleni.
en-mt: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water in preventing the spread of many pathogens, as pathogens remain on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Ukuphumelela kwama-hand sanitizer angenayo i-alcohol kuncike kakhulu ezithakweni nokuhlanganiswa, futhi ngokomlando asebenza ngokuphoxayo kune-alcohol nama-alcohol rubs.
en-mt: The effectiveness of alcohol-free hand sanitizers is highly dependent on ingredients and formulations, and historically they have been less effective than alcohol and alcohol rubs.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Muva nje, ukuhlanganisa okusebenzisa i-benzalkonium chloride kubonise ukuphikelela nokwanda komsebenzi we-antimicrobial ngemuva kokugcoba, ngokungafani ne-alcohol, esibonisiwe ukuthi yehlisa izinga lokusebenza ngemva kokusebenza ngokuphindwa, kungenzeka ingesizathu sokusabela okuqhubekayo kwesikhumba.
en-mt: Recently, formulations using benzalkonium chloride have shown persistence and increased antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease efficacy after repeated application, which may be the reason for persistent skin reactions.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Abantu abaningi emiphakathini entulayo kwezezimali abakwazi ukuthenga insipho futhi basebenzisa umlotha noma inhlabathi esikhundleni.
en-mt: Many people in financially poor communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Umlotha noma inhlabathi ingase isebenze kangcono kunamanzi kuphela, kodwa isebenze kancane kunensipho.
en-mt: Ash or soil may work better than water alone, but less effective than soap.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Okukodwa okukhathazayo ukuthi uma inhlabathi noma umlotha uthole ukungcola kwama-micro-organisms kungase kuphakamise ukusabalala kwesifo kunokusinciphisa.
en-mt: One concern is that if the soil or ash gets contaminated with micro-organisms it may increase the spread of the disease rather than reduce it.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Njengensipho, umlotha nawo uyisimeleli esiqeda igciwane ngoba lapho uhlanganiswa namanzi, kudaleka ingxube ye-alkaline.
en-mt: Like soap, ash is also a disinfectant because when mixed with water, an alkaline solution is created.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: I-WHO ikhuthaza umlotha noma isihlabathi esikhundleni sensipho uma insipho ingatholakali.
en-mt: WHO recommends ash or sand instead of soap if soap is not available.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Inqubo efanele yokuhlanza izandla ekhuthazwa i-US Centers for Disease Control for prevention of transmission of disease ihlanganisa lezi zinyathelo:
en-mt: The proper hand washing procedure recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control for prevention of transmission of disease includes these steps:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Matisa izandla ngamanzi ahambayo afudumele noma abandayo.
en-mt: Wet your hands with warm or cold running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Amanzi ahambayo ayakhuthazwa ngoba obheseni abamile kungenzeka babe nokungcola, kanti isimo sokubanda noma sokushisa samanzi asibonisi senza umehluko.
en-mt: Running water is encouraged because stagnant basins may contain impurities, and cold or hot water does not seem to make a difference.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Gcoba izandla ngokuzihlikihla ngensipho eyanele kahle, kuhlanganise ingemuva lezandla, phakathi neminwe, nangaphansi kwezinzipho.
en-mt: Wash your hands by rubbing them with a good amount of soap, including the backs of the hands, between the fingers, and under the nails.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Insipho iphakamisa amagciwane esikhumbeni, futhi ucwaningo lubonisa ukuthi abantu bavame ukuhlanza izandla zabo kakhle uma insipho ikhona kunalapho besebenzisa amanzi kuphela.
en-mt: Soap raises bacteria on the skin, and research shows that people tend to clean their hands better when soap is present than when they use only water.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Huhla okungenani imizuzwana engu-20.
en-mt: Slow down for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Ukuhuhla kubangela ukushisa, okusizayo ekususeni amagciwane esikhumbeni, futhi ukuhuhla isikhathi esinde kususa amagciwane engeziwe.
en-mt: Rubbing causes heat, which helps remove bacteria from the skin, and rubbing for a long time removes more bacteria.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Hlambulula kahle ngaphansi kwamanzi ahambayo.
en-mt: Rinse well under running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Ukuhlambulula kubheseni kungase kuzingcolise izandla
en-mt: Rinsing in the basin can contaminate your hands

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Omisa ngethawula elihlanzekile noma uvumele zome ngomoya.
en-mt: Dry with a clean towel or let air dry.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Izandla ezimanzi neziswakeme zikuthatha kalula ukungcola. Izindawo ezilibaleka kalula isithupha, isihlakalo, izindawo eziphakathi neminwe, nangaphansi kwezinzipho.
en-mt: Wet and damp hands are easier to get dirty. Places that are easily forgotten are the thumb, the wrist, the places between the fingers, and under the nails.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Izinzipho zokufakelwa ne-nail polish edlekile kungafukamela ama-microorganism.
en-mt: Artificial nails and contaminated nail polish can harbor microorganisms.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Iloshini eswakamisayo ivamile ukukhuthazwa ukuze ugcine izandla zingomile; isikhumba esomile singaholela ekulimaleni kwesikhumba okungaphakamisa ukuchayeka kokudluliselwa isifo.
en-mt: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep hands dry; Dry skin can lead to skin damage that can increase exposure to infection.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Izinhlelo ezihlukile ezingabizi zingenziwa ukuze kuhlangabezanwe nokuhlanza izandla lapho amanzi empompi kanye/noma insipho kungatholakali isib. ukuthela amanzi ngokulengisa isitsha noma isigubhu esinezimbobo ezifanele kanye/noma usebenzise umlotha uma kudingeka emazweni asathuthuka. Ezimweni ezinamanzi alinganiselwe (njengezikole noma izindawo zasemaphandleni emazweni asathuthuka), kunezinqubo eziyisixazulo zokonga amanzi, njengama-"tippy-taps" nezinye izinhlobo zokonga imali.
en-mt: Alternative, cost-effective systems can be developed to accommodate hand washing where tap water and/or soap is not available eg. pour water by hanging a container or drum with suitable holes and/or use ashes if needed in developing countries. In situations with limited water (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are practical ways to save water, such as "tippy-taps" and other forms of savings.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: I-tippy-tap ubuchwepheshe obulula bokusebenzisa isigubhu esiboshwe ngentambo, nesigwedlo esisebenza ngonyawo esithela amanzi amancane ezandleni neqhuzu lensipho.
en-mt: Tippy-tap is a simple technique of using a drum tied with a rope, and a foot-operated paddle that pours a small amount of water on the hands and a bar of soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Ukomisa okusebenzayo kwezandla kuyingxenye ebalulekile yenqubo yenhlanzeko yezandla, kodwa kunokuphikisana mayelana nendlela esebenza ngcono yokomisa ezindaweni zokuhlanza zomphakathi.
en-mt: Effective hand drying is an important part of the hand hygiene process, but there is controversy about the best way to dry hands in public restrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Izinga elandayo locwaningo lusikisela ukuthi amathawula ephepha angcono ngokuhlanzeka kunezomisi zomoya zikagesi ezitholakala ezindaweni zokuhlanza.
en-mt: A growing body of research suggests that paper towels are better for cleaning than the electric air dryers found in laundry facilities.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Ngo-2008, ucwaningo olwaluqondiswa i-University of Westminster, London, futhi elalixhaswe imboni yamathawula ephepha i-European Tissue Symposium, ukuthi iqhathanise amazinga enhlanzeko atholakala kumathawula ephepha, izomisi zezandla zomoya oshisayo nezomisi zezandla zamuva zomoya osheshayo.
en-mt: In 2008, a study led by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper towel industry European Tissue Symposium, compared the levels of hygiene found in paper towels, hot air hand dryers and modern fast air hand dryers.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuhlanza nokomisa izandla ngesomisi somoya oshisayo, ingqikithi yesibalo samagciwane satholakala siphakama ngesilinganiso kumaphedi eminwe ngo-194% futhi ematheni esandla ngo-254%.
en-mt: After cleaning and drying hands with a hot air dryer, the total bacterial count was found to increase on average on finger pads by 194% and on palms by 254%.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Ukomisa ngesomisi somoya osheshayo kwaphumelela ekuphakameni ngesilinganiso sengqikithi yesibalo samagciwane kumaphedi eminwe ngo-42% futhi ematheni esandla ngo-15%.
en-mt: Drying with a rapid air dryer was effective in increasing the average total bacterial count on finger pads by 42% and on palms by 15%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuhlanza nokomisa izandla ngethawula lephepha, ingqikithi yesibalo segciwane yehla ngesilinganiso kumaphedi eminwe ngo-76% futhi ematheni esandla ngokufika ku-77%. Ososayensi baphinda bathatha ukuhlola okungaveza uma belikhona ithuba lokuthelelana kwabasenzisi bezindawo zokuhlanza nendawo yokuhlanza njengomphumela wendlela ngayinye yokomisa.
en-mt: After cleaning and drying hands with a paper towel, the total bacterial count decreased on average on finger pads by 76% and on palms by up to 77%. The scientists also conducted tests that would reveal if there was a chance of cross-contamination between cleaners and cleaners as a result of each drying method.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: Isomisi somoya osheshayo, esiphephetha umoya ovela kuso ngesivinini esibekiwe sika-180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), saphumelela ukuphephetha ama-micro-organisms esandleni nakuso nokucishe sithelele abanye abasebenzisi nendawo yokuhlanza ibanga elingaba amamitha angu-2.
en-mt: The high-speed air dryer, which blows air from it at a set speed of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), succeeded in blowing micro-organisms on the hand and on it and almost infecting other users and the cleaning area at a distance of about 2 meters.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Ukusetshenziswa komoya oshisayo kusabalalise ama-micro-organisms kuze kube amamitha angu-0.25 kusuka kwisomisi.
en-mt: The use of hot air spreads micro-organisms up to 0.25 meters from the dryer.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Amathawula ephepha awabonisanga kusabalala okuqaphelekayo kwama-micro-organisms. Ngo-2005, ucwaningo olwaqondiswa i-TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, izindlela zokomisa izandla ezihlukile zahlolwa.
en-mt: Paper towels showed no detectable proliferation of micro-organisms. In 2005, a study directed by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were tested.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: Ushintsho olulandelayo esibalweni samagciwane ngemuva kokomisa izandla kwaqaphelwa:
en-mt: The following changes in bacterial counts after hand drying were observed:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Baningi abakhiqizi bezomisi zezandla abakhona, futhi izimisi zezandla zike zaqhathaniswa nokomisa ngama-paper towels.
en-mt: There are many manufacturers of hand dryers, and hand dryers have been compared to drying with paper towels.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla usebenzisa ama-hand sanitizing asulayo kungenye indlela lapho usohambweni ingenkho insipho namanzi.
en-mt: Washing your hands using hand sanitizers is another option when you are traveling without soap and water.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: I-hand sanitizer eyakhiwe nge-alcohol kumele ibe ne-alcohol ngu-60% okungenani.
en-mt: An alcohol-based hand sanitizer must contain at least 60% alcohol.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kwezokwelapha kwaphoqelelwa isikhathi eside ngemuva kokuthi udokotela wase-Hungary u-Ignaz Semmelweis ethole ukusebenza kwakho (ngo-1846) ekuvikeleni isifo endaweni yasesibhedlela.
en-mt: Medical hand hygiene was enforced long after the Hungarian doctor Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in the hospital environment.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Kunamadivayisi asebenza ngogesi ahlinzekela ngokuphawula okukhumbuza izisebenzi zasesibhedlela ukuthi zihlanze izandla lapho zikhohlwa.
en-mt: There are electronic devices that provide reminders to hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Ucwaningo olulodwa luthole ukuncipha kwamazinga ezifo ngokusebenza kwawo.
en-mt: One study found a reduction in disease rates with its effectiveness.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kwezokwelapha kuba imizuzwana engu-15, usebenzisa insipho eningi namanzi noma ijeli ukuze ugcobe noma uhlikihle ingxenye ngayinye yezandla.
en-mt: Medical handwashing takes 15 seconds, using plenty of soap and water or gel to rub or rub each part of the hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Izandla kumelwe zihlikihlwe ndawonye ngokugaxelanisa iminwe.
en-mt: The hands must be rubbed together by interlacing the fingers.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Uma kunokungcola ngaphansi kwezinzipho, i-bristle brush ingasebenziswa ukuze ikususe.
en-mt: If there is dirt under the nails, a bristle brush can be used to remove it.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Njengoba amagciwane engahlala emanzini asezandleni, kubalulekile ukuhlambulula kahle bese usula kome ngethawula elihlanzekile.
en-mt: Since germs can live in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse them thoroughly and then dry them with a clean towel.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Ngemuva kokomisa, ithawula lephepha kumele litshenziselwe ukuvala amanzi (nokuvula noma isiphi isicabha sokuphuma uma kwenzeka).
en-mt: After drying, a paper towel should be used to cover the water (and open any exit door if possible).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Lokhu kugwema ukuphinde ungcolise izandla ngalezo zindawo.
en-mt: This avoids re-contaminating your hands in those areas.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Inhloso yokuhlanza izandla esimweni sokwezokunakekela ukususa ama-pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") bese ugwema ukuwadlulisela.
en-mt: The purpose of handwashing in a healthcare setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: I-The New England Journal of Medicine ibika ukuthi ukuyekelela ukuhlanza izandla kuqhubeka ngamazinga angemukeleki ezindaweni eziningi zezokwelapha, isibalo esikhulu sodokotela nabahlengikazi beqhubeka bekhohlwa ukuhlanza izandla zabo ngaphambi kokuthinta iziguli, kanjalo badlulisele ama-microorganisms.
en-mt: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that neglect of hand hygiene continues at unacceptable levels in many medical facilities, with a large number of doctors and nurses continuing to forget to wash their hands before touching patients, thereby transferring microorganisms.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Ucwaningo olulodwa lwabonisa ukuthi ukuhlanza izandla ngendlela nezinye izinqubo ezilula kungehlisa izinga le-catheter-related bloodstream infections ngo-66 percent. I-World Health Organization inyathelise ishidi elibonisa isimiso sokuhlanza izandla nokuhlikihla izandla emkhakheni wokunakekela kwezempilo.
en-mt: One study showed that proper hand washing and other simple procedures can reduce the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent. The World Health Organization has published a hand-washing and hand-rubbing practice sheet in the health care sector.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Iziqondiso zenhlangano ezisalungiswa zenhlanzeko yezandla zingatholakala kuwebusayithi yayo ukuze umphakathi uphawule.
en-mt: The agency's draft hand hygiene guidelines are available on its website for public comment.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Ukubuyekeza okufanele kwaqondiswa i-Whitby et al.
en-mt: A relevant review was directed by Whitby et al.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Amadivayisi ezitolo angakwazi ukulinganisa nokuqinisekisa inhlanzeko yezandla, uma ukubonisa nokuvumelana nomthetho kufuneka.
en-mt: Point-of-sale devices can measure and ensure hand hygiene, if demonstration and compliance are required.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: I-World Health Organization "inezikhathi eziyisihlanu" zokuhlanza izandla:
en-mt: The World Health Organization has "five times" to wash hands:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: ngemuva kokuchayeka egazini/kuketshezi lwegazi
en-mt: after exposure to blood/blood fluids

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: ngaphambi komsebenzi we-aseptic, kanye
en-mt: before aseptic work, and

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: nangemuva kokunakekela isiguli. Ukufaka amakhemikhali anqandayo ensiphweni ("enomuthi" noma izinsipho "ezinqanda ama-microbes") kunika amandla okubulala kulokho kokuhlanza izandla.
en-mt: and after caring for the patient. Adding antibacterial chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "anti-microbial" soaps) gives the hand sanitizer its killing power.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Lawo mandla okubulala angase adingeke ngaphambi komsebenzi wokuhlinza noma ezimweni lapho ama-antibiotic-resistant organisms emaningi khona. 'Ukuhuhla' izandla kothile ngenjongo yomsebenzi wokuhlinza, kuyadingeka ukuba nempompi engavulwa futhi uvalwe ngaphandle kokuthintwa ngezandla, i-chlorhexidine noma i-iodine wash, ama-sterile towels okomisa izandla ngemuva kokuhlanza, ne-sterile brush yokuhuhla kanye nenye i-sterile instrument yokuhlanza ngaphansi kwezinzipho.
en-mt: That killing power may be needed before surgery or in situations where antibiotic-resistant organisms are abundant. To 'rub' someone's hands for the purpose of surgery, it is necessary to have a faucet that can be opened and closed without touching hands, chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels to dry hands after cleaning, a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning underneath of nails.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Konke okokuhloba kumele kukhunyulwe.
en-mt: All jewelry must be removed.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Lenqubo idinga ukuhlanzwa kwezandla nezingalo kufike endololwaneni, ngokuvamile imizuzu engu-2-6.
en-mt: This procedure requires washing the hands and arms up to the elbow, usually for 2-6 minutes.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Izikhathi ezinde zokuhuhla (imizuzu engu-10) azisona isidingo.
en-mt: Long stirring times (10 minutes) are not necessary.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Lapho uyakaza, amanzi asezingalweni kumele avinjwe angagijimeli emuva ezandleni.
en-mt: When swimming, the water in the arms must be prevented from running back into the hands.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuphetha ukuhlanza izandla, izandla zomiswa ngendwangu e-sterile noma ingubo yokuhlinza iyagqokwa.
en-mt: After finishing cleaning the hands, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth or a surgical gown is worn.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Ukuze kwehliswe ukusabalala kwagciwane, kungcono ukuhlanza izandla noma ukusebenzisa isinqandamagciwane sezandla ngaphambili nangemuva kokunakekela umuntu ogulayo.
en-mt: To reduce the spread of the virus, it is best to wash your hands or use hand sanitizer before and after caring for a sick person.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Ukuze kulawulwe izifo ze-staphylococcal ezibhedlela, kuye kwatholakala ukuthi inzuzo enkulu evela ezandleni ezicocekile ivela ku-20% wokuqala wokuhlanza, nokuthi incane kakhulu izuzo eyengeziwe etholakalayo lapho ukuhlanza izandla ngokuphindelela kukhushulwe ngaphezulu kuka-35%.
en-mt: For the control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from clean hands comes from the first 20% of washing, and that there is very little additional benefit when hand washing is increased more than 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: Ukuhlanza ngensipho engenalutho kuba nomphumela wezinga elengezwe kathathu lesifo segciwane elithathelanayo ekudleni uma kuqhathaniswa nokuhlanza ngensipho enqanda amagciwane. Ukuqhathanisa i-hand-rubbing nge-alcohol-based solution ne-hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
en-mt: Cleansing with plain soap results in three times the rate of foodborne illness compared to cleaning with antibacterial soap. Comparing hand-rubbing with an alcohol-based solution and hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Kodwa insipho namanzi kusebenza kangcono kunama-alcohol-based hand rubs ekunciphiseni i-H1N1 influenza A virus ne-Clostridium difficile spores ezandleni. Ukungenela ukuze kuthuthukiswe inhlanzeko yezandla ezimweni zokunakekela impilo kungahlanganisa ukufundisa izisebenzi ngokuhlanza izandla, ukuphakamisa ukutholakala kwe-alcohol-based hand rub, nezikhumbuzo ezibhaliwe nezishiwoyo kubasebenzi.
en-mt: But soap and water are more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs in reducing the H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores on the hands. Interventions to improve hand hygiene in health care settings may include educating staff about hand hygiene, promoting the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Kunesidingo socwaningo olwengeziwe oluphenya ukuthi iyiphi kulezindlela zokungenela esebenza kangcono ezimweni zokunakekela impilo ezingafani.
en-mt: There is a need for more research investigating which of these interventions work best in different health care settings.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Emazweni asathuthuka, ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kuqashelwa njengendlela eyongayo, ithuluzi elibalulekile lokufinyelela impilo enhle, ngisho nokondleka ngokomzimba.
en-mt: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as an economical method, an important tool for achieving good health, and even physical nutrition.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Kodwa, ukuntuleka kokuphakelwa amanzi okunokuthenjelwa, insipho noma izindawo zokuhlanza izandla emakhaya abantu, ezikoleni nasezindaweni zokusebenza zenza kube inselele ukufinyelela imikhuba yokuhlanza izandla yomhlaba.
en-mt: However, the lack of reliable water supply, soap or handwashing facilities in people's homes, schools and workplaces makes it a challenge to achieve universal handwashing practices.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, emaphandleni amaningi e-Africa izimpompi yokuhlanza izandla eseduze nezindlu zangasese zomuntu noma zomphakhathi iyantuleka, yize zikhona izindlela ezingaduli zokwakha izindawo zokuhlanza izandla.
en-mt: For example, in many rural areas of Africa, hand-washing taps near private or public toilets are lacking, although there are inexpensive ways to build hand-washing facilities.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Kodwa, amazinga aphansi okuhlanza izandla kungenzeka ayisizathu semikhuba egxilile kunaleso sokuntuleka kwensipho noma kwamanzi.
en-mt: However, low levels of hand washing may be the reason for more entrenched practices than lack of soap or water.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Ukukhangisa nokumelela ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kungaba nomthelela ekwenzeni iziqumo zomthetho, kuphakamise ukuqapha ngezinzuzo zokuhlanza izandla futhi kuholele ekushintsheni kwemikhuba ehlalayo yomphakathi.
en-mt: Advertising and advocacy for handwashing with soap can influence the implementation of legislation, raise awareness of the benefits of handwashing and lead to lasting changes in public attitudes.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Ukuze lokhu kusebenze kahle, ukuqapha nokulandelela kubalulekile.
en-mt: For this to be effective, monitoring and follow-up are essential.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Ukubuyekeza okuhleliwe kocwaningo olungu-70 kuthole ukuthi izindlela ezincika emphakathini ziyasebenza ekuphakamiseni ukuhlanza izandla kuma-LMIC, kuyilapho imikhankaso yokukukhangisa ngokwezenhlalo kusebenza kancane. Isibonelo esisodwa sokukhangisa ukuhlanza izandla ezikoleni "Indlela Yezinkanyezi Ezintathu" ye-UNICEF ekhuthaza izikole ukuthi zithathe izinyathelo ezilula , ezongayo ukuze kuqinisekwe ukuthi abafundi bahlanza izandla zabo ngensipho, phakathi nezinye izimfuneko zenhlanzeko.
en-mt: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective in promoting handwashing in LMICs, while social media campaigns are less effective. One example of promoting hand washing in schools is UNICEF's "Three Star Method" which encourages schools to take simple, cost-effective measures to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygiene requirements.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Lapho amazinga amancane efinyelelwa, izikole zingasuka kwesinye futhi ekugcineni ziye kwezintathu izinkanyezi.
en-mt: When minimum levels are reached, schools can move from one and eventually to three stars.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: Ukwakha izindawo zokuhlanza izandla kungaba yingxenye yemikhankaso yokukhangisa ukuhlanza izandla eyenziwayo ukuze kuncishiswe izifo nokufa kwezinsana.
en-mt: Building handwashing facilities can be part of handwashing advertising campaigns to reduce infant mortality and morbidity.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Usuku Lomhlaba lokuhlanza Izandla ngenye yezibonelo zemikhankaso ephakamisa ukuqapha ezama ukufinyelela ukushintsha kwemikhuba. Njengomphumela wobhubhane lwe-2019-20 coronavirus, i-UNICEF yakhangisa ukusebenziswa kabanzi kwe-emoji yokuhlanz'izandla.
en-mt: World Handwashing Day is one example of awareness raising campaigns that try to achieve behavioral change. As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the widespread use of the hand hygiene emoji.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Ucwaningo olumbalwa luye lacabangela izindleko zonkana zokusebenza kokuhlanza izandla emazweni asathuthuka nobudlelwano nokuvimba kwe-DALYs.
en-mt: Few studies have considered the overall cost of handwashing practices in developing countries and the relationship to DALYs averted.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Kodwa, ukubuyekeza okukodwa kuphakamisa ukuthi ukukhangisa ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho konga izindleko kakhulu kunokunye ukungenelela ngamanzi nokukhuculula.
en-mt: However, one review suggests that promoting handwashing with soap is more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Ukubaluleka kokuhlanza izandla kwezempilo yomuntu – ikakhulukazi kubantu abangaphansi kwezimo ezibuthaka njengomame abasanda kubeletha noma amasosha alimele ezibhedlela – kwaqaphelwa okokuqala phakathi lekhulu leminyaka lika-19 ngamavulandlela amabili enhlanzeko yezandla: Udokotela wase-Hungary u-Ignaz Semmelweis owayesebenza e-Vienna, e-Austria no-Florence Nightingale, Ingisi "elasungula ubuhlengikazi besimanje".
en-mt: The importance of hand hygiene for human health – especially for people in vulnerable situations such as mothers who have just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first noticed in the middle of the 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: Hungarian doctor Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the Englishwoman who "invented modern nursing".

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Ngaleso sikhathi abantu abaningi babesakholelwa ukuthi izifo zibangwa amaphunga amabi ayebizwa ngama-miasmas.
en-mt: At that time many people still believed that diseases were caused by bad smells called miasmas.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Ngawo-1980, ukuqubuka okuvela ekudleni nezifo ezihlobene nezokwelapha kwaholela i-United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention ukuthi ikhangise ngokwengeziwe ukuhlanza izandla njengendlela ebalulekile yokuvikela ukusabalala kwesifo.
en-mt: In the 1980s, outbreaks of foodborne and medical-related illnesses led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to increasingly promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of disease.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Ukuqubuka kwe-swine flu ngo-2009 kanye nobhubhane lwe-COVID-19 ngo-2020 kuholele ekuqapheni okuphakeme emazweni amaningi mayelana nokubaluleka kokuhlanza izandla ngensipho ukuze umuntu azivikele kulolu hlobo lwezifo ezithathelanayo.
en-mt: The swine flu outbreak in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 have led to heightened awareness in many countries about the importance of hand washing with soap to protect oneself from this type of infectious disease.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, amaphosta anombhalo othi "inqubo efanele yokuhlanza izandla" aphanyekwa phezulu eduze kukasinki wokuhlanza izandla ezindlini zangasese zomphakathi nasezindlini zangasese kumabhilidi amahhovisi nasezikhumulweni zezindiza e-Germany.
en-mt: For example, posters with the text "proper hand washing practice" are hung up next to hand washing sinks in public restrooms and restrooms in office buildings and airports in Germany.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Isisho esithi "ukuhlanza izandla zakho" kokuthile, kusho ukucacisa ungafuni kothile ukuthatha umthwalo wemfanelo kokuthile noma ukuhileleka kuyo.
en-mt: The expression "to wash your hands" of something, means to make it clear that you do not want someone to take responsibility for something or be involved in it.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Umsuka wayo yingxenye yeBhayibheli ekuMathewu lapho uPontiyu Pilatu ezihlanza izandla ekwenzeni isinqumo sokubethela uJesu Krestu, kodwa sesiphenduke isisho esisebenza kabanzi kweminye imiphakathi yamaNgisi.
en-mt: Its origin is a part of the Bible in Matthew where Pontius Pilate cleans his hands in making the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but it has become a widely used expression in some English communities.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Ku-Macbeth ka-Shakespeare, Intokazi u-Macbeth iqala sakuphoqa ngokuzihlanza izandla izama ukuzicoca ukungcola okucabangwayo, okumelela unembeza onecala ngokuphathelene namacala ayewenzile futhi wanxenxela umyeni wakhe ukuba awenze.
en-mt: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins by washing her hands in an attempt to cleanse herself of the imagined dirt, representing a guilty conscience regarding the crimes she committed and induced her husband to commit.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Kuphinde kwatholakala ukuthi abantu, ngemuva kokukhumbula noma kokucabanga ngezenzo ezingafanele, bavamile ukuhlanza izandla zobo izikhathi eziningana kunabanye, futhi bavamile ukwazisa ukubaluleka kwezinto zokuhlanza izandla kakhudlwana.
en-mt: It has also been found that people, after remembering or thinking about wrongdoing, tend to wash their hands more often than others, and tend to appreciate the importance of hand sanitizers more.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, lapho abavunyelwe ukuhlanza izandla zabo ngemuva kwalokho aba mancane amathuba abo okuhlanganyela kokuzisola ezenzweni "zokuhlanza", njengokuvoluntiya.
en-mt: Furthermore, when they are not allowed to clean their hands afterwards they are less likely to engage in regretful "cleaning" activities, such as volunteering.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Inkolo ikhuthaza ukuhlanza izandla ngakho kokubili injongo yenhlanzeko nomfuziselo. Umfuziselo ekuhlanzeni izandla, usebenzisa amanzi kodwa ngaphandle kwensipho ukuze uhlanze izandla, kuyingxenye yenqubo yokuhlanza izandla ekhona kweziningi izinkolo, kuhlanganise i-Bahá'í Faith, i-Hinduism, i-tevilah ne-netilat yadayim ku-Judaism, i-Lavabo ku-Christianity, ne-Wudhu ku-Islam. Izinkolo ziphinde zikhuthaze ukuhlanza izandla, ikakhulukazi ngemuva kwezenzo ezithile.
en-mt: Religion encourages hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes. An example of hand washing, using water but without soap to wash hands, is part of the hand washing process that exists in many religions, including the Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity , and Wudhu in Islam. Religions also encourage hand washing, especially after certain activities.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: I-Hinduism, i-Judaism ne-Islam iphoqa ukuhlanzwa kwezandla ngemuva kokusebenzisa indlu yangasese.
en-mt: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam require hand washing after using the toilet.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Futhi, i-Hinduism, i-Buddhism, i-Sikhism, i-Judaism ne-Islam iphoqa ukuhlanza izandla ngaphambi nangemuva kokudla.
en-mt: Also, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam require washing hands before and after eating.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: Izilawuli zendowo yomsebenzi zengozi ye-COVID-19
en-mt: Workplace controls for the risk of COVID-19

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Izilawuli zengozi endaweni yomsebenzi ze-COVID-19 ukusebenziswa kwezinqubo zokulawula izingozi ze-occupational safety and health ekuvikeleni isifoe se-coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: Workplace risk controls for COVID-19 are the use of occupational safety and health risk management practices to prevent the spread of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Izilawuli ezifanele zengozi endaweni yomsebenzi zincike endaweni yokusebenza nohlobo lomsebenzi, ngokusekela ekuhloleni ubungozi bemithombo yokuchayeka, ubunzima besifo emphakathini, nezinto eziyingozi kubasebenzi ngabanye okungenzeka babuthaka ekunqandeni i-COVID-19.
en-mt: Appropriate risk controls in the workplace depend on the workplace and type of work, based on assessing the risk of exposure sources, the severity of the disease in the community, and risk factors for individual workers who may be vulnerable to COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), imisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphansi kwengozi inezinga eliphansi lokuthintana nomphakathi nezinye izisebenzi, okuthi izinyathelo ezilula zokuvikela ziyakhuthazwa, kuhlanganisa ukuhlanza izandla, ukukhuthaza izisebenzi ukuthi zihlale emakhaya uma zigula, imikhuba emihle yokuphefumula, nokugcina inqubo yokuhlanza nokubulala amagciwane endaweni yokusebenza.
en-mt: According to the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), low-risk jobs have a low level of public contact with other workers, for which simple protective measures are encouraged, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, good respiratory practices, and maintaining proper cleaning and disinfection procedures. bacteria in the workplace.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Imisebenzi enokuchayeka engozini okuphakathi ihlanganisa leyo efuna ukuthinta njalo futhi okuseduze nabantu abangaziwa noma abasolwa ukuba ne-COVID-19, kodwa bangase babe negciwane ngenxa yokudluliselana okuqhubekayo emphakathini noma ukuvakashela emazweni angaphandle.
en-mt: Occupations with moderate risk exposure include those that require frequent and close contact with people who are not known or suspected to have COVID-19, but may become infected through ongoing social transmission or travel to foreign countries.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Lokhu kuhlanganisa izisebenzi ezinokuthintana nomphakathi ovamile njengezikole, izindawe zokusebenza ezigcwala abantu abaminyene, kanye nezimo zokuthengisa ezinabaningi.
en-mt: This includes workers who may come into contact with the general public such as schools, crowded workplaces, and crowded retail environments.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Izilawuli zengozi kuleli qembu, ngaphezu kwezinyathelo zokuvikela igciwane ezilula, zihlanganisa i-ventilation esebenzisa i-high-efficiency air filters, ama-sneeze guards, kanye nokuba ne-personal protective equipment etholakalayo ezimweni lapho kutholakala umuntu one- COVID-19.
en-mt: Risk controls in this group, in addition to simple virus protection measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in cases where a person with COVID-19 is found.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: I-OSHA ibheka abasebenzi bezempilo nabasemakhazeni abachayeka kubantu abaziwayo noma abasolwa ngokuba ne-COVID-19 njengabasengozini ephakeme yokuchayeka, okuphakamela engozini ephakeme kakhulu yokuchayeka uma izisebenzi zenza ama-aerosol-generating procedures, noma zilanda noma ziphatha ama-specimens asuka kubantu abaziwayo noma abasolwa ngokuba ne-COVID-19.
en-mt: OSHA considers health care and cold storage workers who are exposed to people with known or suspected cases of COVID-19 to be at high risk of exposure, with the highest risk of exposure occurring if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures, or collect or handle specimens from people who are known or suspected to have and COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Izilawuli zengozi ezifanelekayo kulezi sebenzi kuhlanganisa izilawuli zokwakha njengama-negative pressure ventilation rooms, ne- personal protective equipment efanele emsebenzini.
en-mt: Appropriate risk controls for these workers include building controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and appropriate personal protective equipment at work.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: ukuqubuka kwe*COVID-19 kungaba nemiphumela enzima ngaphakathi endaweni yomsebenzi.
en-mt: *The outbreak of COVID-19 can have serious consequences within the workplace.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Izisebenzi zingase zingabibikho emsebenzini ngenxa yokugula, isidingo sokunakekela abanye, noma ngenxa yokusaba ithuba lokuchayeka.
en-mt: Employees may be absent from work due to illness, the need to care for others, or fear of exposure.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Imikhuba youthengisa ingase ishintshe, kukho kokubili uhlobo lwezimpahla ezifunekayo, anezindlela zokukuzithola lezi zimpahla (njengokuthenga ngezikhathi ezingekho matasa noma ngokulethelwa noma nemisebenzi yokudlula ngokushayela).
en-mt: Sales habits may change, both in the type of goods needed, and the means of obtaining these goods (such as shopping during off-peak hours or by delivery or drive-thru services).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Okokugcina, ukuthunyelwa kwezinto ezisuka ezindaweni ezithintwe kanzima i-COVID-19 kungase kuphazamiseke. Ukulungela isifo esithelelanayo nohlelo lokusabela kungasibenziswa ukuze kuqondise izenzo ezivikelayo.
en-mt: Finally, shipments from areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be disrupted. Infectious disease preparedness and response planning can be used to guide preventive actions.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Izinhlelo zibheka amazinga engozi ahilelekile ezindaweni ezingafani zokusebenza nohlobo lomsebenzi, zihlanganisa uhlobo lokuchayeka, izinto eziyingozi eziphakama ekhaya noma ezimweni zomphakathi, nezinto eziyingozi zabasebenzi ngabanye njengiminyaka ephakeme noma izimo zezifo ezingomahlalakhona.
en-mt: Programs look at the levels of risk involved in different workplaces and types of work, including the type of exposure, risk factors that arise at home or in social situations, and individual risk factors for workers such as advanced age or chronic disease conditions.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Ziphinde zicacise ukulawula okufanele ukuze kuhlangabezwe lezo zingozi, futhi izinhlelo ezilandelayo zezimo ezingaphakama njengomphumela wokuqubuka.
en-mt: They also specify the appropriate controls to meet those risks, and subsequent plans for situations that may arise as a result of an outbreak.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Ukulungela isifo esithelelanayo nezinhlelo zokusabela zingase zincike kokukhuthazwa umthetho wezwe noma wezifundazwe.
en-mt: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to the promotion of national or provincial legislation.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Izinjongo zokusabela esimweni sokuqubuka zihlanganisa ukunciphisa ukudliliselana phakathi nabasebenzi, ukuvikela abantu abasengozini ephakeme yezinkinga ezinzima zempilo, ukugcina imisebenzi yebhizinisi, nokunciphisa imiphumela enzima kwamanye amabhizinisi nabaphakeli bokuthenga.
en-mt: The goals of responding to an outbreak include reducing stress among employees, protecting people at high risk of serious health problems, maintaining business operations, and reducing adverse effects on other businesses and suppliers.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Ubunzima besifo emphakathini ibhizinisi elikuwo kuthinta izinyathelo zokusabela ezithathwayo.
en-mt: The severity of the disease in the community in which the business is located affects the response measures taken.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Izitebhisi zokulawula izingozi ifremuwekhi esebenziswa kabanzi ku-occupational safety and health ekuhlanganiseni izilawuli zengozi ngemiphumela.
en-mt: The risk management framework is a widely used framework in occupational safety and health for linking risk controls with outcomes.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Lapho izingozi ze-COVID-19 zingasuseki, ukulawula okusebenza kangcono ukulawula kokwakha, kulandelwa ukulawu kokuphatha, futhi ekugcineni izinto zokuvikela umuntu siqu.
en-mt: When the risks of COVID-19 are irreversible, the most effective control is building control, followed by administrative control, and finally personal protective equipment.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Izilawuli zokwakha zihilela ukuhlukanisa abasebenzi ezingozini ezihlobene nomsebenzi ngaphandle kokuthembela emkhubeni wesisebenzi, futhi zingaba isinyathelo esonga izindleko kakhulu lapho sifakwa.
en-mt: Building controls involve isolating workers from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be a very cost-saving measure when installed.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Izilawuli zokuphatha izinguquko emthethweni womsebenzi noma izinqubo odinga isinyathelo sesisebenzi noma somqashi
en-mt: Controls for managing changes in employment law or procedures that require employee or employer action

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) icatshangela iphumelela ngezinga eliphansi kunokulawula kokwakha nokulawula kokuphatha, kodwa kungasiza ekugwemeni ukuchayeka okuthile.
en-mt: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than building controls and management controls, but it can help prevent some exposures.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Zonke izinhlobo ze-PPE kumele zikhethwe ngokusekelwe engozini yesesebenzi, igqokwe ngendlela efanele njengokufanelekile (isib., amarespiretha), kugqokwe njalo futhi ngendlela, ihlolwe njalo, igcinwe, futhi ishintshwe, ngokwesidingo, futhi isuswe ngendlela efanele, ihlanzwe, futhi igcinwe noma or ilahlwe kugwenywe ukungcola.
en-mt: All types of PPE must be selected based on the worker's risk, properly worn as appropriate (e.g., respirators), worn regularly and properly, regularly tested, maintained, and replaced, as needed, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or or disposed of to avoid pollution.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), imisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphansi inokuthintana okuncane nomphakathi nezinye izisebenti ezingontanga.
en-mt: According to the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), jobs with low exposure have less contact with the public and other workers.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Izinyathelo ezilula zokuvikela igciwane ezikhuthaziwe kuzo zonke izindawo zokusebenza zihlanganisa ukuhlanza izandla kaningi futhi ngokwenzisisa, ukukhuthaza izisebenzi ukuthi zihlale ekhaya uma zigula, imikhuba yokuziphatha emihle yokuphefumula ehlanganisa ukumboza ukukhwehlela nokuthimula, ukuhlinzekela ngamathishu nezithako zomgqomo, ukulungiselela ukusebenzela ekhaya noma amashifu ashiyanayo kuye ngesidingo, khuthaza izisebenzi ukuthi zigweme ukusebenzisa amathuluzi abanye nezinto zokusebenza, futhi ziqhubeke zigcine inqubo yokuhlanza nokubulala amagciwane endaweni yomsebenzi.
en-mt: Simple infection prevention measures encouraged in all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home when sick, good respiratory hygiene practices including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and bin supplies, preparing to work from home or alternating shifts as needed, encouraging workers to avoid using other tools and equipment, and continue to maintain the cleaning and disinfection process in the work area.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Ukutholakala okusheshayo nokuhlukaniswa kwabantu okungenzeka banegciwane isinyathelo esibalulekile ekuvikeleni izisebenzi, amakhasimende, izibakashi, nabanye endaweni yomsebenzi.
en-mt: Rapid detection and isolation of potentially infected individuals is an important step in protecting employees, customers, visitors, and others in the workplace.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: I-U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) ikhuthaza ukuthi izisebenzi ezinezimpawu ze-acute respiratory illness kumele zihlale emakhaya kuze kube yilapho zingasenakho ukushisa, nezinye izimpawu okungenani amahora angu-24 ngaphandle kokusebenzisa imithi eyehlisa ukushisa noma eguqula izimpawu, nokuthi imithetho yezinsuku zokugula ibe egobekayo, vumela izisebenzi ukuthi zihlale ekhaya ukuze zinakekele ilungu lomndeni eligulayo, nokuthi abasebenzi bayazi lemithetho.
en-mt: U.S. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that workers with symptoms of acute respiratory illness must stay at home until they are free of fever and other symptoms for at least 24 hours without using antipyretic or symptom-modifying medications, and that sick days rules are flexible. allow employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees know these rules.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-OSHA, imisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphakathi ihlanganisa leyo misebenzi edinga ukuthintana njalo noma eduze ngamagxathi ayisithupha (1.8 m) nabantu abangaziwanoma abacatshangelwa ukuba iziguli ze-COVID-19, babe negciwane le-SARS-CoV-2 ngenxa yokudluluselana okuqhubekayo emphakathini oseduzane nendawo yokusebenza, noma ngesizathu sokuthi othile usanda kubuya ezweni langaphandle eliyindawo enokusabalala kokudluliselana nge-COVID-19.
en-mt: According to OSHA, jobs with medium exposure include those jobs that require constant or close contact of six feet (1.8 m) with people who are not known or suspected to be patients with COVID-19, have the SARS-CoV-2 virus due to ongoing transmission in the community near the workplace, or for the reason that someone has recently returned from a foreign country where there is widespread transmission of COVID-19.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Laba bahlanganisa izisebenzi ezinokuthintana nomphakathi ovamile njengezikole, izindawo zokusebenza ezigcwala kakhulu abantu, nezimo zokudayisa zesimo esiphakeme. Ukwakha izilawuli zala maqembu engozi ephakeme kuhlanganisa ukufaka ama-air filters ezinga eliphakeme lokusebenza, ukuphakamisa izinga le-ventilation, ukufaka imingcele njengeziqaphi zokuthimula zepulastiki, nokufaka iwindi lokudlula ngokushayela lesevisi yamakhasimende. Ukulawula kokuphatha kuleli qembu lemisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphakeme kuhlanganisa ukukhuthaza izisebenzi ezigulayo ukuthi zihlale emakhaya, ukufaka indlela yokuxhumana ngenqubo ye-virtual ukuthi ithathe indawo yemihlangano yobuso-nobuso, ukuqalisa amashifu ashiyanayo, ukumisa uhambo olungabalulekile oluya ezindaweni ezinokuqubuka kwe-COVID-19, ukwakha izinhlelo zokuxhumana kwesimo esiphuthumay okuhlanganisa i-forum yokuphendula izinkathazo zabasebenzi, ukuhlinzekela abasebenzi ngemfundo nokuqeqeshwa kwakamuva mayelana nezinto eziyingozi nge-COVID-19 nemikhuba yokuzivikela, ukuqeqesha abasebenzi abadinga ukusebenzisa izingubo ezivikelayo nendlela yokuzisebenzisa, ukuhlinzekela ngezinsizi nendawo yokusebenza ekhuthaza inhlanzeko yomuntu siqu, efuna ukuhlanzwa kwezandla njalo, ukubeka umkhawulo wamakhasimende nomphakathi wokufinyelela indawo yomsebenzi, nokuposa izimpawu mayelana nokuhlanza izandla izinyathelo zokuvikela i-COVID-19. Kuye ngokuncika emsebenzini, abasebenzi abachayeka ngezinga eliphakathi bangase badinge ukugqoka izinto zokuzivikela ezihlanganisa inhlanganisela yamagilavu, ingubo, isembozo sobuso noma imaski yobuso, noma izibuko.
en-mt: These include workers who come into contact with the general public such as schools, high-traffic workplaces, and high-profile retail environments. Building controls for these high-risk groups includes installing high-performance air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing barriers such as plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service. Management controls for this high-exposure job group include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, implementing virtual communication to replace face-to-face meetings, implementing staggered shifts, stopping non-essential travel to areas with outbreaks of COVID-19, creating situational communication plans which includes a forum for responding to employee concerns, providing employees with the latest education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective practices, training employees who need to use protective clothing and how to use it, providing facilities and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring frequent hand washing, limiting for customers and the public to access the workplace, and posting signs about hand washing measures to prevent COVID-19. Depending on the occupation, workers with moderate exposure may need to wear protective equipment including a combination of gloves, gown, face covering or face mask, or goggles.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: Izisebenzi ezikuleli qembu lokuchayeka azivamile ukudinga ukusebenzisa amarespiretha.
en-mt: Workers in this exposure group rarely need to use respirators.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Uma umuntu eqala ukugula ebhanoyini, izinhlelo ezifanele zokulawula zokuvukela abasebenzi nabanye abagibeli zihlanganisa ukuhlukanisa umuntu ogulayo nabanye ngebanga lamagxathi angu-6, ukubeka ilungu elilodwa le-crew ukuthi linakekele umuntu ogulayo, nokunikeza imaski yobuso kumuntu ogulayo noma ukubuza umuntu ogulayo ukuthi amboze umlomo wakhe nekhala ngamathishu lapho ekhwehlela noma ethimula.
en-mt: If a person becomes ill on an airplane, appropriate control measures for staff and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by 6 feet, assigning one crew member to care for the sick person, and giving the sick person a face mask or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when he coughs or sneezes.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: Ikhru yekhebhini kumele igqoke amagilavu lapho inakekela umgibeli ogulayo noma ithinta ukutshezi lomzimba noma izindawo okungenzeka zingcolile, futhi kungenzeka ukuthi izinto ezengeziwe zokuzivikela uma ogulayo enokushisa, ukukhwehlela okungaphezi, nalapho kunzima ukuphefumula.
en-mt: The cabin crew must wear gloves when caring for a sick passenger or touching body parts or areas that may be contaminated, and additional protective equipment may be needed if the patient has a fever, persistent cough, and difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: Amagilavu nezinye izinto ezilahlekayo kufanele zilahlwe ngesikhwama se-biohazard, futhi izindawo ezithole ukungcola kufanele zihlanzwe futhi zifakwe isibulala magciwane kamuva. Ngokuphathelene nemikhumbi yezimakethe, kuhlanganisa imikhumbi yokuvakasha neminye yokuthutha abagibeli, ukulawula ingoza kuhlanganisa ukuhlehlisa uhambo lapho ugula, nokuzihlukanisa futhi wazise isikhungo sokwelapha ngaphakathi ngokushesha uma othile eqala ukushisa noma ezinye izimpawu lapho esagibele.
en-mt: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated areas should be cleaned and disinfected afterward. In relation to commercial ships, including cruise ships and other passenger transport ships, risk management includes postponing travel when you are sick, and isolating yourself and notifying the medical center immediately if someone develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Uma kungenzeka, ukulandelela kwezokulapha kumele kwenzakale kukhebhin yomuntu ozihlukanisile. Ezindaweni zezikole nenkulisa, i-CDC ikhuthaza ukuvala isikhashana ngenjongo yokuhlanza nokubulala amagciwane uma umuntu onegciwane eke waba ngaphakathi kwesakhiwo sesikole kungakhathaliseki ukusabalala.
en-mt: If possible, medical follow-up should take place in the cabin of the isolated person. For school and daycare facilities, the CDC recommends temporary closures for cleaning and disinfection purposes if an infected person has been inside the school building regardless of the spread.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: Uma kunokutheleleka okuncane kuya kokuphakathi emphakathi, amasu okuhlukanisa ngokuhlala kungenzeka aqaliswe njengokukhansela ama-field trip, imihlangano, neminye imibuthano emikhulu njengemfundo yezemvelo, amaklasi ekwaya noma ukudla emakhafethira, ukwandisa isikhala phakathi kwamadeski, ukufika ngezigamu nezikhathi zokugoduka, ukukhawula izivakashi ezingabalulekile, nokusebenzisa indawo yehhovisi lempilo elihlukile lezingane ezinezimpawu ezifana nomkhuhlane.
en-mt: If there is mild to moderate infection in the community, social distancing strategies may be implemented such as canceling field trips, meetings, and other large gatherings such as environmental education, choir classes or eating in cafeterias, increasing the space between desks, arriving at half-times and going home times, limiting non-essential visitors, and using healthy office space. different for children with flu-like symptoms.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: Lapho igciwane lisakazeka ngendlela ephawulekayo emphakathini, naphezu kwemizamo yokuqhelelana kwabantu, kungase kucatshangelwe ukuvalwa kwezikole okweluliwe. Ezisebenzini zezomthetho ezenza imisebenzi yansuku zonke, ingozi yempilo ngaleso sikhathi ibhekwa njengephansi yi-CDC.
en-mt: When the virus spreads significantly in a community, despite social distancing efforts, extended school closures may be considered. For law enforcement officers performing daily duties, the health risk at that time is considered low by the CDC.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: Izisebenzi zezomthetho okumelwe zithintane nabantu abaqinisekisiwe noma okusolwa ukuthi bane-COVID-19 kukhuthazwa ukuba zilandele iziqondiso ezifanayo nezezisebenzi zezimo eziphuthumayo zezempilo, kuhlanganise nezinto ezifanele zomuntu zokuzivikela.
en-mt: Law enforcement personnel who must come into contact with people with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 are encouraged to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical personnel, including appropriate personal protective equipment.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
