en-mt: The Privacy Group at the MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for implementing privacy protection strategies when collecting and using location or cross-path data to track the spread of COVID-19.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: Kusekelwe ocwaningweni oluvela ephepheni elimhlophe i-"Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" elakhishwa ngoMarch 2020. Omunye umzamo ofanayo yipulatifomu ye-SafeTrace ye-Enigma MPC, inkampane esungula ubuchwepheshe bobumfihlo eyasungulwa okokuqala e-MIT Media Lab.
en-mt: It is based on research from the white paper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020. Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform of Enigma MPC, a privacy technology startup founded at the MIT Media Lab.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: I-SafeTrace isebenzisa ubuchwepheshe behadiwe obuvikelekile ukuze ivumele abasebenzisi ukuba babelane ngedatha ebucayi yendawo nempilo nabanye abasebenzisi nabezomthetho, ngaphandle kokubeka ubumfihlo baleyo datha engozini.
en-mt: SafeTrace uses secure hardware technology to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and law enforcement, without compromising the privacy of that data.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-5 April 2020, i-TCN Coalition yomhlaba wonke yasungulwa amaqembu abehlanganiswe yilokho obekuyindlela efanayo namaphrothokholi ashiyana kakhulu, ngomgomo wokunciphisa ukuhlukana, futhi kuvunyelwe ukusebenziseka emhlabeni wonke kwama-app okuthungatha nokuxwayisa, isici esibalulekile ekwamukelweni kabanzi.
en-mt: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was established by groups that were united by what were similar approaches and widely divergent protocols, with the goal of reducing fragmentation, and allowing the universal use of tracking and warning apps, an important factor for widespread adoption.

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-9 April 2020, uhulumeni waseSingapore wamemezela ukuthi wenza isimemo sephrothokholi ye-BlueTrace esetshenziswa yi-app wayo kahulumeni esemthethweni.
en-mt: On 9 April 2020, the government of Singapore announced that it is decommissioning the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-10 April 2020, i-Google ne-Apple, izinkampane ezilawula amapulatifomu eselula ye-Android ne-iOS, zamemezela indlela yokuthungatha abantu, futhi zagomela ngokuthi izobuvikela ubumfihlo, ngokusekelwe enhlanganiseleni yobuchwepheshe be-Bluetooth Low Energy ne-cryptography evikela ubumfihlo.
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced a tracking method, and asserted that it will protect privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and cryptography that protects privacy.

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: Ziphinde zashicilela izici zobuchwepheshe obusetshenziswe kusistimu.
en-mt: They also published the characteristics of the technology used in the system.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: Ngokuvumelana ne-Apple ne-Google, isistimu kuhloswe ukuba ikhishwe ngezigaba ezintathu:
en-mt: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be released in three stages:

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: ukukhishwa kwamathuluzi ukuze kuvunyelwe ohulumeni ukuba bakhe ama-app asemthethweni athungatha i-coronavirus avikela ubumfihlo
en-mt: the release of tools to allow governments to create legitimate apps that detect the coronavirus and protect privacy

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: ukufakwa kwalesi sici ngokuqondile ohlelweni lwe-iOS ne-AndroidGoogle ne-Apple ukuze kulungiswe izinkinga zokuqalisa nokuqapha okuqhubekayo ngokuthumela kuqala isistimu ngezibuyekezo ze-OS, futhi kamuva ukusikhipha ngendlela efanayo lapho usongo seludlulile.
en-mt: the inclusion of this feature directly in the system of iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple to fix the problems of launch and continuous monitoring by first sending the system with OS updates, and later removing it in the same way when the threat has passed.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: I-b'Drug repositioning (ephinde yaziwe ngokuthi ukusetshenziswa kabusha komuthi, i-re-profiling, i-re-tasking noma i-therapeutic switching) iwukusebenzisa kabusha umuthi ogunyaziwe ukuze kwelashwe esinye isifo noma isimo sezempilo esihlukile kuleso eyayakhelwe sona.
en-mt: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug to treat a different disease or medical condition than the one it was designed for.

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: Lolu uhlobo locwaningo lwezesayensi olwenziwayo njengamanje ukuze kusungulwe izindlela zokwelapha i-COVID-19 eziphephile neziphumelelayo.
en-mt: This is the type of scientific research that is currently being done to develop safe and effective treatments for COVID-19.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: Ezinye iziqondiso zocwaningo zibandakanya ukusungulwa komgomo we-COVID-19 nokumpontshelwa i-convalescent plasma. I-SARS-CoV-2 inamaphrotheni angaba ngu-66 akwazi ukusebenzisa umuthi, ngayinye inamasayithi amaningi okuhlangana kuwo amamolekhuli.
en-mt: Other research directions include the development of a vaccine for COVID-19 and convalescent plasma transfusions. SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 drug-capable proteins, each with multiple molecular binding sites.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: Ukuhlaziya lawo masayithi okuhlanganwa kuwo kwakha iphrojekthi enengqondo yokusungula umuthi olwa negciwane ngokumelene namaphrotheni e-COVID-19.
en-mt: Analyzing those binding sites forms a logical project to develop an antiviral drug against the proteins of COVID-19.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: Kumaphrotheni abhekiwe abaluleke kakhulu e-SARS-CoV-2 yi-protease enjenge-papain, i-RNA polymerase esekelwe ku-RNA, i-helicase, i-S protein, ne-ADP ribophosphatase.
en-mt: Among the most important observed proteins of SARS-CoV-2 are papain-like protease, RNA-based RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: U-Hussein A A, nabanye bacwaninga imithi eminingana engasetshenziswa kwabe sekuthuthukiswa futhi kuhlaziywa ukufana kwesakhiwo sayo ngemithi egunyaziwe efanayo ephakeme ukuze kusheshiswe ukusungulwa komuthi onamandla wokwelapha i-SARS-CoV-2 kulolu cwaningo lwangaphambi kokwelapha ongase usetshenziswe njengomuthi wocwaningo.
en-mt: Hussein AA, and others researched several drugs that could be used and then developed and analyzed their structural similarity with similar approved drugs to accelerate the development of a powerful drug to treat SARS-CoV-2 in this pre-treatment study that could be used as a research drug.

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: I-chloroquine ingumuthi wokwelapha umalaleveva ophinde usetshenziselwe izifo ezithile zamasosha omzimba.
en-mt: Chloroquine is an antimalarial drug that is also used for certain immune system disorders.

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-18 March, i-WHO yamemezela ukuthi i-chloroquine ne-hydroxychloroquine ehlobene nayo zizoba phakathi kwemithi emine ecwaningwa njengengxenye yocwaningo lwezokwelapha Oluhlanganisiwe.
en-mt: On March 18, the WHO announced that chloroquine and its related hydroxychloroquine will be among the four drugs being studied as part of the Integrated Medicine study.

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: Umphathi-sifundazwe waseNew York u-Andrew Cuomo wamemezela ukuthi ucwaningo lweSifunda saseNew York lwe-chloroquine ne-hydroxychloroquine luzoqala ngomhla ka-24 March. Ngomhla ka-28 March, i-FDA yagunyaza ukusetshenziswa kwe-hydroxychloroquine sulfate ne-chloroquine phosphate ngaphansi kwe-Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
en-mt: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that the New York State trial of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine will begin on March 24. On March 28, the FDA approved the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: Lokhu kwelashwa akukagunyazwa yinqubo yocwaningo yezokwelapha ye-FDA futhi igunyazwa ngaphansi kwe-EUA kuphela njengendlela yokwelapha ecwaningwayo ezosetshenziselwa izimo eziphuthumayo ezigulini ezilaliswa esibhedlela kodwa ezingakwazi ukwamukela ukwelashwa ocwaningweni lwezokwelapha.
en-mt: This treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical research process and is approved under the EUA only as an investigational treatment for emergency use in hospitalized patients who cannot accept treatment in a clinical trial.

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: I-CDC ithe "ukusetshenziswa, umthamo, noma inkathi ye-hydroxychloroquine ku-prophylaxis noma ukwelashwa kwegciwane le-SARS-CoV-2" akukalungi.
en-mt: The CDC said that "the use, dose, or duration of hydroxychloroquine in the prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 virus" is not yet approved.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: Odokotela bathe basebenzisa umuthi lapho "ingekho enye indlela".
en-mt: Doctors said they use the drug when "there is no other option".

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: Ithimba locwaningo laseTurkey e-Istanbul liqhuba ucwaningo oluncane ekusebenziseni i-chloroquine ihlanganiswe ne-zinc, i-vitamin A, i-vitamin C ne-vitamin D.
en-mt: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: Ucwaningo olukhulu luyaqhubeka eDuke University nase-University of Oxford.
en-mt: Major research is underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: I-NYU Langone Medical School iqhuba ucwaningo lokuphepha nokusebenza kwe-hydroxychloroquine ukuze kuvinjelwe isifo.
en-mt: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting research on the safety and efficacy of hydroxychloroquine for disease prevention.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Ucwaningo lwezokwelapha lwaseChina eWuhan naseShenzhen luthi kubonakala i-favipiravir "isebenza ngempela".
en-mt: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen say favipiravir appears to "really work".

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Iziguli ezingu-35 eShenzhen zitholwe zinegathivu ekuhlolweni phakathi nezinsuku ezingu-4, kuyilapho ubude bokugula babuyizinsuku ezingu-11 ezigulini ezingu-45 ezingazange ziyithole.
en-mt: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative within 4 days, while the duration of illness was 11 days for 45 patients who did not.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Ocwaningweni oluqhutshwa eWuhan ezigulini ezingu-240 ezinenyumoniya, uhhafu wanikezwa i-favipiravir omunye uhhafu wanikwa i-umifenovir.
en-mt: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and the other half were given umifenovir.

sourceString: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
targetString: I-Italian Pharmaceutical Agency yakhumbuza umphakathi ukuthi ubufakazi obukhona ekusekeleni umuthi bumbalwa futhi obangaphambi kokuba usebenze.
en-mt: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the evidence supporting the drug is limited and preliminary.

sourceString: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-2 April, i-Germany yamemezela ukuthi izowuthenga umuthi eJapan iwubeke esitokweni, bese isebenzisa amasosha ukuze athumele umuthi ezibhedlela zaseyunivesithi, lapho umuthi uzosetshenziswa khona ekwelapheni iziguli ezine-COVID-19.
en-mt: On April 2, Germany announced that it would buy the drug from Japan and put it in stock, then use the military to send the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
targetString: Ngokuvumelana ne-South China Morning Post, uShinzo Abe uye wazethula emkhandlwini ka-Trump mayelana nokuthenga umuthi. Umuthi ungase ungasebenzi ngokuphelele ezimweni ezimbi kakhulu zokugula lapho igciwane seliye laphindaphindeka khona.
en-mt: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has introduced himself to Trump's council about buying the drug. The drug may not be completely effective in severe cases of the disease where the virus has multiplied.

sourceString: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
targetString: Kungaba okungaphephile ukuwusebenzisa kwabesifazane abakhulelwe noma lapho abazama ukukhulelwa.
en-mt: It may be unsafe to use in women who are pregnant or trying to conceive.

sourceString: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
targetString: Olunye ucwaningo lwe-lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), inhlanganisela yemithi elwa negciwane i-lopinavir ne-ritonavir, lwaphetha ngokuthi "ayikho inzuzo etholakele".
en-mt: Another study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antiviral drugs lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was found".

sourceString: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
targetString: Le mithi yayiklanyelwe ukuvimbela i-HIV ekuphindaphindekeni ngokuhlangana ne-protease.
en-mt: These drugs were designed to prevent HIV from replicating by binding to a protease.

sourceString: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
targetString: Ithimba labacwaningi e-University of Colorado lizama ukushintsha imithi ukuze lithole uketshezi oluzohlangana ne-protease ye-SARS-CoV-2. Kunabagxeki emphakathini wososayensi ngokuqondisa imizamo ekusebenziseni kabusha imithi eklanyelwe ngokukhethekile i-HIV/AIDS.
en-mt: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado is trying to change medicine to find a liquid that will interact with the protease of SARS-CoV-2. There are critics in the scientific community for directing efforts to reuse drugs designed specifically for HIV/AIDS.

sourceString: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
targetString: I-WHO ibandakanye i-lopinavir/ritonavir ocwaningweni Oluhlanganisiwe lomhlaba jikelele.
en-mt: WHO has included lopinavir/ritonavir in a global Integrated study.

sourceString: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
targetString: I-Remdesivir yakhiwa futhi yasungulwa yi-Gilead Sciences njengomuthi wokwelapha igciwane le-Ebola nezifo ze-Marburg. I-Gilead Sciences yathola ukuthi i-Remdesivir ibinomsebenzi wokulwa negciwane ku-vitro ngokumelene namagciwane e-filo-, e-pneumo-, e-paramyxo-, ne-corona- .
en-mt: Remdesivir was developed and developed by Gilead Sciences as a drug to treat the Ebola virus and Marburg disease. Gilead Sciences found that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses.

sourceString: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
targetString: Inkinga eyodwa ngokwelashwa okulwa negciwane ukusungula indlela yokwelapha ngama-mutation angaholela esifweni esibi kakhulu nesithelelanayo.
en-mt: One problem with anti-viral therapy is developing a cure for mutations that can lead to more severe and contagious disease.

sourceString: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
targetString: Ucwaningo lokuqala lwangaphambi lusikisela ukuthi i-remdesivir kungenzeka lunesivimbeli esiphezulu sezakhi zofuzo ekungasebenzini komuthi. Kunocwaningo oluningana lwezokwelapha oluqhubekayo, okubandakanya olumbili oluqhutshwa eZibhedlela zaseCleveland University; olulodwa ngolwabantu abanokugula okusesilinganisweni kanti olunye olwabantu abagula kabi kakhulu.
en-mt: Early research suggests that remdesivir may have a higher genetic resistance to the drug's ineffectiveness. There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted at Cleveland University Hospitals; one is for people with moderate illness and the other is for people with severe illness.

sourceString: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
targetString: Kunocwaningo lwezokwelapha oluthathu oluqhubekayo lomjovo we-vitamin C wabantu abalaliswa esibhedlela nabagula kakhulu abane-COVID-19; imithi-mbumbulu emibili (eChina, eCanada) nolulodwa olungalawuliwe (e-Italy).
en-mt: There are three ongoing clinical trials of vitamin C injections for hospitalized and critically ill people with COVID-19; two fake medicines (China, Canada) and one unregulated (Italy).

sourceString: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
targetString: ISifunda saseNew York saqala ucwaningo lwesibulali-magciwane esiyi-azithromycin ngomhla ka-24 March 2020.
en-mt: New York State began testing the antibiotic azithromycin on March 24, 2020.

sourceString: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
targetString: I-National Center yaseJapan ye-Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) ihlela ucwaningo lwezokwelapha lwe-Teijin's Alvesco (i-ciclesonide), i-corticosteroid ehogelwayo ye-asthma, ekwelapheni iziguli ezingenazimpawu zesifo ezinegciwane elisha le-coronavirus.
en-mt: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial of Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, in the treatment of asymptomatic patients with the new coronavirus.

sourceString: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
targetString: Ucwaningo lohlobo lwe-angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, Isigaba II luyaqhubeka neziguli ezingu-200 ezizofakwa ezisukela ezimweni ezimbi kakhulu, zabalaliswa esibhedlela eDenmark, eGermany, nase-Austria ukuze kubonakale ukusebenza kwalokhu kwelashwa.
en-mt: Angiotensin-converting enzyme type 2, Phase II studies are underway with 200 patients to be included from acute, hospitalized in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to see the effectiveness of this treatment.

sourceString: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
targetString: Abacwaningi base-Montreal Heart Institute eCanada njengamanje bacwaninga indima ye-colchicine ekunciphiseni ukuvuvukala nezinkinga zamaphaphu ezigulini eziguliswa izimpawu zesifo ezingatheni ze-COVID-19.
en-mt: Researchers at the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and lung problems in patients with mild symptoms of COVID-19.

sourceString: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
targetString: Ucwaningo, olubizwa ngokuthi yi-COLCORONA, luhlanganisa abantu abadala abangu-6000 abaneminyaka engu-40 nangaphezulu abatholwe benesifo se-COVID-19 futhi abanezimpawu zesifo ezingatheni ezingadingi ukulaliswa esibhedlela.
en-mt: The study, called COLCORONA, includes 6,000 adults aged 40 and over who have been diagnosed with COVID-19 and have mild symptoms that do not require hospitalization.

sourceString: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
targetString: Abesifazane abakhulelwe noma abancelisayo noma abangenayo indlela esebenzayo yokuvimbela ukukhulelwa abafaneleki.
en-mt: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or do not have an effective method of contraception are not eligible.

sourceString: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
targetString: Kuhlolwa ama-anticoagulants amaningana e-Italy.
en-mt: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.

sourceString: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
targetString: I-heparin enesisindo esiphansi samamolekhuli isetshenziswa kabanzi ekwelapheni iziguli, yaholela ne-Italian Medicines Agency ukuba ishicilele iziqondiso zokusetshenziswa kwayo.
en-mt: Low molecular weight heparin is widely used in the treatment of patients, leading the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines for its use.

sourceString: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwezikhungo eziningi lweziguli ezingu-300 olucwaninga ukusetshenziswa kwe-enoxaparin sodium emithamweni yokuvimbela nokwelapha isifo yamenyezelwa e-Italy ngo-April 14.
en-mt: A multicenter study of 300 patients investigating the use of enoxaparin sodium in preventive and therapeutic doses was announced in Italy on April 14.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: Njengoba i-SARS-CoV-2 iyigciwane, ezesayensi ziye zagxila kakhulu ekusebenziseni kabusha imithi elwa negciwane eyayisungulelwe imiqedazwe yangaphambilini enjengegciwane le-MERS, i-SARS, ne-West Nile.
en-mt: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, science has focused on repurposing antiviral drugs that were developed for previous epidemics such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: I-Ribavirin: i-ribavirin yasikiselwa ekwelapheni i-COVID-19 ngokuvumelana nohlelo 7 lweziqondiso zaseChina
en-mt: Ribavirin: ribavirin was suggested for the treatment of COVID-19 according to the 7th edition of the Chinese guidelines

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: I-Umifenovir: i-umifenovir yasikiselwa ekwelapheni i-COVID-19 ngokuvumelana nohlelo 7 lweziqondiso zaseChina
en-mt: Umifenovir: umifenovir was suggested for the treatment of COVID-19 according to plan 7 of the Chinese guidelines

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Ezinye izibulali-magciwane eziye zatholwa njengezingasetshenziswa kabusha ekwelapheni i-COVID-19:
en-mt: Other disinfectants that have been found to be reusable in the treatment of COVID-19:

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: I-Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Igunyazwe eChina.
en-mt: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved in China.

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: Ocwaningweni futhi lwase-Italy naseChina. futhi ubheke i-Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
en-mt: In the study also of Italy and China. and look for Tocilizumab #COVID-19.

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Umgomo we-b'A COVID-19 ungumgomo ocatshangwayo ngokumelene nesifo se-coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: The b'A COVID-19 vaccine is an anti-coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccine.

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: Nakuba ungekho umgomo osuqedile ucwaningo lwezokwelapha, kunemizamo eminingi eqhubekayo yokwakha umgomo onjalo.
en-mt: Although no vaccine has completed clinical research, there are many ongoing efforts to develop such a vaccine.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: Ngasekupheleni kuka-February 2020, i-World Health Organization (WHO) yathi ibingalindele ukuthi umgomo we-SARS-CoV-2, igciwane eliyimbangela, ukuba litholakale ngaphansi kwezinyanga ezingu-18.
en-mt: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine for SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes it, to be available in less than 18 months.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: Amakhendidethi okugoma amahlanu abeseSigabeni I socwaningo lokuphepha ngo-April.
en-mt: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: I-COVID-19 yatholwa ngo-December 2019.
en-mt: COVID-19 was diagnosed in December 2019.

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Ukuqubuka okukhulu kwabhebhetheka emhlabeni wonke ngo-2020, kwaholela emsebenzini omkhulu wokutholwa kwezimali nocwaningo ukuze kusungulwe umgomo.
en-mt: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, prompting a massive fundraising and research effort to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Izinhlangano eziningi zisebenzisa izakhi zofuzo ukuze zisungule imigomo engenziwa ye-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Many organizations are using genetics to develop potential vaccines for SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-April, izinto ezisemqoka zomsebenzi we-CEPI wokusungula umgomo ziyashesha, ziyagungulwa, ziyakhiqizwa, futhi ziyafinyeleleka emhlabeni.
en-mt: As of April, the core elements of CEPI's goal-setting work are fast-tracked, rolled out, produced, and accessible to the world.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Ngo-April, ososayensi be-CEPI babike ukuthi amapulatifomu obuchwepheshe ahlukahlukene angu-10 aye acwaningwa futhi asungulwa ngasekuqaleni kuka-2020 ukuze kwakhiwe umgomo osebenzayo ngokumelene ne-COVID-19.
en-mt: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms have been researched and developed by early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: Imisebenzi yepulatifomu emikhulu eyathuthukela ocwaningweni lokuphepha lweSigaba I ihlanganisa:
en-mt: Major platform functions that advanced to Phase I safety studies include:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: i-nucleic acid (i-DNA ne-RNA) (umsunguli weSigaba I nekhendidethi yomgomo: i-Moderna, i-mRNA-1273)
en-mt: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I originator and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: i-viral vector (umsunguli weSigaba I nekhendidethi lomgomo: i-CanSino Biologics, i-adenovirus type 5 vector)
en-mt: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: Njengoba kwabikwa ososayensi be-CEPI ngo-April, amakhendidethi angu-115 asezigabeni zokuqala zokusungulwa komgomo, kanti abangu-78 aqinisekisiwe njengamaphrojekthi anegciwane (abangu-79, ngokwe-Milken Institute), kanti abangu-37 bamenyezelwe, kodwa luncane kakhulu ulwazi lomphakathi olutholakalayo (okungenzeka luyahlelwa noma luyasungulwa).
en-mt: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 candidates are in the early stages of vaccine development, and 78 have been confirmed as viral projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 have been announced, but very little public information is available ( which may be planned or established).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: Ucwaningo lweSigaba I-II luhlola ukuphepha kwangaphambi kokusetshenziswa nokulwa negciwane, ngokuvamile aluhleliwe, lulawulwa ngomuthi-mbumbulu, futhi lusezikhungweni eziningi, kuyilapho kubhekwa imithamo enembe kakhudlwana, esebenzayo.
en-mt: Phase I-II studies evaluate the safety and efficacy of preclinical, mostly randomized, placebo-controlled, and multicenter studies, while looking for more precise, effective doses.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: Ucwaningo lweSigaba III ngokuvamile luhilela ababambiqhaza abengeziwe, okubandakanya iqembu lokulawula, nokusebenza kokuhlolwa komgomo ukuze kuvinjelwe isifo, kuyilapho kuqashwa imiphumela ebucayi ngomthamo ofanele.
en-mt: Phase III studies usually involve additional participants, including a control group, and test the efficacy of the vaccine to prevent disease, while monitoring adverse effects at the appropriate dose.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: Kumakhandidethi omgomo angu-79 asungulwayo (aqinisekiswe ngasekuqaleni kuka-April 2020), angu-74 abengakahlolwa kubantu (abesekucwaningo "lwangaphambi kokwelapha").
en-mt: Of the 79 vaccine candidates being developed (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 have not yet been tested in humans (they were in "pre-clinical" research).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: Ngawomhla ka-24 January 2020 e-Australia, i-University of Queensland yamemezela ukuthi icwaninga ukuthi kungasetshenziswa yini umgomo we-molecular clamp ozoguqula ezakhini zofuzo amaphrotheni anegciwane ukuze kwelashwe.
en-mt: On January 24, 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is researching whether a molecular clamp vaccine can be used to genetically modify viral proteins for treatment.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Ngawomhla ka-24 January 2020 eCanada, i-International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) e-University of Saskatchewan yamemezela ukuqala komsebenzi wokusungula umgomo, ngenhloso yokuba kuqalwe ukuhlolwa abantu ngo-2021.
en-mt: On January 24, 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Center (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the start of work to develop a vaccine, with the aim of starting human testing in 2021.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Amaphrojekthi okwakha umgomo amenyezelwa e-Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention ngomhla ka-26 January 2020, e-University of Hong Kong ngomhla ka-28 January.
en-mt: The vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, at the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Ngawomhla ka-29 January 2020, i-Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, iholwa ngu-Hanneke Schuitemaker, yamemezela ukuthi isiqalile umsebenzi wokusungula umgomo.
en-mt: On January 29, 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it has begun work on developing a vaccine.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: I-Janssen nayo isungula umgomo ophuzwayo nomlingane wayo, i-Vaxart.
en-mt: Janssen is also developing an oral vaccine with its partner, Vaxart.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-18 March 2020, i-Emergent BioSolutions yamemezela ukusungulwa ngokubambisana ne-Vaxart ukuze kusungulwe umgomo.
en-mt: On March 18, 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: Ngo-8 February 2020, ilabhorethri yakwa-OncoGen e-Romania yashicilela iphepha eliphathelene nomklamo womuthi wokugoma onobuchwepheshe obufanayo nalobo obusetshenziswe ekwelashweni komdlavuza kusetshenziswa ukugonywa ngezikhuthazi ezintsha zamasosha omzimba.
en-mt: On 8 February 2020, the OncoGen laboratory in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with the same technology as that used in the treatment of cancer using vaccination with new immune stimulators.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-25 March umphathi wesikhungo socwaningo wamemezela ukuthi usufinyelele iziphetho ngengxube yomgomo futhi ukuhlola sekuyaqala.
en-mt: On March 25, the head of the research center announced that it had reached conclusions on the vaccine mixture and testing was about to begin.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-27 February 2020, inkampane esizayo ye-Generex, i-NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, imemezele ukuthi isiqala iphrojekthi yokugoma ukuze kwakhiwe umgomo we-peptide ye-Ii-Key ngokumelene ne-COVID-19.
en-mt: On February 27, 2020, Generex's future subsidiary, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced that it is starting a vaccine project to develop an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Bebefuna ukukhiqiza umgomo obungahlolwa kubantu "phakathi nezinsuku ezingu-90."
en-mt: They wanted to produce a vaccine that could be tested on humans "within 90 days."

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-5 March 2020, iWashington University eSt. Louis yamemezela amaphrojekthi ayo okusungula umgomo.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its goal-setting projects.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-5 March 2020, i-United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command eFort Detrick neWalter Reed Army Institute of Research eSilver Spring, zombili ezisentshonalanga yeMaryland, zamemezela ukuthi zisungula umgomo.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced that they were establishing the vaccine.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Ngawomhla ka-10 March 2020, i-Emergent Biosolutions yamemezela ukuthi isibambisene ne-Novavax Inc.
en-mt: On March 10, 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it has partnered with Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: ekusunguleni nasekwakheni umgomo.
en-mt: in establishing and building a goal.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: Abalingane baphinde bamemezela izinhlelo zokuhlolwa kwangaphambi kokwelashwa kanye nocwaningo lokwelashwa lweSigaba I ngo-July 2020.
en-mt: The partners also announced plans for a pre-clinical trial and a Phase I clinical trial in July 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-12 March 2020, i-Health Ministry yase-India yamemezela ukuthi isebenza ngabantu abahlukaniswe nomphakathi abangu-11, nokuthi ngisho ingashesha kanjani kungathatha okungenani unyaka nohhafu kuya eminyakeni emibili ekusunguleni umgomo.
en-mt: On 12 March 2020, the Health Ministry of India announced that it is working on 11 people isolated from the community, and that even if it is fast it will take at least a year and a half to two years to establish a vaccine.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: Ngo-12 March 2020, i-Medicago, okuyinkampani ye-biotechnology yase-Quebec City, e-Quebec, yabika ukuthi kwakwakhiwe izinhlayiya ezifana ne-coronavirus ngaphansi koxhaso oluncane oluvela ku-Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
en-mt: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company from Quebec City, Quebec, reported that particles similar to the coronavirus had been developed under a small grant from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: Ikhendidethi yomgomo icwaningwa yilabhorethri, futhi ukuhlolwa kwabantu kuhlelelwe u-July noma u-August 2020.
en-mt: The vaccine candidate is being studied by the laboratory, and human trials are planned for July or August 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: Ngasekuqaleni kwalelo viki, i-Guardian yabika ukuthi uMongameli wase-US uDonald Trump unikeze i-CureVac "'izizumbulu zezimali' ukuze ithole umgomo we-Covid-19", kanti uhulumeni waseJalimane wamelana nalokho.
en-mt: Earlier that week, the Guardian reported that US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'huge sums of money' to find a Covid-19 vaccine", while the German government opposed it.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-17 March 2020, inkampane yemithi yaseMelika i-Pfizer yamemezela ukusebenzelana nenkampane yaseJalimane i-BioNTech ukuze zakhe ndawonye umgomo we-mRNA.
en-mt: On 17 March 2020, the American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a collaboration with the German company BioNTech to jointly develop an mRNA vaccine.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: Umgomo we-mRNA i-BNT162, njengamanje ohlolelwa ukusetshenziswa ngaphambi kokwelapha futhi ucwaningo lwezokwelapha lulindeleke ukuba luqale ngo-April 2020.
en-mt: The mRNA vaccine BNT162, is currently being evaluated for pre-treatment use and clinical trials are expected to begin in April 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: E-Italy ngomhla ka-17 March 2020, iTakis Biotech, inkampane yezobuchwepheshe obubandakanya izinto eziphilayo yamemezela ukuthi izothola imiphumela yokuhlola kwangaphambi kokwelapha ngo-April 2020 futhi umgomo wayo wokugcina ungaqala ukuhlolwa kubantu ekwindla.
en-mt: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, a biotechnology company announced that it will receive the results of pre-treatment tests in April 2020 and its final goal can start testing in humans in the fall.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: E-France ngomhlaka-19 March 2020, i-Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) yamemezela ukutshala imali eyizigidi ezingu-US$4.9 kucwaningo oluyinhlanganisela lokuthola ikhambi le-COVID-19 oluhlanganisa i-Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), Kanye ne-University of Pittsburgh, okubeka ingqikithi yokutshala imali kwe-CEPI ekwakheni ikhambi le-COVID-19 ku-US$29 million.
en-mt: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced an investment of US$4.9 million in joint research to find a cure for COVID-19 involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), And the University of Pittsburgh, which puts CEPI's total investment in developing a cure for COVID-19 at US$29 million.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: Abanye abalingane abangabatshali-zimali be-CEPI ekusunguleni umgomo we-COVID-19 yiModerna, i-Curevac, i-Inovio, i-Novavax, i-University of Hong Kong, i-University of Oxford, ne-University of Queensland.
en-mt: CEPI's other investment partners in developing a vaccine for COVID-19 are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-20 March 2020, izikhulu zezempilo zaseRussia zamemezela ukuthi ososayensi sebeqalile ukuhlola izilwane ngemigomo eyisithupha ehlukahlukene.
en-mt: On March 20, 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists had begun testing animals for six different vaccines.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: Abacwaningi be-Imperial College London bamemezela ngomhla ka-20 March 2020 ukuthi basungula umgomo we-RNA wokuzixilonga wena we-COVID-19.
en-mt: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they have developed an RNA vaccine for self-diagnosis of COVID-19.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: Lo mgomo wasungulwa phakathi nezinsuku ezingu-14 kutholakale umgomo eChina.
en-mt: This vaccine was developed within 14 days of the vaccine being found in China.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: Ngasekupheleni kuka-March, uhulumeni waseCanada wamemezela imali eyizigidi ezingu-C$275 yokuxhasa amaphrojekthi ocwaningo angu-96 ezindleleni zokwelapha i-COVID-19, okubandakanya imigomo eminingana ezinkampanini nasemayunivesithi ase-Canada, njengemisebenzi eyenziwa eMedicago nase-University of Saskatchewan.
en-mt: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on ways to treat COVID-19, including several goals in Canadian companies and universities, such as the work done at Medicago and the University of Saskatchewan.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Cishe ngesikhathi esifanayo, uhulumeni waseCanada wamemezela izigidi ezingu-C$192 ngokukhethekile ukuze kusungulwe umgomo we-COVID-19, ngezinhlelo zokusungula "ibhange lemigomo" likazwelonke lemigomo emisha eminingana elingasetshenziswa uma kuqubuka enye i-coronavirus.
en-mt: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for the development of a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used in the event of another coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: Ngomhla ka-2 April 2020, abacwaningi e-University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine babika ngokuhlola kwePittCoVacc, umgomo ongasetshenziswa we-COVID-19 emagundaneni, baveza nokuthi "imigomo ye-MNA ye-SARS-CoV-2 S1 ezimele ikhiphe imiphumela yezakhi zesifo enamandla yezakhi zesifo ezilwa namagciwane [emagundaneni] ebonakele emavikini angu-2 ngemva kokuthola umgomo."
en-mt: On April 2, 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a potential vaccine for COVID-19 in mice, and revealed that "MNA vaccines for SARS-CoV-2 S1 independently produced potent pathogenic effects of antibodies [in mice] seen 2 weeks after receiving the vaccine."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: ECanada ngomhla ka-16 April 2020, i-University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy yamemezela ukuklanywa komgomo osekelwe ku-DNA ongaba isifutho sasemakhaleni.
en-mt: In Canada on April 16, 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced the development of a DNA-based vaccine that could become a nasal spray.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Isebenzisa amagciwane asetshenziselwa ukwelapha, i-DNA izokwenziwa ukuba ikhiqize phakathi kwegciwane elikumuntu ukuze kukhiqizwe izinhlayiya ezingenangozi ezinjengegciwane, ezingase zikhuthaze amasosha omzimba ukuba akhiqize izakhi ezilwa ngokumelene negciwane le-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Using the viruses used for therapy, the DNA will be made to reproduce within the human virus to produce harmless virus-like particles, which can stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies that fight against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: Ngo-March 2020, uhulumeni, izimboni, namayunivesithi amathathu ase-US ahlanganisa izinto zokusebenza ukuze athole amakhompyutha amakhulu ase-IBM, ahlanganiswe nezinto zekhompyutha zefu ezivela kwa-Hewlett Packard Enterprise, ku-Amazon, ku-Microsoft, naku-Google.
en-mt: In March 2020, the government, industry, and three US universities pooled equipment to acquire IBM supercomputers, combined with cloud computing equipment from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: Eminye imigomo inemiphumela yezinye izinto eziphilayo, ebizwa nangokuthi imiphumela engacacile.
en-mt: Some vaccines have effects on other organisms, also called indirect effects.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: Lokho kusho ukuthi ingaba nemiphumela engale kwesifo abasivimbelayo.
en-mt: That means they can have effects beyond the disease they prevent.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: Olunye ucwaningo olungahleliwe e-Australia lufuna ukubhalisa izisebenzi zezempilo ezingu-4,170.
en-mt: Another randomized trial in Australia sought to enroll 4,170 health workers.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: Kungenzeka ukuthi imigomo esungulwayo ngeke iphephe noma isebenze.
en-mt: It is possible that the vaccines being developed will not be safe or effective.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: Ucwaningo lokuqala lokuhlola ukusebenza komgomo kusetshenziswa amamodeli ezilwane e-COVID-19, njengegundane eline-ACE2 efakelwe, ezinye izilwane zaselabhorethri, nezilwane ezifuze abantu, lubonisa isidingo semizamo yokuvikelwa egciwaneni engu-3 ekusingatheni amagciwane, nokusebenzelana namanye amazwe ukuze kuqinisekiswe izinqubo eziphephile ezisebenza yonke indawo.
en-mt: Initial studies evaluating vaccine efficacy using animal models of COVID-19, such as the ACE2-transfected mouse, other laboratory animals, and human models, demonstrate the need for 3-pronged antiviral efforts in handling the virus, and collaboration with other countries to ensure safe practices that work everywhere.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: Imigomo ye-SARS ne-MERS iye yahlolwa kumamodeli ayizilwane angebona abantu.
en-mt: SARS and MERS vaccines have been tested in non-human animal models.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-2020, alikho ikhambi noma umgomo oyisivikelo we-SARS oye wabonakala uphephile futhi usebenza kubantu.
en-mt: As of 2020, no SARS vaccine or vaccine has been shown to be safe and effective in humans.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: Ngokwamaphepha ocwaningo ashicilelwe ngo-2005 nango-2006, ukutholwa nokusungulwa kwemigomo nemithi emisha ekwelapheni i-SARS kwakuyinto esemqoka kohulumeni nama-ejensi ezempilo omphakathi emhlabeni wonke. Futhi awukho umgomo otholakele we-MERS.
en-mt: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the discovery and development of new vaccines and drugs to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world. And no vaccine has been found for MERS.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: Lapho i-MERS ibhebhetheka, kwaba nenkolelo yokuthi ucwaningo oselukhona lwe-SARS lunganikeza ithempulethi ewusizo ekusunguleni imigomo nezindlela zokwelapha igciwane le-MERS-CoV.
en-mt: When MERS spread, it was believed that existing research on SARS could provide a useful template for developing vaccines and treatments for the MERS-CoV virus.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: Kusukela ngo-March 2020, kube nomgomo owodwa (we-DNA) we-MERS owaphothula isigaba I socwaningo lwezokwelapha kubantu, futhi eminye emithathu isacwaningwa, futhi yonke iyimigomo yama-viral-vector, ama-adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac) amabili, ne-MVA-vector eyodwa (MVA-MERS-S).
en-mt: As of March 2020, there has been one MERS (DNA) vaccine that has completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three more are being studied, and all are viral-vector, adenoviral-vectored vaccines (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS- GamVac) two, and one MVA-vector (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: Amaphosti ezinkundla zokuxhumana akhuthaza umqondo wokuthi igciwane elibangela i-COVID-19 liyaziwa nokuthi umgomo usuyatholakala kakade.
en-mt: Social media posts promote the idea that the virus that causes COVID-19 is known and that a vaccine is already available.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: Amaphethenti acashunwe kumaphosti ezinkundla zokuxhumana ezihlukahlukene abhekisela kumaphethenti akhona kakade okulandelana kwezakhi zofuzo kanye nemigomo yezinye izihlobo ze-coronavirus ezifana ne-SARS coronavirus.
en-mt: The patents cited in various social media posts refer to existing patents for the genetic sequences and targets of other coronavirus relatives such as the SARS coronavirus.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Igciwane le-b'Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) yigciwane elithelelanayo elibangelwa yi-severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: b'Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious virus caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Izimpawu zesifo ezivamile zibandakanya imfiva, ukukhwehlela, nephika.
en-mt: Common symptoms of the disease include fever, cough, and malaise.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: Ezinye izimpawu zingase zibandakanye ukukhathala, ubuhlungu bezicubu, uhudo, umphimbo obuhlungu, ukungezwa amaphunga, nobuhlungu esiswini.
en-mt: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and stomach pain.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Isikhathi ukusuka ekuchayekeni ukuya ekuqaleni kwezimpawu zesifo ngokuvamile siyizinsuku ezinhlanu kodwa singasukela ezinsukwini ezimbili kuya kweziyishumi nane.
en-mt: The time from exposure to the onset of symptoms is usually five days but can range from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: Nakuba iningi lezigameko liphumela ezimpawini zesifo, ezinye ziphumela kunyumoniya ebhebhethekayo nokufa kwezitho eziningi.
en-mt: Although most cases result in symptomatic disease, some result in progressive pneumonia and multi-organ death.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: Kusukela ngomhla ka-17 April 2020, kuye kwabikwa izigameko ezingaphezu kwezigidi ezingu-2.24 emazweni nasezindaweni ezingu-210, kwaphumela ekufeni kwabantu abangaphezu kuka-153,000.
en-mt: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Abantu abangaphezu kuka-568,000 baye balulama. Leli gciwane ngokuyinhloko lisakazeka phakathi kwabantu abathintanayo, ngokuvamile ngamaconsi amancanyana aphuma lapho ukhwehlela, uthimula, noma ukhuluma.
en-mt: More than 568,000 people have recovered. The virus is primarily spread between people who come in contact, usually through small droplets that come out when you cough, sneeze, or talk.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Nakuba la maconsi ephuma lapho uphefumula, ngokuvamile awela phansi noma ezintweni kunokuba abe amagciwane emabangeni amade.
en-mt: Although these droplets come out when you breathe, they usually fall on the ground or on objects rather than becoming germs over long distances.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Abantu bangase bangenwe igciwane nangokuthinta indawo enegciwane bese bezithinta amehlo, ikhala, noma umlomo.
en-mt: People can become infected by touching an infected area and touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: Leli gciwane lingaphila ezintweni amahora angaba ngu-72.
en-mt: This virus can live on objects for up to 72 hours.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: Lithathelana kakhulu phakathi nezinsuku ezintathu zokuqala ngemva kokuqala kwezimpawu zesifo, nakuba lingabhebhetheka ngaphambi kokuvela kwezimpawu zesifo nasezigabeni zakamuva zegciwane. Indlela evamile yokuxilonga yi-reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) ngeswabhu yamankanka.
en-mt: It is most contagious within the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although it can spread before symptoms appear and in the later stages of the virus. The most common diagnostic method is reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) with a cervical swab.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: Ukusetshenziswa kwamamaski kuyakhuthazwa kulabo abasola ukuthi banegciwane nabanakekeli babo.
en-mt: The use of masks is encouraged for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: Ukusikisela kokuba umphakathi wonkana usebenzise imaski kuyahluka, ezinye iziphathimandla zithi awangasetshenziswa, ezinye zithi awasetshenziswe, kanti ezinye ziyaphoqa ukuba asetshenziswe.
en-mt: Recommendations for the general public to use masks vary, some authorities say they can't be used, others say they shouldn't be used, and others force them to be used.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Njengamanje, awukho umgomo noma ukwelashwa okuqondile okulwa negciwane le-COVID-19.
en-mt: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific treatment against the COVID-19 virus.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: Ukudluliselwa kwegciwane kuye kwatholakala emazweni amaningi kuzo zonke izindawo eziyisithupha ze-WHO.
en-mt: Transmission has been detected in most countries in all six WHO regions.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Labo abangenwa igciwane bangase bangabi nazimpawu zesifo noma babe nezimpawu zesifo ezinjengezomkhuhlane njengemfiva, umkhuhlane, ukukhathala, nephika.
en-mt: Those who become infected may have no symptoms or have flu-like symptoms such as fever, chills, fatigue, and weakness.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: Izimpawu zesifo zesimo esiphuthumayo zibandakanya ubunzima bokuphefumula, ubuhlungu besifuba obuphikelelayo noma ingcindezi, ukudideka, ubunzima bokuvuka, nobuso nezindebe eziluhlazana; kukhuthazwa ukuthola usizo lukadokotela masinyane uma lezi zimpawu zesifo zibonakala.
en-mt: Symptoms of an emergency include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking up, and pale face and lips; it is recommended to seek medical attention immediately if these symptoms of the disease appear.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: Okungavamile, izimpawu ezithinta ukuphefumula ngenhla ezifana nokuthimula, amafinyila noma umphimbo obuhlungu zingase zibonakale.
en-mt: Rarely, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: Izimpawu zesifo emgudwini osuka emlonyeni uya ezinqeni njengesicanucanu, ukuhlanza nohudo ziye zabonakala ngamaphesenti ahlukahlukayo.
en-mt: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhea have been reported in varying percentages.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: Ezinye izigameko eChina zaqale zadala kuphela ukuqina kwesifuba nokushaya ngamandla kwenhliziyo.
en-mt: Some cases in China initially caused only chest tightness and palpitations.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: Kwezinye, isifo singadlondlobala sibe yinyumoniya, sibulale izitho eziningi, futhi sibulale.
en-mt: In some, the disease can progress to pneumonia, multiorgan involvement, and death.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: Lokhu kubizwa nangokuthi inkathi yokuvela kwezimpawu zesifo.
en-mt: This is also called the period of emergence of symptoms of the disease.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: Inkathi yokuvela kwezimpawu zesifo ye-COVID-19 ngokuvamile iba izinsuku ezinhlanu kuya kweziyisithupha kodwa ingasukela ezinsukwini ezimbili kuya kwezingu-14.
en-mt: The onset of symptoms of COVID-19 is usually five to six days but can range from two to 14 days.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: U-97.5% wabantu ababa nezimpawu zesifo uba nazo phakathi nezinsuku ezingu-11.5 bengenwe isifo. Imibiko ibonisa ukuthi akubona bonke abangenwa igciwane ababa nezimpawu zesifo.
en-mt: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms develop within 11.5 days of being infected. Reports indicate that not all those infected develop symptoms of the disease.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: Indima yalaba abangenazo izimpawu zesifo ekusidluliseleni kwabanye ayikaziwa ngokugcwele; nokho, ubufakazi bamanje busikisela ukuthi bangase babe negalelo ekubhebhethekeni kwegciwane.
en-mt: The role of those without symptoms in transmission is not fully understood; however, current evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the virus.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: Isibalo sabantu abangenwa igciwane abangabonisi izimpawu zesifo njengamanje asaziwa futhi sisacwaningwa, futhi i-Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) ibika ukuthi u-20% wabo bonke abangenwe igciwane ubulokhu ungenazimpawu zesifo ngesikhathi ulaliswe esibhedlela.
en-mt: The number of asymptomatic infected people is currently unknown and under study, and the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reports that 20% of all those infected were asymptomatic at the time of hospitalization.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: I-National Health Commission yaseChina yaqala ukubandakanya izigameko zabangenazimpawu zesifo ezibalweni zayo zansuku zonke ngomhla ka-1 April; kwabanegciwane abangu-166 ngalolo suku, abangu-130 (78%) babengenazimpawu zesifo lapho behlolwa.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily statistics on April 1; of the 166 infected that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic when tested.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: Kokubili isikhwehlela namathe kungaqukatha igciwane.
en-mt: Both sputum and saliva can contain the virus.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: Ukukhulumela phezulu kukhipha amaconsi amaningana kunokukhuluma okuvamile.
en-mt: Loud talking releases several drops than normal talking.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: Ucwaningo eSingapore luthole ukuthi ukukhwehlela ngaphandle kokumboza kungaholela emaconsini ahamba amamitha angaba ngu-4.5 (amafithi angu-15).
en-mt: A study in Singapore found that coughing without covering can result in droplets traveling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: Nakuba igciwane ngokuvamile lingadluliseleki emoyeni, i-National Academy of Science isikisele ukuthi lingadluliseleka ngokuhogelwa futhi iziqongeleli zomoya ezisemaphaseji ngaphandle kwamagumbi abantu zakhipha amasampula aphozithivu egciwane le-RNA.
en-mt: Although the virus is not usually airborne, the National Academy of Sciences has suggested that it can be transmitted by inhalation and air collectors in hallways outside people's rooms yielded positive samples for the virus's RNA.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Izinqubo ezithile zezokwelapha njengokufakwa kweshubhu ne-cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) zingabangela ukukhiqizwa kwezinhlayiya ukuba zikhishelwe emoyeni futhi kuphumele ekubhebhethekeni ngokuhogelwa.
en-mt: Certain medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) can cause the production of particles to be released into the air and result in inhalation.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: Nakuba kunokukhathazeka kokuthi lingabhebhetheka ngendle, lobu bungozi kucatshangwa ukuthi buncane. Igciwane lithelelana kakhulu lapho abantu benezimpawu zesifo; nakuba ukubhebhetheka kungenzeka ngaphambi kokubonakala kwezimpawu zesifo, ubungozi buncane.
en-mt: Although there is concern that it could spread through faeces, this risk is thought to be low. The virus is most contagious when people have symptoms; although spread may occur before symptoms appear, the risk is low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: I- European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) ithi nakuba ingakacaci ngokuphelele indlela okulula ngayo ukuba igciwane libhebhetheke, umuntu oyedwa ngokuvamile uthelela abantu ababili noma abathathu. Igciwane liyaphila amahora kuya ezinsukwini ezintweni.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says that although it is not entirely clear how easy it is for the virus to spread, one person usually infects two or three people. The virus lives for hours to days on objects.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: Ngokukhethekile, kwatholakala ukuthi igciwane liyaphila usuku olulodwa kukhadibhodi, izinsuku ezingaba zintathu kupulasitiki (i-polypropylene) nasensimbini (i-AISI 304), namahora angaba mane ethusini elingu-99%.
en-mt: Specifically, the virus was found to live for one day on cardboard, about three days on plastic (polypropylene) and steel (AISI 304), and about four hours on 99% copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: Nokho, lokhu, kuyahlukahluka kuye ngomswakama nezinga lokushisa.
en-mt: However, this varies depending on the humidity and temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: Insipho nayo ingasebenza uma isetshenziswe kahle; imikhiqizo yensipho iyalunciphisa ulwelwesi oluvikelayo lwamafutha egciwane, ilubulale, futhi iyalususa esikhunjeni nakwezinye izindawo.
en-mt: Soap can also work if used properly; soap products reduce the protective oil film of the virus, kill it, and remove it from the skin and other areas.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: Ezinye izinsipho, njenge-benzalkonium chloride ne-chlorhexidine gluconate (isibulali magciwane sezindawo zokuhlinza), azisebenzi kahle. Ocwaningweni lwaseHong Kong, amasampula amathe athathwa ezinsukwini ezimbili ngemva kokuqala ukulaliswa esibhedlela.
en-mt: Some soaps, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical site disinfectant), do not work well. In the Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken two days after the start of hospitalization.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: Ezigulini ezinhlanu kweziyisithupha, isampula lokuqala labonisa inani legciwane eliphakeme, futhi isiguli sesithupha sabonisa inani legciwane eliphakeme ngosuku lwesibili sihloliwe.
en-mt: In five of the six patients, the first sample showed a high viral load, and the sixth patient showed a high viral load on the second day of testing.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: I-severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) iyi-severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus embi kakhulu, eqala ngokukhishwa kubantu abathathu abanenyumoniya yaxhumeka ezifweni eziningi ezimbi kakhulu zokuphefumula eWuhan.
en-mt: The severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is the worst severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, which was first isolated from three people with pneumonia and has been linked to many severe respiratory diseases in Wuhan.
